author: {'steamid': '76561198042557351', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1447814388}
review:
[h1] Example of Early Access Hell... [/h1]

[b]What It Is:[/b]
A survival type game focused around exploring multiple islands.

[b]Gameplay:[/b]
You are dropped into a cold and unforgiving robot infested wasteland and tasked with finding some objects. It's about as bare-bones as it sounds.

[b]Difficulty:[/b]
Quite difficult, especially given the poor stealth mechanics which were never fully developed.

[b]Graphics:[/b]
Not good. This game didn't really look good when it came out, and it looks even worse now. There's cartoony graphics, and then there's this.

[b]Audio:[/b]
Actually passable. The robot sound effects aren't Gen Z quality or anything, but they have that cartoony hunter vibe about them as most of the game does.

[b]Replay Value:[/b]
I honestly didn't even finish it in the first place, so none.

[b]What I Like:[/b]
It was a great concept in its day, but it was never given the love or attention it needed to become a successful or entertaining title that stands on its own weight.

[b]What I Don't[/b]
Nearly everything, the enemies are not that interesting, stealth is buggy and bad, item spawns seem sporadic. Just from the moment of first playing this game I had issues with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203819592', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1380, 'last_played': 1558919613}
review:
Sir is a unique game that is difficult to fit in a single genre. It‚Äôs a mixture first person shooter, survival, and moderate horror. It does an excellent job of mixing in a rather quirky backdrop and a sly touch of humor as well.

At bottom it‚Äôs a pretty simple game. You teleport to a land full of robots bent on shooting you full of holes. You have to dig through abandoned houses for weapons, ammo, food, and the like, while dogging search parties looking for your skin. All the while you have to find missing pieces for your teleporter so you can get home again. 

It has a fun dynamic of hunter and hunted, since you can easily overpower a party with a few well placed shots. But it is easy to get in over your head and bleed to death if you aren‚Äôt mindful of how many enemies you‚Äôre engaging.

And this element of keeping things balanced is what gives Sir its synergy. You run faster than the robots, you have greater intelligence, and yet, it is oh so easy to become overconfident and get killed. That balancing on a knife‚Äôs edge keeps the game compelling through multiple playthroughs, even after the game‚Äôs elements have become familiar.

Additionally, while the graphics are sufficient, the devs clearly wanted to remove any obstacle to fast paced gameplay. The result is a refreshingly light shooter that allows you to move, engage, and disengage quickly. This helps to keep the game moving, as you rummage around like a hunted dog, looking for forbidden treats.

You can also play with friends, although the game was not designed with multiplayer as a main feature, so it can feel a little uneven at times when playing with others.

Overall a great experience. I give it 85/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198097033224', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1707679293}
review:
This game is...well, it gives me mixed feelings.
I love it, but it just induces a very surreal feeling upon me whenver I play it, it's like I zone out and can't even remember what I did 5 minutes ago, and no other game does that to me, it's strange.

This game is fun, and a bit challenging, I love it.
It gives you options to customize how you want your world to be, and delivers just that.
Packed with action and anticipation, with one bullet left in the rifle and a patrol of robots coming for you I highly suggest the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071843596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1558718624}
review:
CE JEUX A DU POTENTIEL !
Mais c'est tout, c'est pas tr√®s beau, pas √©vident √† utiliser, si vous √™tes mauvais en anglais, mes plus sinc√®res condol√©ances. 

Je pense que ce jeu peut devenir tr√®s bon si une refonte graphique est envisag√© ainsi qu'une refonte de la mise en place du jeux qui est pas √©vidente.

Ha... J'avais oubli√©... Ce jeu ne vous fera aucun cadeau. Il est gentil cependant et vous laisse sauvegarder quand vous voulez... Mais pass√© ce d√©tail... Vous √™tes constament pourchass√© pour une bande d'android qui vous vois a travers les murs et vous traque comme le dernier des criminels (ce dernier point n'est pas sp√©cialement n√©gatif).
Ajouter √† cela que vous dever g√©rer une barre de sant√© et de faim (un peu √† la don't starve) qui aura la facheuse habitude de descendre si vous n'avalez pas un roti toutes les 5 minutes. En ajoutant √† cela que les d√©gats ont des status (h√©moragies, empoisonnements...) qui vont vous pulv√©riser. En bref, le jeux est loin d'√™tre facile.

Il y a des choses a sauver cel√† dit, je vois bien la d√©marches qu'on eu les developpeurs de ce jeu. Et c'est tr√®s louable. Qui plus est le jeux est stable. 
Je vous recommande ce jeu si vous √™tes un amateur de jeu underground en phase de d√©veloppement qui relachera son plein potentiel en fin de d√©veloppement.
Si vous avez l'habitude des jeux au m√©caniques finis au petits oignons o√π il faut √™tre un peu strat√®ge et tout, a la limite, pourquoi pas.
Si par contre, vous aimez les jeux finis pleinement, amateurs de jeux o√π on vous explique clairement les choses et disposant d'un pointeur de qu√®tes, pass√©s votre chemin. Revenez plus tard peut etre, pour voir o√π en est le jeu mais je ne vous le conseille pas maintenant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004585919', 'num_games_owned': 1076, 'num_reviews': 283, 'playtime_forever': 5518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5144, 'last_played': 1569625319}
review: A rare gem. A game that is original in theme and craft yet the devs seriously did not know what they had. Seriouusly denied what they had. This is a great eerie game about being trapped on an island with british robots who are hunting you down like a fox hunt. You and others must collect things to escape...but the fun part is strategizing and ganging up on the robots. Sure it was loaded with issues especially the item drop rate and the fact that so many of the items were useless. But at its heart the coop vs robots game of it was so amazingly fun...and you could adjust the difficulty based on how many people were playing when you create each unique world. Pity the devs just wanted, nay demanded everyone play it as a multiplayer competitive game. They demanded that and ignored everyone's pleas to fix and adjust the game for coop. Their constant answert "we don't want people playing that way". Servers they had died then. Fewer people played due to lack of support. But if you can....round up anyone who as the game and play on your own server and it's so fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009474997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1072, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1546691216}
review:
The game seems very interesting and quite unique, the gameplay itself along with the mechanics is a deal maker or breaker, by this i mean this game will not be for everyone, chances are you will either love this game or you won't, this is just the general vibe the game gives off.

To be blunt, check out some gameplay videos first this game can be super fun if you can get into it, whether you choose to play solo or with friends, this should be your first step.

Now if you do decide to play the game: It was created quite beautifully with some great concepts in mind, no game is ever the same, whether you choose to play one of the several different map types or the same favorite one, each game experience is new and unique with the procedural map generation. 

The game delivers the feeling of being trapped on an island with nowhere to go quite beautifully, in fact they did a remarkable job here.
The entire landscape area is said to be a remembrance of actual British scenery, i having never been there myself can't speak for that, but what i can say is that the game really looks amazing, and beautiful as well, a lot of creative effort and detail went into creating some beautiful visuals for us.

The combat system was done just as properly, neatly worked out and balanced properly to truly deliver a fun experience to you the gamer. The survival aspect here plays off beautifully and really fun, running and hiding from the hunters truly was made fun and challenging here.


All in all a very decent game that is worth a shot if you give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999167949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1400787107}
review: The sense of mood and place in this game is terrific. It really does feel like being trapped on a rainy, windswept island off the coast of Britain. Everything is dirty and dingy and gross and you're scrabbling around in the mud while bizarre robots try to make you dead. Great stuff! Continually impressed by how specific and unusual this survival game is!

author: {'steamid': '76561198261743642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1691752195}
review: I really love this game, probably in my top 5 for indie games. This is a bit of a unique experience, and the developers should be very proud of this one. The scenery is amazingly beautiful, and really reminded me of the British country landscape, I totally did not find a gun (The combat system is actually very well done by the way) for quite some time but that was actually part of the fun! Trying to sprint across a field to some cover with robot hunters and their dogs chasing you is very fun! I would safely ignore any negative comments and pick this one up with confidence.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130362418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1544277224}
review:

Il est amusant, parfois stressant et m√™me si graphiqement c'est pas le top, c'est largement assez pr√©sentable.

Ce jeu ne vaut pas les 20‚Ç¨ pour lesquels il est propos√© pour le moment, je conseille d'attendre des soldes de 50%.

Et il a une dur√©e de vie TRES courte.

Je m'explique...

M√™me si c'est un jeu charmant, il aurait m√©rit√© plus de travail sur la dur√©e de vie. Le mode "histoire" est assez r√©p√©titif et sans rebond m√™me si il offre du challenge, le mode multijoueurs aurait m√©rit√© des fa√ßons de jouer alternatives ou au moins des caract√©ristiques ou achievments exposables que l'on garde apr√®s chaque parties (comme des lvls par exemple ou des skins)
Et finalement, il y a trop peu d'items diff√©rents et le fait de ne pas pouvoir √©√®llement entrer dans les maisons est frustrant.



Cependant, je ne peux pas attribuer une mauvaise note √† ce jeu vu qu'il m'a pas mal amus√©...

author: {'steamid': '76561198149635733', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1541537673}
review:
in the state that is in,is not worth the price

edit: just found out that this is the final version and holy shit is it a mess.
i like the concept of the game and the art style however in the state its in is really bad,for starters it drops you on the map not telling you what to do,how to play or what the objective is

in the end i found out the only objective is to bring overly large stones wich take up almost half of your inventory space just to bring them to a portal,after wich you go to the portal and start over again doing the same thing

on paper it dosnt sound that bad however the AI is such a bugy mess that lord knows how those robots even inslaved us in the first place,i played this game with a friend and tough the AI were pretty terrifing at the begining they lost all of their fear factor when they sudently just stoped moving,yes the AI were all stuck in place 5 minutes after we started the game and we didnt even notice this was a bugg until we were almost done with collectiing all portals.
And not to mention the second we got actual weapons and ammo for them we basacly could take on an army no problem

overall the AI is fun and uniqe IF you get them to work properly

wich brings me to the next problem with the game and that is the looting and the items in the game.

this is one thing i do not get,is one thing to add lootable items that dont do shit but is another to add items that are only usefull for killing yourself,becasue aparantly theres alot of em

starting off youll probably find alot of dead rats and rotten potatoes,youd think they can fill your hunger at the cost of health or have some general use but no the only purpase of those is to use them if you want to lose health and as far as i know they have no other purpase
and the inventory managment is anoyhing because you always need to add room for bigg ass  rocks wich take up almost half of your inventory space because why not right?
not to mention you cannot expand it or make chests or such for you to putt away your things for a bit no youll have to settle for what you have.

next up we have crafting wich dosnt exhist

finnaly we have the "stealth and survival" concept wich i say there is not much to stealth once you get a weapon and there is not much to survival if the only survival is "remember to eat and not die"

also keep in mind this is a game that costs 20 euros

overall id give it a 3/10 unfinished but still better than anything EA made in the past few years

author: {'steamid': '76561198065878227', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1542234070}
review:
SYABH is a wonderful little game, with a lot of abandoned potential. It's probably worth about ¬£10, not ¬£20, just due to how far through development the game feels. The movement/combat mechanics are a janky kind of polished, it's purely the content and replayability that lets this game down.

Multiplayer is good, the netcode is solid and doesn't often cause any issues, but there's not much to do beyond ferrying pieces to the centre. The pieces spawn in predictable circles on the island, and beyond setting an arbitrarily large number of pieces to be required, there's no option for starting difficulty (it scales the more pieces have been recovered) - And the scaling can be bypassed with a classic collect them all and dump them at once.

I'd recommend as a game to get in a sale, worth getting in your library for the occasional challenge with some friends!

review:
A nice little casual game to play if you don't feel like playing anything else.

Good:
- Fun to play
- Cheap and small to download
- Atmospheric
- Graphics are quite good for the size of the game
- Enemies are hard and Ammo is uncommon so you have to be stealthy.
- Its random and has starting classes so each game is different.
- Sir... You are always being hunted.

Bad:
- Can make you rage like hell
- A little glitchy at times

Gameplay: (Terrible)  (Very Bad)  (Bad)  (Okay)  (Good)  (Very Good)  (Amazing)

Graphics - Okay
Soundtrack - N/A
Atmosphere - Good
Controls -  Good
Overall Gameplay: Good

Difficulty - High
Replay Value - High
Worth - ¬£3 

Overall Rating: Really cheap and fun little game to mess around with. Wouldn't call it a horror but a great atmospheric survival game. Deffo worth a buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971316390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1536970907}
review:
In 1982 an automotive firm came up with a curious idea - a modular car. It was called the Capsula and was simply the lower-half of the vehicle with the upper half being modular so you could swap out the chassis so that the vehicles could be repurposed using the right equipment. A vehicle could be a people carrier with one chassis but then have it swapped out with a new one to make it a refrigirated courier van. The idea was interesting but when you looked into it further you had to wonder why someone would want to buy the Capsula plus all of the equipment to swap the chassis when it was easier to simply by two normal vehicles. Sir has the same issue, it has some novel ideas that simply don't pan out in the long run and lead to a rather broken experience.

First if all, the stealth system is very detailed but somewhat inconsistant at times. It uses a mixture of line of sight combined with how obsured you are by foliage you may be standing/sitting in, the amount of noise you are making as you move and also the ambient light level. What it trips over with is displaying how well hidden you are with the UI indicator and the AI at times will suddenly become very ignorant to your presense. There are times when the indicator says that you are completely invisible, but a robot wanders over and because it was looking in your direction it suddenly gains the ability to notice you. Yet they'll easily walk past you in this 'invisible' state if they happen to be looking elsewhere. Or the UI says that you're making noise by splashing around in water while a bot is 2m away, but it will act like you are not there because can't see you due to something breaking line of sight yet if you did that while hiding in a bush it would suddenly see you. As you play the game you do start to understand what causes you to be noticed  or not but in all fairness that is learned through trial and error and not due to the UI.

The next issue is the vitality system. Now, I can understand why a survival element may seem like a good idea at first in a stealth game, but when there is a finite amout of food in the game you suddenly end up with a hidden time limit for you to complete your tasks. The fact that the RNG for lootdrops makes this time limit completely random is also a big problem. Dying due to poor RNG rolls in a game like this really isn't a very good experience and for a stealth game where you need patience, it isn't great to have a clock-ticking down and forcing you to run everywhere you can.

Speaking of the loot itself, rather than searching building interiors you 'search' the doors of buildings. So they become like massive storage boxes. It seems very half-hearted and frankly it jars you from any immersion the game is trying to accomplish. They also contain vast amounts of useless items which makes me wonder why they felt the need to do that when the time could be better spent elsewhere. The buildings are also one of the only places you can get any items at all which creates a vicious cycle. You need food from buildings, but they are always guarded, you can use items as distractions to lure the guards away but these are also found in buildings. You do eventually find that you can deliberately approach the the bots to cause them give chase so you can swing around to the opposite end and loot the doors but this is both time consuming, risky and not always worth the effort due to the RNG loot rolls.

In terms of concept, I love the idea of retro-robots hunting humans down across the english moorlands. It is a very original settings but as the game progresses the novelty wears off and it becomes tedious to be creeping through woodlands and across fields in one gigantic fetch quest. If you compare this with a similar game like Monstrum, the length of Sir is what works against it. Monstrum is short but brutal, it's a game where the goal is so close yet so difficult and you just know you can beat it if you give it one more shot. But the end of Sir is so distant and the challenge so random that you start to lose interest, plus if you eat all of the food on the isles before you have collected all of the items you've created an unwinnable scenario.

Sir is an interesting concept but poorly executed and not something I can recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022113409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1536210139}
review:
[b]Quick Rundown[/b]
You are stranded among 5 islands full of robots that want to kill you. You must find 16 fragments of... something to save you. You sculk around looking for these fragments while also finding food, weapons, and distractions to help you. You may feel at first like you could gun the robots down, but you soon find this won't pan out in the long run...

[b]Thoughts[/b]
I've just started the game and I have to say I love the creepy atmosphere. There's no dramatic music or evil monologues to be found here; when the robots find you, they shoot. As things get more difficult the pace is pretty slow as you must approach everything with stealth, but with a bit of patience you do get to be crafty.

This is a good creepy survival/stealth/scavenger game to play in the dark. However, do NOT pay full price for it! I'd say it's worth about $5 from what I've seen thus far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009167953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1532215549}
review:
I was excited to finally try this one out but it wasn't for me. While survival games aren't my genre, I found it too difficult and vexing to stick with. I also found the game to be predictably malign in ways you can't easily avoid, like the spotter balloons that always make their way toward you, or the hunting parties that see your campfire a mile away. The game is just too difficult too early in too many annoying ways. 

Plot's threadbare and gives you no direction, the physics are irritating, and basically you're just gonna get negged all game. If you snag it, don't get it for full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961359548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1529099488}
review:
If the premise of this game sounds interesting or fun to you, I would definitely recommend going for it, but it would probably be wise to wait for a sale as I can't see you stretching your playtime very far past 10 hours unless you get completely addicted to it and try out all the starting classes. The overall idea of the game is executed beautifully; the robots that hunt you are both convincingly dangerous and comically British ("Good show!" shouts a robot as you flee his shotgun barrage). As you progress, additional and more difficult enemies will spawn, i.e. terrible little robot hunting dogs, and a few others that are quite clever, but I won't spoil. At first I thought the lack of ammo was a bother, but in fact they really want you to stealth around the islands instead of making a Rambo-esque stand against your pursuers. Still, despite the low ammo availability, the guns function quite well, the shooting is satisfying, and I enjoyed the vintage feel the weapons have (the shotgun is fuckin' beautiful to look at). The best mechanic in the game by far is the ability to draw the robots away using the many tricks at your disposal; easy examples being if you light a fire to cook, they see it for miles around and charge you, or if you find an alarm clock you can set it and flee, and when it goes off they will be drawn to it.

Overall, challenging and fun, creative and at least a little unique. Very well executed idea, even if slightly light on content. Runs very smoothly. You could say its just what it says on the tin!

EDIT: I did forget to mention the only downside, which will only matter to some players: there are no Steam achievements, so you will be playing this game purely for the fun of it without earning any internet bragging points. Certainly for most people this won't matter at all, but it is too bad, as if there were (for example) an achievement for beating the game with each different starting class, the total playtime in the game might be increased substantially.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026845235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1528603916}

What is needed is an immediately available map (you have to find one or get very lost as things all look the same. 2 hours in and still couldn't find it). And a way to kill off the robots easier. I'd explore for a good 20min...then get gang rushed at the slightest sighting and boom.....20min lost. That happened more than once. Sorry guys. Can't give a thumbs up.   :-(

author: {'steamid': '76561198176351713', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1528367733}
review:
This game has an unforgivably short amount of genuinely enjoyable gameplay. You load in, get slightly spooked by the robots, and then creep around an island for an odd hour or two, maybe collecting a weapon, a fair bit of stuff that you are garunteed to not use, as your vitality is never, and I mean NEVER, an issue in the slightest. You also grab 10 colourful rocks scattered around the island and put them into a less colourful rock, upon which you get treated to the not so colourful rock become all glowy, and then it just ends. The robots were unique and interesting, so I'll give it credit for that, but it doesn't mean that they were a threat; if they saw you, you would just run away. They were no more than an inconvenience.
Multiplayer was obviously thrown in at the last second; I played through with a friend, and it was, to be blunt, bad. You cannot give the other player(s) your items directly; you have to place them inside a building or barrel, so they can then pick them up from said bulding or barrel. If you were to die, your body would just disappear, along with all the items that you happened to have on you, so there was no chance for you or your friends to pick up the items. On top of that, you rarely found them, but why would you want to, anyway? That would just mean you could cover less ground as you got bored searching for those last few colourful rocks.
There is no way in hell that this is worth the price tag it's attached to, not even with the 50% dicount that was on when I got it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198815509380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1528336467}
review: This game is a little buggy when it comes to the mutipliplayer setting and the vitality seems to go down a bit fast. A few more animals like cows or horses would be good too. If it had a little more story on what happened to the people and why exactly the robots are hunting you it would be a bit better. For now I give it an 8/10 or 9/10. So sorry if I sound a bit salty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092710797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1528235395}
review:
The gameplay isn't enjoyable. The AI is too simple, you know exactly where the bots are going to move and their detection radius. The looting system is too simple and it feels very incomplete, going up to a door and looting the door doesn't make much sense and it's plain boring. You can obtain something important, like a gun, just by doing something as simple as opening the door of a house ( you don't enter the building, that's how you loot ).
 I spent almost one hour and a half looking for the missing teleportation crystals and came across almost nothing entertaining. There's only 4 (If I'm not mistaken ) weapons in the game and they are easy to obtain.
 Keeping your vitality up isn't a challenge, I've kept two bottles in my inventory and they kept me lasting for what felt like forever.
 I've tried raising the difficulty by increasing the spawn rates of enemies, but the gameplay never felt intense, it just felt like I was solving a boring puzzle.

   If I were to compare this with an analogy, I'd say playing this game is similar to eating a simple batch of cookies. The first 2-3 cookies taste pretty good, but as you keep eating the batch, it progressively tastes flavorless and all you feel is your mouth getting dry after every cookie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1152, 'num_reviews': 650, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1654141900}
review:
I could not connect with this game, and I am not sure who would like this game, instead. As much as I like what Big Robot is trying to do, I cannot recommend this game.

At first appearances, I thought it would be my type of game. Slowly exploring a beautiful computer generated landscape, while collecting survival gear, and avoiding scifi-style robots. Then, I realized that the gameplay is entirely built upon dealing with robots camping on your treasure. Rather than hiding from robots, you must confront them, with some of the crappiest tools.

You can distract them, but they will see you running behind them. You can shoot them, but they can out-gun you and move in groups. So, you end up dying over and over, which means running all the way from the last dreary savepoint. I am sure eventually you can master the technique required for distracting and crawling, but that whole process is irritating and not something that I enjoy learning. For this vital aspect of the game, the game does a pretty terrible job showing the game mechanics of detection.

Then, there's the terrain that initially looks great, but then you get trapped in your twentith hedgerow square. There's no jump in the game, so you have got to run along the hedgerow, looking for a gap, only to discover the only exit to the square is the gap where you entered it. I ran into these giant cul-de-sacs more often than not, especially at night, when I could hardly see anything.

It is almost like the designers said, "Let's make amazing generated landscape, populate it with some brilliant AI enemies, and then... something, something, something... we'll figure that out later." Sadly, that something - still missing - is the soul of the gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202456299', 'num_games_owned': 38, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1100, 'last_played': 1694656467}
review:
Great game, but not for $20.

I enjoy this game. I've played a few rounds, though I'd say the replay value diminishes quickly. True, the islands are randomly generated each time and you can adjust the number of robots and start with different sets of equipment, but the experience still remains about the same.

I'd highly recommend playing it, as it's a great experience and has some interesting mechanics... and it's one of those games where you'll have fond memories of the music and sound effects for the rest of your life... 

but get it on sale. Don't pay more than $5 for it. I got it for $2, and it's well worth that price. I'd say $5 is about right.

review:
Did you ever dream of running through a lush, but traditionally english, countryside whilst being relentlessly hunted by packs of pipe-smoking, tophat wearing, and all-round scary British robots? 


No, neither did I, but this one brilliant game if you did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034739619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1520547843}
review:
Sir YABH is a strange game. It took my attention with the unique graphic skyline that it shows, and I must admit, it's still a beautiful result to watch.

In opposite it lacks of gameplay. I'm not a survival lover but here the gameplay is very poor. You have to search for stones and take them to a monolith. Houses cannot be explored and provide a menu of unuseful objects. 
Stealth gameplay is also poor. You can crouch and throw bottles to elude enemies, but there is nothing more.
Survival is also poor. If you use a campfire in a few seconds you are surrounded by enemies and you can only run. Where? To the opposite direction.

For example there could be some npc that could sell something or say something or add some quests... But no. There are only stones and a monolith and enemies.

I , at this point, would have appreciated just a walking and eating sim. Just to see the skylines and the hurban industrialized amusing towns.

Poor of gameplay and a bit flat. Sorry guys, it's not enough for me.

Lord Hol Napult's experience: 4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198002880881', 'num_games_owned': 3511, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1525292601}
review:
Sir, You Are Being Hunted √® prima di tutto un gioco stealth. Le armi da fuoco ci sono, la scarsit√† di proiettili per le stesse pure, cos√¨ come √® presente anche la necessit√† di nutrirsi (pena una terribile fine fra stenti), rendendo l'aspetto survival molto importante. Ma il gioco punta tutto sullo stealth, tant'√® che a fine gioco il riepilogo della partita classificher√† le nostre prestazioni basandosi praticamente solo su quante volte siamo stati visti dai robot, nostri nemici agguerriti.
Lo scopo del gioco √® quello di recuperare 15 frammenti sparsi su 5 isole diverse, mentre un nutrito e disparato gruppo di robot ci daranno la caccia, proprio come se fossimo una povera volpe durante una battuta. Data la bassa quantit√† di munizioni che troveremo nella mappa, la tattica migliore sar√† sempre quella di optare per piccoli diversivi, come una bottiglia lanciata da dietro una siepe, attirare i nemici su tagliole piazzate ad hoc per metterli fuori combattimento e simili. Il gioco, grazie alla vena survival che lascia il giocatore spesso alle strette, ma anche grazie all'ambientazione piuttosto tetra, riesce a trasmettere sensazioni degne di un horror (ma proprio leggero eh, se sono riuscito a giocarlo io non avrete alcun problema a farlo voi, ve lo assicuro).
Il gameplay funziona bene. L'IA √® adatta allo scopo, pur seguendo dei pattern piuttosto semplici. Purtroppo il gioco risulta fin troppo facile, in particolare grazie ad alcune piccole strategie che non sveler√≤ per non rovinare il gioco a nessuno (nonostante le strategie adottate ho ottenuto il rango stealth pi√π basso sia chiaro, ma non ho pazienza con gli stealth e come vedevo un'apertura possibile mi lanciavo urlando con la doppietta in mano!).
Tecnicamente il gioco √® molto semplice, anzi anche troppo scialbo, soprattutto nel comparto texture, davvero troppo semplici. Anche il comparto sonoro non √® per niente memorabile.
Una partita mi √® durata circa 3 ore e mezzo, i mondi sono generati casualmente quindi sempre diversi (anche se poi alla fine le differenze sembrerebbero solo marginali e in 3 ore credo si sia visto gran parte del gioco).
Consiglio sicuramente il gioco agli amanti dello stealth e perch√© no ai simpatizzanti ma amanti dei survival. Se invece vi piace sparare rivolgetevi ad altro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038146007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1599555390}
review: It's an open world survival stealth game. It takes places in randomly generated worlds, so every time you play it will be different. It's pretty interesting, and gets pretty difficult as time goes on. Combat isn't something you want to use, and should generally be a last resort as ammo is scarce, and you'll be far outnumbered. You need to eat and drink to survive, and your goal is gather all of the pieces to escape the islands. It's a pretty fun concept, and due to it's randomly generated worlds, has a good amount of replay value each time you play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198104358473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1588161310}
review: guns are impossible to use. aiming is impossible, many times i've emptied an entire round of bullets into a robot from 2 inches away and somehow they all missed. on top of that, shooting gives absolutely no feedback making it impossible to tell if you hit or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100374904', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1522735375}
review:
Love the English? Love robots? Love hunting/shooting stuff? Love wondering around looking for stuff that does stuff that you don't understand because you were told to do so? If the answers to those questions were yes. Go ahead and buy this game! If the answer was no, go ahead and buy the game anyway because it's just that good! What's not to love about a game that makes you wander an island inhabited by british robots out for blood searching for fragments that you swear you left in this very barrel. Hmmm. What's that? Too many robots? Turn the spawn rates down! Too few robots? I'm sure a couple more ballons will be a great idea! Shoot the lot of them or sneak past them. Who cares! They are only robots, they don't feel pain! That screaming is a pre recorded message.

Honest opinion: Shit's scary until you learn you can kill it or at least run from it! Good game sure to waste a couple of hours. Just, don't try pulling an English accent unless you're English, ok?

author: {'steamid': '76561198818010890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1522781444}
review: Hilarious in every detail, yet creepy and breathtaking game. First few hours it felt repetative but then I thought of saving every now and then. And from that point the game became very interesting. It's not easy to get those parts and every time you have to think of different tactics and try new things. Sometimes it's just ok to slay a bunch of robots with an axe. And sometimes it's better to outwit them. The other day you just steal the part and run. The game has lots of humor beneath the gameplay, so it worth checking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317561961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1536285364}
review: This game is amazing. I played with 2 of my friends, and the experience was INSANE! The AI is actually very smart, the robots look sick, and the game is totally immersive. As you get closer to beating the game, the robots even seem to team up and converge on you. I like the quick looting system, and how the robots patrol the neighborhoods. All in all, a truly great game. I recommend buying it on sale, like my friends and I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971729024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1527120169}
review:
A great original concept and really fun game, especially now that it has mulitiplayer. You creep around randomly generated islands, being stalked by robots that are a hilarious pastiche of the British aristocracy on a fox hunt. The experience is actually genuinely scary too - particularly when you hear the electronic scream of a horse rider charging you!
Multiplayer makes a game like this eminently more playable, as you compete or co-operate with friends to find the teleporter pieces and escape the hunt together.
All in all a really good indie game buy, especially when you get it cheaply on a sale. It's great to see such an unusual and original concept executed so well!

author: {'steamid': '76561198360933754', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1567865794}

author: {'steamid': '76561198425783748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1622241264}
review: Okay fisrt of all I LOVE this game idea wise you (Male OR Female) are being hunted by various types of robots across an england type landscape finding around 16 peices of a portal to go back home and not dying to gunshot wounds robot dogs and starvation. In that regard 10/10. Asthetic wise I like going back to these days as i remember as a kid these graphics being good (and the fact most the robots wear tophats and moustaches is great!) I would play this game for an hour and still love the graphics although a graphic change mode or something would be great I would rate the asthetic 9/10. And now game play I sometimes enjoy the forced stealth at times but I would like the ability (albiet somewhat difficult) to gun my way through a town as you can only enjoy creeping around for so long. Longevity dies QUICK as your basicly on a 7 hour fetch quest with next to no diversity as if you start shooting your either VERY desprate or a dead man. I rate game play a 5/10. For as much as i love this game get it when its on sale its not worth around 22 dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043512270', 'num_games_owned': 803, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1522189021}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990082639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1687781251}
review: Dripping with atmosphere, this game reminds me of some of the stranger parts of my childhood in the English countryside. Don't ask. Definitely a classic in its own right. Go watch the film 'Inbred'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078437944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 785, 'last_played': 1521509572}
review:
This is a thumbs up for me. I do understand its not for everyone though and I agree on some of the reasons mentioned in the other reviews. The negative points that are brought up are that the game was abandonned and doesnt feel finished, and I do agree on both in a way. For example the multiplayer doesnt work (last time I tried it) and walking around on the islands feels like theres a lot of space you pass through espcially at the shores of the islands, where theres nothing happening in those areas. So to get some action you have to be in the more central regions of the islands but the more empty ones on the outskirts still exist. On the other hand that gives you a place to run which otherwise you might not have had. But it still feels a bit big and empty in those areas. 
Another point is that variety of ways you play the game such as for example the amount of items there are and the ones you actually use (there are some that dont have a use as far as I understood) doesnt feel too big, once you kind of get the hang of the game. I, at least, will probably always use similar strategies since there arent that many different ones to chose from. However i could be wrong about that.

Now but since this is a positive review lets get to the good parts:
I really like the feeling the game gives you of really being hunted and that you have to be careful while really looking for your way to escape. The brittish setting is also nice. Walking around on the islands really made me feel like I was in England and it was a beautiful nature if you can call it that. Also a changing day and night rhythm makes things more interesting and beautiful (surise i.e.).
Another bonus that I discovered just now again, after completing the game, is that each time you start a new game, a new map will be generated and I suppose the objects you're looking for in game will also be distributed differently accross the islands (yes thers more than one island that you can travel between, wich is another bonus point imo). So that all gives it a replayability value since no game will be exactly like another. Additionally to this you can also choose the type of biome that islands will have, and you can adjust how many of which robot types will be hunting you how quickly, so you can determine the difficulty of the game. That gives you the opportunity to for example play a casual runthrough, or make it a really hard achallenge that you'll have to spend hours on to complete.

So to sum it up there are negative parts to it and I am sad too that many people dont like to play it anymore because of those, but its also a game that is entertaining to play and that you  can spend a few relaxed (or not so relaxed once youre spotted or you have to sneak up close to a danger) hours with. I do recommend you buy it on sale since the normal price is too high, but I myself really just enjoyed the game even though it has its problems and/or flaws too. Hence I'm giving a thumbs up and am happy about everyone else who tries the game and likes it too :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998332251', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1452799530}
review:
Sir, You Are Being Hunted is a nice stealth indie game.
The gameplay is a great experience with no two playthoughs being the same due to the randomly generated map.
It's nice to see a game that encourages you to play stealthy and will reward you for doing so. You can't just run around without a care in the world.

Awesome game, Maybe not worth the ¬£15 but definitely give it ago if you see it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198294298500', 'num_games_owned': 1000, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1488652388}
review: It may be worth it for very cheap if you want to try something new for  an afternoon, but there really isn't much to do. The appeal to it comes from how weak you are in comparison with the robots. It can get tense, but it is generally a slow paced game. The graphics aren't that good, and I still had to turn down some of its settings. It doesn't have anything to it to make you want to come back to it again. You can't enter buildings. Also, the game is dead, and development long ceased. From what I can find, modding isn't much of an option either, and nothing really exists out there apart from a couple config tweaks to make baddies more aggressive/sensative to your presence.

review: A truly marvelous game! The limited resources and the unfairly strong opponent makes it a real challenge to get so much as two of the required items. The game is definitely in my top ten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096742168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1483932180}
review:
This is one wild ride. A commedy survival horror game. I know it might not look like much, but I will always have a soft spot for this little gem. If you really like Moty Python type stuff where everything just seems a bit off this game will entertain you. If you like stealth action games where you have to take down enemies without being discovered lest you be hunted by adversaries with fantastic aim en masse, this game will entertain you. Resource/inventory management is a must. This game will allow you to make huge mistakes and laugh in your face as you fail. It is not a casual type experience by any means, so if you are looking for a puts around good feels game stick to something like Snake Pass for now. This game will punish your mistakes, and it only gets harder as you get deeper into a run. Day after day growing harder until you win or die.

It's not the theme that is scary in this survival horror, it's the feeling of having a match weighed heavily in the NPC's favor. It's a vulerability you have no matter how skilled you are, and it keeps you thinking about a better way to complete your objectives. It keeps you working to stay alive. Mocking you all the while.

Get it. Play it. Love it. Bring a friend for multiplayer.



PS: Procedurally generated! Part of what I love in gaming. It keeps the plays fresh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155589975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1678639512}
review:
Great game. Started a playthrough a couple years back but never finished it. Decided to try it again when I was dusting up my Steam library. The game is pretty easy at first, but the difficulty really spikes in the later portions of the game.

The levels are random generated, and the system is pretty good. 
The gameplay is alright, the story interesting and the AI is really good. 
The stealth system is set up perfectly and combined with the amazing AI it makes for some really tense moments.
IMO the asking price is a bit on the high side, wait for sale.

If you like tea, whiskey, silly robots and 8+ hours worth of banter, buy it. Jolly good show!

review: The variety in environments and robots is fun as is the gradually ramping up of tension as more (and harder) stuff starts hunting you. The gameplay is a little repetative and whilst the environments aren't huge if you get unlucky with the RNG you may find you are playing a much harder or easier game than you expected. Nevertheless, with enough options that you can create the maps you want to play in (with the enemies you want to outwit) and make it as easy or hard as you like this seems like nice little game. I imagine multiplayer with a bunch of friends would be pretty good too but I didn't really feel like trying it with a bunch of randoms.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995290433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1521569398}
review:
CHECKLIST TEST

Do you:

1) ...like playing a game where the audio really means something? Aka you couldn't play it properly on mute?

2) ...have a fetish for tweed?

3) ...have the patience for a slow, challenging stealth game?

4) ...feel fine with muddy graphics?

5) ...enjoy a quirky sense of humour?

If you're nodding in agreement to at least 3 of the above, buy it on sale - I'd say no more than 10e.

Bottom line: Definately not a perfect game, but still got it's charms none the less. Cred to the devs for trying out something new, imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999633968', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1515103978}
review:
Game is fantastic. Brilliant concept and extremely fun. Only problem is that the multiplayer, unless done with friends, is a complete ****-fest with idiots who think it's PUBG. First multiplayer game, I spent 25 minutes alive. Got lucky and managed to get a shotgun, map, and even the scanner to help the team out. Figured I'd hunt down as many pieces as I could. I ended up finding and returning 6 of the 10 pieces, myself. All 5x5. So I made several trips. On the map, I marked the last 2, so I could run and grab them at the last stone activation. Ended up being chased down by a player (not robot) and gunned down as I grabbed the last piece. When I typed, "Why?" in the chat, I was pleasantly given a: "Cuz suk my dick". Then decided that it was fine and I would just head to the portal and we would win, end of game, right? NOPE. Got to the portal after bolting through an army of different types of robots and dogs and was again, gunned down by my own players. After I again, respawned, it occured to me that the server was being modded/hacked anyways. I suddenly had an inventory opened up full of rifle ammo and a rifle with some rags (for bandages) and a bunch of booze (for vitality) and when I attempted to equip the rifle, it kept cancelling it out on me. Like I wasn't meant to equip the weapon. Meaning the game was preventing me from using a "not-quite-earned" weapon.

As I said, Singleplayer - 10/10.
Multiplayer (With friends) - could be fun
Multiplayer (Servers with random people) - ****ing joke. -100/10

review:
Un juego donde debes pensar, si, pensar... tal vez por ello es que hay algunos que se aburren. Si te haces el Rambo durar√°s poco, en segundos tendras cazadores, perros de caza, el due√±o del campo... y eso si lograste derribar a alguno de tus enemigos (lo m√°s seguro es que te dejen agonizando a la primera). 
Es altamente recomendable, y es de esos juegos que tienes que sentirte inmerso en el mundo y pensar como si realmente estuvieses ah√≠.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965916889', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1480, 'last_played': 1601388734}
review: Open world, exploration, stealth survival. You're entirely on your own, left to your wits and courage on a set of islands with the sole purpose of finding a set number of parts and bringing them back to a central location. The only catch is that there are upper class, gentlemanny, english robots who will shoot you at first glance. Fun, fun, fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052254829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1670290320}
review:
I will say it is intoxicating gameplay, and it's a nice variation outta of the survival genre (Meaning there are no deamons, ghosts, etc) and you still feel scared sometimes, not being able to go one way or another because there are many robotos everywhere and you are out of ammo. 

Ammo is scarce, you take few hits, large environments, reasonably strong enemies (Except those long legged sons of bitches) I'd say the balance is more than amazing when it comes to gameplay. Though I wish I found a friggin riffle in my first playthrough...
Around 12 slots used for amo and never found one...

author: {'steamid': '76561198371546899', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1512596357}
review: mto bom

author: {'steamid': '76561198066991153', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1635184111}
review:
Te trezesti pe o insula unde esti vanat de roboti, ca sa evadezi de pe acea insula trebuie sa faci rost de anumite piese dintr-o masinarie, poti sa gasesti arme prin jur dar destul de rar, cred ce cele mai valoroase sunt armele albe fiindca alea nu raman fara gloante. Are si un mod multiplayer unde esti pe aceeasi insula cu alti jucatori si va bateti intre voi sau cooperati sa evadati de pe insula. Jocul are o tematica britanica de prin anii 1800, vocea care comunica cu tine ti se adreseaza cu sir sau madame iar armele cat si stilul vestimentar ar robotilor par a fii din acea epoca.

Esti ca un Bear Grills numai ca vanat de roboti, gasesti putine arme prin jurul tau, cel mai bine mi s-a parut sa am o arma alba fiindca nu ramai niciodata fara gloante, cu cat pui mai multe pietre in masinarie cu atat echipele de cautare ale robotilor devin mai puternice.

Placut doar ai rabare sa-l joci stealth, nu prea merege in stil rambo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071215451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1624632730}
review: A true gentleman's game about sport hunting. The thrill o chase! Dogs sniffing for prey. Hunters teamwork and ambushes. A help from spotter zappeline of course! Tea and biscuits. Ah, whiskey after a cold long day. Fresh meals from fresh game. Great landscape. Truly a great adventure! Well there is one thing. Small... problem of sorst. You ARE a PREY and NOT A HUNTER! So be carefull... Sir, You Are Being Hunted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072867795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1678577665}
review: Don't listen to the negative reviews on this game, most of them are a result of people wanting this game to cater to their normal gaming experience in this genre.  This game was designed with a very unique perspective.  Granted this game isn't for everyone.  But if you enjoy survival or stealth games you'll like this game.  Many say that this game is too easy or too difficult, but you have the choice to set up the enemy generation.  At max difficulty this game is next to impossible.  It's refreshing to encounter a new style of game and Sir you are Being Hunted delivered for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987041987', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1994, 'last_played': 1496120693}
review:
This game's a hoot in the multiplayer. I'll occasionally reinstall it, host a server with PvP damage cranked up to the max, and hunt down players that join.

The reactions I get are always priceless, but it's all in good fun. Whatever I paid for it when the game first came out, it's since been worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991503265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1511569900}
review:
Disappointing. Billed as a humorous, "relentlessly British" survival stealth game that boasts "infinite replayability," but I found the amount of content sorely lacking in all of those areas:

[list]
[*] Humor: Unless you find the visual of robots dressed in British hunting garb inherantly funny, there's no humor here (and even if you do, that's at best a one note joke that must lose its appeal by the 4th or 5th robot you see). (I played in multiplayer, and this did not seem to include the promised "disembodied voice of Walters, your butler," at all. I'm guessing maybe that's where the humor is supposed to come from. If that's the case, maybe there is some humor, but it's a single-player-only feature? If so, that's disappointing for those of us who purchased to take advantage of the recently announced co-op mode.)
[*] Britishness: I suppose the clothing style and a few of the food items (haggis, tea, etc.) are British themed, but beyond that there was no personality to this game whatsoever, British or otherwise. (Again, at least not in multiplayer.)
[*] Survival: The survival mechanics begin and end with looting food from containers and then eating it. Some of the containers look like barrels, others look like houses, but you can't enter any of the buildings, so they're effectively just giant barrels. There's no hunting, crafting, or anything else you might find in other survival games.
[*] Stealth: Since the game puts you on a wide open island where you can see enemies coming from a ways off, and enemies are scattered few and far between, the stealth manages to be both too easy ‚Äì just keep your distance from enemies ‚Äì and too hard ‚Äî if an enemy does get close enough to see you, there's often nowhere to hide. To be fair, this seems like the most developed aspect of the game, with a visibility meter that adjusts based on your movement speed, and various patches of grass and bushes that supposedly decrease your visibility. I even had one close call that provided a brief moment of tension. There's some potential there, but the game's overall design just doesn't do enough to leverage the stealth mechanics. If there had been a lot more moments of tension and a lot fewer of running aimlessly through the woods trying to find something to do, my recommendation might be different.
[*] Replayability: The 90 minutes plus that I played seemed to be enough to see everything the game has to offer and then get bored with it. I've read there are actually a few other biomes and robot types that I didn't get to see, but if the gameplay is still fundamentally the same in those areas, I don't feel like I really missed anything. Don't get me wrong, there were some fun moments, but replay value? I don't think so. The game is so repetitive that I was bored before I even played through it once.
[/list]

Basically, the game consists of wandering aimlessly around a mostly empty island, easily keeping your distance from enemies while looting containers. When you happen to stumble across a "mysterious fragment," you take it back to a centrally located special stone to trade it in for a point. Repeat until you have enough points to win. That's it. That's literally the entire game.

I bought it for 75% off on a Black Friday sale, and this game still didn't offer enough gameplay to justify what I paid for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083673560', 'num_games_owned': 1404, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1512625915}
review:
I was playing this with a few friends are we were so close to finishing the teleporter and had the few final pieces in our inventory. The time came to put them in the teleporter and rushed there, what we didn't expect though is that the AI had set up an ambush for us. The hot air balloon was just above the teleporter so I shot out the light, and suddenly robots began emerging from the underbrush and villages surrounding the teleporter. The robots were waiting in all the places we might've approached the teleporter from, and were now closing in on us.

My friend and I were murdered, but amazed by the clearly intelligent AI.

Some you can't kill, some lay traps, fly, shoot pheasants, shoot each other, guard towns, have dogs, ride horses, etc.  Beats Killing Floor's zeds by a wide margin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198434607663', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1662297431}
review:
[h1] Jolly good show!	[/h1]

Imagine a fox during a hunting season. Yes, [i] a fox[/i]. Think of its desperate efforts to flee the hunters and their agile hounds. Focus on the smell of tobacco and gun powder of the hunters. Try to imagine it shivering in the middle of a wheat field, surrounded by loaded shotguns and british laughter.
In this game, you [i] are[/i] the fox. You are the prey, running for cover as the day turns into night, and warm sunshine into cold rain. You are the underdog, scavenging for anything edible and trying to find a way to escape the nightmare. Try not to do anything stupid on your way home, you can only save your progress on certain points.

 Also including:
- rusty trombone
- tea
- biscuits
- whole lot of british humour
- [strike]story[/strike]
- ???
- robots

author: {'steamid': '76561198163490287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1638680049}
review:
I do say this game is quite magnificent. I might even say its the bees knees! The chaps who developed this have a right old classic on their hands. A lovely bit of sport hiding from the dasterly robots while I peacefully sip my tea, although I must give credit, their tweeds are much more in style then even mine! I simply must ask where they have gotten such clothing but I cannot seem to fine a reputable shop anywhere. I also for the life of me could not find fresh biscuits anywhere! The shame of having to eat meat with tea as if I was a savage! 

It is most unfortunate that this game isn't kept up to date, I dare say that the robots within could use a bit of a fixing with the amount of shots they miss. Although I do find it quite off putting that the population of the many surrounding towns have up and left! I do hope they don't mind if I knick a few of their belongings, there is a group of robots chasing me after all! Its almost as if I am being hunted!

After this is all over Jeeves said he had put the kettle on so I hope for the tea to be ready by the time I get back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065963027', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1508780643}
review:
All in all a good game, and I'm happy with the time that I did play it, but I can't say that I would want to play any more. Cool idea, having everything procedurally generated, and there are some creepy enemies, but there's just not much to the game. Find the teleporter shards, take them to the stone, escape. Though I did only play one full round, i can't see it changing much between playthroughs.

Buy it on sale if you want to try it out, definitely worth looking into, but I don't think it's worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034635786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1508811199}
review:
To preface my opinion, please be aware that I've only put just short of an hour into the game. 
That being said, it was a terribly boring hour at that. The game seems very bare-bones, and randomly generated to very poor effect. 

I spent about 40 minutes walking around from one objective to the next. The objective being to pick up items and return them to the starting position. 
The other 10-15 minutes I spent in observation that the enemies in this game provide no notable threat whatsoever. They at no point were near my objectives, and were so sparsely present near lootable buildings, they were easily avoided while I could collect an inventory full of loot, such that I needed not be near enemies at all after a few minutes into the game. Nor did I find any intrigue in engaging with them, since your tactical options for doing so are limited and uninteresting.

If you find slenderman envigorating, it's possible you may enjoy this experience; If you do not, then you will likely find this game boring and easy, as I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987872190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1602269524}
review:
I'm confused by a lot of the negative reviews.  Many say the game is abandoned or incomplete.  Some say they bought years ago and feel ripped off because it is no longer being updated.  I only recently bought the game and 5.5 hours in, I feel like I'm playing a fully developed, complete, and polished game.  More than all that, it is also a rather fun and engaging game.  

I didn't follow devolpment, so maybe I'm unaware of unfulfilled promises from the developer, but I can't really imagine what people feel is missing from the game.   I suppose more robot types could be added, but I've already encountered quiete a few different ones, all with different traits and behaviors.  I don't think I've even encountered all of them.  I find their hunting AI to be very good.  They actually hunt you the way an Englishman would hunt a fox.  When they spot me or I draw attention to myself, they put ot a pretty decent dragnet in the area and I can't always get away.

I find the proceedural generation of the islands to be solid.  A convincing, English countryside with lots of interesting terrain to consider.  Over time you come to know the various copses of trees that you use to travel through.  some reviews complain about how easy it is to get lost while simultaneously complaining about lack of depts--but a lot of the games depth comes from navigating the land, finding your way around, using the landmarks such as those weird towers to orient yourself, and finding good routs to get around without getting detected.

Lot of complaints about not being able to go in buildings.  Honestly, the game would get very tedious if you had to go in each building and click on some drawers and cabinets to find a few scraps of food.   That level of looting gameplay is just not necesarry in a game that isn't about loot.  If you could go into the buildings, then the robots would have to go into buildings to look for you, taking them out of their field searches--which is the whole point of this game--being hunted across English Country side like a fox.  If you could go into the buildings, you would spend tons of time hiding inside of buildings, which would also get boring.  Its fun to sneak around the alleys and buildings of the hamlets--I'm glad I don't have to spend 15 minutes going in and searching 6 buildings everytime I encounter a hamlet.

Sound is great.   The robots make all these computer bleeps and boops that sound like something out of an creepy, 70s sci-fi movie.  Its actually kind of ominous, when youre hiding behind a building, and a robot is coming your way.  You get nervous as those bleeeps and bloops get louder, and you know he's probably going to come around that corner at any minute.  The game is actually very atmospheric, with an ominous sense of dread haning over everything that I wasn't at all expecting from this game when I bought it.  I thought it was just going to be a funny tone (and it is funny) but its also a little dark and ominous.  

At 5.5 hours, so far, I love it.  I feel like I'm really just now digging into the meat of the game--learning the lay of the land, developing competence at foraging, finding meteorites, and avoiding/destroying robots.   It has lots of content, and the proceeduring generation of everything ensures that new, unthought of tactical situations appear all the time.  Last time I played, I got spotted and ended up finding myself between two hunting parties with a variety of robot types.  I vanished into a ditch in a copse of trees, and the robots were hunting all around, but hadn't found me.  Then that balloon started drifting my way.  I have watched that thing hunt the island for hours, but this time, it actually happened to come my way.  All I could do was lay still and hope the search beam didn;t hit me.  When it hit me, the alarm went off, my hiding place was revealed, and I had to make a quick decision about how to flee. 

These are the elements of good gameplay.

I got it on sale for $5.  I guess $20 is a little steep, but this is a high-quality, complete, and fun game.  I just don't think $20 is really that far off the mark.  If you see it for $15 or less, I suggest you go for it, and if you like stealth/survival/proceedurally generated games, I say go for it at $20

I'm giving this one a solid thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960393604', 'num_games_owned': 2753, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1507746999}
review:
There's not a whole lot of content to the game, but the theme is solid enough.  It does have some flaws, you can get locked in a bit of a cycle of needing a way to deal with the robots, but they're guarding all the places to find items to help deal with them.  There's also some issues with map generation, such as putting a dock to another island inside a lake instead of at the shore.  And the AI can be a bit exploitable.

However, the basic idea of the game is fun, and the theme works well.  You do have a few ways to deal with situations, but stealth and distractions are usually the best method.  I would recommend this game, but probably only on sale.  It is a small game, with a good theme.  Don't expect a huge amount of replay value or play time, but there's enough for some quick entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970596981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 17164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1700, 'last_played': 1706570136}
review:
An enjoyable title for what is is.  The stealth gameplay is good and sufficiently challenging.  I'm fine with the graphics and art design.   Stylistic and it reminds me of old school games.  

The random level generator provides fresh levels, but the gameplay can become repetitive over time.  Another plus the story is sufficiently mysterious and interesting.  I hope to see more games like this, but the full price is a bit high.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993276289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1506738517}
review:
Wow, where do I begin...

Graphics: this game REALLY ugly. Not that it needs to be super realistic, but doesn't even have a style. Lots of grey, blurred textures. You can barely distinguish anything. Your weapon just floats in the middle with no hand holding it. The bad texture and modeling makes this even worse. Characters doesn't even look human.

Gameplay: absurdly BORING. A big map full of NOTHING. Oh, but you can LOOT HOUSES! Why bother making into a proper building, where you can enter, explore and hide? Oh no, this is just too much! You die, lose everything and there you go, in a random spot on the map, completely lost, your friends nowhere to be seen. Did I mention on how easy do you get lost? Since everything blends into the scenario, The gunplay is so awful that it makes the difficult seem completely artificial.

Audio: no ambience, no music. Just some noises from robots from far away, sometimes near, that's it. By this point, I don't even care anymore.

So yeah, don't buy. I got this in a bundle because of a proper game and gave it a try. Turns out it isn't worthy even on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013020354', 'num_games_owned': 918, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1469504638}
