review:
What a Great indy Stealth game! best I've played for a long time! 10/10
[ if you like the original stealth game 'thief' you'll probably like this]
great atmosphere. Very well thought out ... 
Sneek around trying to find food to stay alive - while trying to track down and steal
15 artifacts to exit the island - thats it. simple you say ?... give it a try.
don't expect a typical shooter ... it's definetly more stealth than fighting.
If you want action it's there, but you will have to shoot and run like hell.
Took me 9 hours ish to complete ... and I'm sure I'll give a replay in the near future.
I picked my copy up for ¬£5 in the steam sale ... so definetly one to add to your wishlist
for when it's next on offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971472889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1099, 'last_played': 1663902615}
review: This is a great game, but it gives a very specific type of gaming experience that only certain gamers will enjoy. Most often the smartest course of action is to simply walk/sneak away from a fight. When you do have to fight the game rewards you for being clever. It's a combination of stealth and survival/looting. If you like stealth games, and immersion then I would recommend it when it's on discount. If you have a copy of Thief Gold, or Thief 2 installed on your system right now, then there is a high probability that you will enjoy this game immensily, and it's worth the full price. If you are looking for flashy graphics, or a more traditional type of fps experience then look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037750776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1460844513}
review:
It's as if "The Most Dangerous Game" by Richard Connell was brought to life - but with deadly british robots! The entire time you are constantly on edge, trying to survive and make tactical choices throughout the entire game (day and night cycles are equally nerve-inducing). All the enemies, items, weapons and encounters are unique, and the game gets harder as you progress towards successfully escaping the five inter-connected islands. Stealth is key to this game. If you do not like taking your time or being stealthy, then this game WILL punish you; you will find yourself running away from enemies or dying most of the time as a result. 

Despite a few personal issues I had with the lighting and game mechanics (mainly item usage like the alarm clock or bottle), I believe this game was a quick, fun, and overall entertaining way to spend an evening. I was able to finish a complete game in a single day that lasted a little over three hours. Just know that those were very worthwhile hours though. To me, there is not too much immediate replay value, but I can see myself coming back to this game some future afternoon. There is also a multiplayer option outside of the single-player gameplay, but I cannot comment on this since I have yet to have friends willing to play it with me. 

Basically, I know this game won't be for everyone, but it is a solid stealth-based game. Therefore, pick it up during a steam sale when you get the chance! Also, due to its relatively short single player, if you do not like it within the first hour or so, you can always get your money back from Steam. I hope this review helps you in making your decision to buy this game or not, but if you have any questions about the game before you purchase it, feel free to add me or leave a comment here about it. 

Oh yeah, my final rating (as people find this to be almost a necessity): 
This game gets 7 crumpets split between 10 bad sets of teeth. "Cheers."

author: {'steamid': '76561197967971065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1460607430}
review:
What an interesting concept, it's a bloody shame it was wasted here. 
Buggy and with the visual quality of a game 10 years ago; this game looks like it held too tightly onto the popularity of survival games coattail's that it tore free and tumbled into a muddy ditch.  Or just ran out of budget.  Since in many cases it just looks unfinished, many would mistaken it for an early access title.  Normally I can be open minded and even allow a game with defective AI if the game is fun, but when it is centered around avoiding and using tools on it to no effect, that is when you lose me.  But the one thing I can't forgive ever is when you have a massive open world game with stealth mechanics and make the walk/run/crouch speed abyssmal.  Not only is it a cheap way to add artifical suspense and game time, its a quick way for me to find myself largely bored and starving to death in an open field.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080228162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1506743806}
review: I can't even begin to explain the horror, the paranoia, and the fear you will experience playing this game. For the price, I don't think I've ever played anything else that's as enthralling and immersive. Nothing gets the adrenaline surging like split-second decisions.. "Do I have enough time to turn and look behind me or will I get shot?" "Do I dare enter a safe-looking village to find food and risk stumbling on a group of hunters?" The amount of strategy, stealth, and problem solving required by this game is overwhelming at first, but it's not an impossible challenge. I highly recommend starting with multiplayer so you've got a friend to back you up when things get tough. If I could recommend this game more than once, I gladly would.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025458386', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1401895752}
review: Despite being several hours of immense fun, this game seems to have started as a joke and have made bold to be large and detailed, but as of now, it still does not seem intricate and deep enough to cost 20 ‚Ç¨. Games that do not take themselves very seriously can be pretty well directed, but this one... suffered from indie complacency. There is still much hard work to do to make this little gem well-polished and fine-faceted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107403955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1598129989}
review:
Haven't even touched the single player game yet, just ran some multiplayer with a friend. Wow. You have no idea what you are truly getting into until you're there. This game is funny, ridiculous, and stressing all at the same time.

I spent the first part gathering up a whole bunch of gear and not finding the the robots, only to have all the gear lost to my frantic unpracticed shooting when I was finally being run down my robots. We scrambled trying to gather up the stones to win, eventually learning how to properly coordinate and got better at not being owned by robots (ie hiding).

And then came the unintended shenanigans. Working my way to the stone with one of the pieces, approaching a building to hide next to, I hear my friend being spotted and shot at. Having no weapons but an objective piece, there was nothing I could do for the poor doomed soul. I resumed my approach to the building and just before getting there, my friend runs right across my path, and I knew then, that things were just about to get real. Ya, the robots chasing him got to stumble across me so now I was the one desperately running. After circling the building a few times and a few failed hiding attempts, I settled into a new spot as one of the robots rounded the corner in pursuit. For an agonizing nerve-wrecking minute or two I waiting in terror as the robot continued to search for me and kept creeping closer to my incredibly flimsy hiding spot next to the building. After what felt like an eternity, he decided to resume patrol, and wandered off, leaving me, somehow not dead.

This game kicked off with a great start for me, and I can't wait to try the single player mode. The graphics aren't the greatest but that shouldn't discourage you, and the graphics they do have are charming and fitting for the mood of absurd comical terror.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099718029', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1460344693}
review: This game has brought some fun and pain

author: {'steamid': '76561197999546422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1446942615}
review:
I think this game is too rough to really be considered a final product; to me, it seems more like it belongs in the late stages of early-access.  Honestly, I don't think this is trash or anything, but I can't recommend it, especially at full price.

I think this is an OK game, but it definitely isn't worth $20.  Additionally, it still feels very rough but the last update was in Oct 2015 (it's now Apr 2016) and the version is 1.0+, so I don't know if the dev is planning to do much more with it.  If you're playing this single player, I can't imagine you getting more than 3 hours of quality gaming out of it (I probably got around 1.5 hours myself before I got bored of it).  The multiplayer is a bit clunky to set up and once you've got a game going, I guess it could be good if you have like 4 or 5 people in it, but when you have 2 or 3 I personally didn't find it added much.

Overall, it's a decent game that needs polish, but I don't think it'll ever get it.  $20 for this is just absurd though, even with all the necessary polish I'd say $15 is the max I could ever recommend this for.  In its current state, if you're ok with a rough game that will probably remain so, I'd recommend picking it up at around $7, maybe $10 if you have 4 or 5 friends who are also going to get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972244201', 'num_games_owned': 625, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1630781787}
review:
I picked up this game during early access, and for some reason it didn't click with me at the time. I found it too punishing, and all that creeping around was painfully slow. 

But after watching a couple of Richspeed's charming SYABH YouTube videos (check out Ep 13), it was clear I'd been playing all wrong, and far too timidly! I should have been running around and only stealthing while bots are near. Also, the hunting rifle is powerful and satisfying, so it's worth scavenging around for one.

I suspect the devs have done some tuning since my first go at it, and now the gameplay just feels right.  Plus, having the single-player option to start with a rifle (as the Officer) made a huge difference.

I've also played a few co-op multi-player sessions with friends and I'm here to report it's a ton of fun. The art direction and gameplay are both top-notch, so we found it a very satisfying experience. And the networking was solid, no issues there.

If you enjoy the stealth and combat in Skyrim, Sir You Are Being Hunted will probably appeal to you as well. I recommend this game.

Edit: worded things better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058137958', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1457496811}
review:
Sir, You Are Being Hunted is an atmospheric open world survival game with a personality of its own. Its use of silence and stealth leaves the player in a constant state of paranoia. But its for this same reason why SYABH is overall a dull game with very little variety to keep you engaged.

Positives:
+ Amusing dialogue and humor
+ Excellent atmosphere that keeps the player on edge
+ Excellent world generator that allows some customization

Neutral:
* Subpar graphics, but what you'd expect from an indie game
* Okay variety in items to collect

Negative:
- Unfortunately very dull half of the time. There aren't enough enemies, locations, and objects to collect to keep the suspense going,

As a huge fan of both stealth games and survival games, I really wanted to enjoy SYABH. But in its current state, I can't get myself to recommend it. There's a point where too much suspense leaks into monotony. I personally prefer The Long Dark, another survival game with more variety in locations and collectibles.

Spawned at a bridge. Walked 10 seconds and got killed by a robot dog.

Respawned at another bridge. Got spotted by robots with rifles and ran into a trap and got killed by robots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095325123', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1492471162}
review:
[b] Picture the scene	[/b]

Your 'friend' is running at you with a shotgun yelling that he wants to molest you with lead when the hill you where running up is infested with death robots that yell at you "Sir, you are being hunted" in a posh English voice. They don't pay any attention to your friend, they just chase you down the hill where you get stuck in a bear trap, an evil robot dog comes and tears your face to peices whilst your friend finally molests you with a shotgun before getting caught in the same bear trap as me which was inactive and closed..... Never playing again, lost many brain cells that day.

HJKDSDFJKHSAFAL/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198058801893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1424554864}
review:
Nein, dieses Spiel ist nicht perfekt. Technisch hat es noch viel Raum nach oben, und in puncto Stealth-Gameplay erfindet es das Rad in keiner Hinsicht neu. Warum empfehle ich es trotzdem nachdr√ºcklicher als alle anderen vergleichbaren Spiele?

Zum einen erschafft SYABH mit einfachen Mitteln ein wunderbar stimmungsvolles, absichtlich √ºberzeichnetes Abbild der englischen Landschaft. Die prozedural generierten Spielwelten mit ihren regnerischen Feldern, versmogten Industriegebieten und deprimierenden D√∂rfern sind ungemein atmosph√§risch und passen gut zum Spielgef√ºhl.
Zum anderen nimmt sich das Spiel erfrischend wenig ernst. Die blechernen Gentlemen, die den Spieler jagen, klopfen trockene Spr√ºche, und die Texte sind mit einer Prise englischen Humor geschrieben.

Eins muss ich trotzdem kritisieren: Der Titel "Sir, you are being hunted" ist eigentlich irref√ºhrend, da nur wenige Roboter dem Spieler aktiv nachstellen. Die meisten von ihnen bewachen lediglich wichtige Positionen, die der Spieler somit nacheinander abklappern kann. Ein echtes Gef√ºhl des Gejagtwerdens kommt so nicht auf - schade, aber vielleicht war die Umsetzung technisch nicht anders m√∂glich.

Alles in allem m√∂chte ich dieses Spiel dem geneigten Leser w√§rmstens empfehlen. *Tee trink* *Monokel zurechtr√ºck*

author: {'steamid': '76561198022657551', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1455399678}
review:
I had much fun playing this. The first time we played this, me and 2 of my friends basically went around with guns pretending we were american revolutionary soldiers. We took down many of the robot's numbers. The only thing that stopped us was a swarm of sudden robots attacking us. In the confusion, 2 of us died. A while after that, we finally got all the pieces.

Guess what i did.

I teleported while my friend was pointed the other way. He was not happy.

Anyways, to the real review!

This game is fantastic. Robots hunt you down with guns while you try to survive off of rats and cat food from their own houses. But, you can fight back with various weaponry, including muskets, dynamite, and the trusty axe. To escape the island of robots, you have to find pieces to a teleporter, which only takes pieces occasionally. Said pieces are scattered around the island, in small craters, with smoke coming from their location. Once you have enough pieces, you can teleport out. But, only one will make it out. Keep that in mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083485985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1440172079}
review: Its a fun and thrilling game at first, but it is a hard game to play to completion because of all the different islands and having to collect the parts on each islands. It feels like no matter how hard I try those darn robots win in the end! It will keep you entertained for at least 4 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069472971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1486429377}
review:
A very unique first person survival game. For me, this game is so close to being a very good game, but I feel it falls short just a little.

Pros
- Its hard ( As a survival game should be )
- The shooting and moving and such works perfectly
- The Old Movie aesthetic is awesome
- The atmosphere in this game is intense and you feel like your always on your toes and worried.
- Its Multiplayer

Cons
- A lot of useless items
- Not much enemy variety
- The guns are basic and uninteresting
- The way you beat the game isn't fun. ( You look for rocks the entire time )

I'd recommend it on a sale, or if you love survival games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143597617', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1455596324}
review:
Sir, You Are Being Hunted is a game that takes place in an alternate reality in Britain where British robots hunt humans for sport. There are a variety of robots, such as robots on robot horses, robots with rifles, robots with blunderbusses, scarecrows that warn other robots, robot hunting dogs, and a giant hot air balloon that will attract robots to your location if you are spotted. With only having a rag to stop bleeding and a bottle of alcohol for vitality, stealth becomes a vital role in the game until you find enough guns and ammo and other weapons, traps, and distraction items to combat the robots, and even then is a huge role in staying alive. Even though sneaking through the map from town to town getting loot, avoiding robots, running from robots, and occasionaly attacking a robot for its loot is fun for a while, this game does lose its fun rather quickly. Because you cannot punch or kick in this game, having a weapon is crucial to defending yourself from the ever-present threat of being attacked by a robot. Typically a game goes like this: 
1. Spawn, get to the nearest town, and loot it, possibly finding a weapon or two
2. Go looking for a piece of the teleporter (you win the game by returning all the pieces of a teleporter to a place called the stones) and possibly grab it if it is unguarded
3. Return one or two pieces of the teleporter and then get killed by robots
4. Repeat this process a couple of times. No problem, right? theres always some loot to be found, right? WRONG!
5. Get to the point where all the loot that will actually help you is gone, except the occasional food or bottle that can be found in some place that you somehow skipped when you looted a town
6. At this point, there will probably be a lot of robots, as more spawn as you return more pieces of the teleporter.
7. Get stuck in an endless cycle of trying to find an ungaurded teleporter piece, then try to get it and run to the stones, but get shot 90% of the time
8. Repeat 7 until you win
Overall, its pretty fun, but loses its fun after a while of having no weapons and just being forced to run from every robot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038364525', 'num_games_owned': 977, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1541467531}

author: {'steamid': '76561198256627439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1646625583}
review:
Man this game is awesome. It's always a random map, so remember to save. The map can take at least 4 minuites to render but it's worth the wait. You are constantly put to the test as you pit your wits and willingness to survive against the creepiest machinces I have ever been hunted by in a game. There are ways to distract them, you can beat them, but it takes practice, tactics and patience.

And remember, eat regulary. You're going to need it. Tally ho, wot wot and all that herang. Enjoy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050306372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1456184006}
review:
This is a long overdue video game version of The Most Dangerous Game. In other words, it's awesome. It's a solid survival stealth game without burdensome crafting or resource gathering. 

Things I would like to see as the game develops: 

1. different modes for multiplayer - something that requires teammates to complete
2. voice chatting for multiplayer
3. more trap-type devices
4. stealth kills
5. headshots
6. FASTER CRAWLING

Worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993734296', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1451312629}
review:
Hardly impressed by this product. Only thing SYABH has going for it is British countryside aesthetics and the game hardly uses it to  its potential: environment is very dull and there is barely any atmosphere or lingo in flavor text, all you see is typical north England housing and robots wearing top hats(yet speaking in very broad accent using common terms). 
Another completely misused asset in this game is procedural generation: supposedly it creates parts of the world from a seed, but the only difference it ever has is in occasional building, that you can only push button on to receive loot, looks different, but even with that 90% of the world is the identical tall grass and copypasted trees.
Enemy AI is lackluster as well and for a game that bases itself on the premise of stealth it falls on its face.  
UI is functional but that is all that can be said for it, no flavor, no stylistic impression, just a grid with objects on it. 
Finally the survival aspect is non-existant, and while I can appreaciate a game that doesn't want to put a dozen idiotic parameters that you ahve to monitor constantly like other representatives of the genre, boiling everything down to two parameters one of which is your HP is just lazy and feels pointless.
Another good point this game is capable of striking is the weaponry feel, shotguns have a nice punch to them, but even that gets spoiled when you realize every single firearm has the same sound and hitting an enemy with it results in metal clinking anyway.
Not exactly a horrid unplayable mess, but for the life of me I can't recommend it even to people whose eyes light up every time they hear Yorkshire accent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993517615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1455472250}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116183456', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1429, 'last_played': 1646147745}
review:
First of all i have to say this:

when i first saw this game, i didn't really like it (i just saw a trombone and how a plyere lured something to them and decied to check this game out) but when i gave it a try, i realized one thing, this is a phenomenally good game:
- it has a uniquie story.
- Rarely in game history, play not as a hunter, but as a prey.
- Weapons are secondary in this game (i beat appox 60% of it without even finding a gun)
- Enemy has a very interesting AI (they look around the last place they saw you, always stick together, lay traps, guard sertain areas, can be distracted for a short time, will investigate noises)
- loot system is very interesting.
- You can hunt animals and roast the (of course fire will attrackt every enemy in the vicinity)
- Some coments are just hillarious.
- Five unique styles of islands (that you can choose)
- Stealth is balanced and it is the only way of winning the game as the ammo is quite a rare treat.
- Design of the robots is just awesome.
- Save system is quite rare, that adds to the thrill.
- Graphics are not amazing, but sound system is awesome+ startled animals ma help giving away the hunters' location.
- Starting calsses with different items on start (i personally advise "cook" because the game is harder that way and more thrilling)
- Four weapons (blunderbuss, rifle,shotgun, revolver) that are quite rare themselves, each with unique charecteristics and ammo types+plus carried by different robots.
- Tentacles!!!! For lovers of Hentai anime. (I personally call them "Hentai tentacles")
- Desent multiplayer, but most of the serves are pasworded (just so you know)
- A lot of loot, food, junk, strange items.
- Ratings and adjustable number of enemies on each island.
- interesting objective with a spark of a challenge.

To sum up, Sir you are being hunted is a greatand stable game, that can be both enjoyed alone and with friends. Defenitely advise bying it and telling your friend (Pluss ask the developers to make like a snow island, where snow storms roam around blinding you and enemies, would be awesome!) and if you are reading this, thank you for paying atteniton to my small text, i hope it will help.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151344088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1455090499}
review:
This game is great for the small amount of time I played it. Yes, the graphics arent that amazing but that has never stopped a game from being fun. Sir, You Are Being Hunted has alot of potential to be a great game. The game still feels like its unfinished and could use alot more depth or story line. The games looting system is weird, all the house's doors are chests, having about two doors on every house.  You can not go in any building or structure, everything is boarded up. You get used to it quickly though and forget they're houses. Yet, it is NOT WORTH THE 19.99$. I got it for 3.99. So I couldnt be disappointed in the game no matter how bad. The game is still fun and is a blast with friends. It is worth getting if its on sale. It has hours of gameplay and could be alot of fun but, after a while it can get repetitive.
3.5/5 Get it with friends!

author: {'steamid': '76561198150392881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1527274164}
review:
Sir, You Are Being Played! - Und das mit Sicherheit nicht nur einmal!

Durchgeknallte Roboter auf Hasenjagd im Inselland, gepaart mit knallharter R√§tsel-Stealth-Shooter-Action und a lot of britishness. Ein Survivalspiel zum schmunzeln und zum lieben. (Man ist der Hase.^^)

Nach etwa 7h das erste Mal, mit der ersten von mehreren Startklassen des Charakters, "durchgespielt", hier aber auch nicht wirklich alles erkundet und gesehen.
Man startet auf einer von 5 Inseln und ist von blutr√ºnstigen, aber sehr britischen Robotern umgeben, welche Jagd auf Menschen, und manchmal auch auf sich selbst machen. Um der ganzen Misere zu entfliehen, muss man alle Teile eines magischen Steins wiederbeschaffen und sie zusammentragen. Hier liegt aber auch schon der Hase (oder Mensch) im Pfeffer, denn diese sind Zahlreich und gut von den (nicht ganz so) rostigen Kollegen bewacht, auf allen 5 Inseln, welche bei jedem Spiel wieder komplett neu und zufallsgeneriert erstellt werden, verstreut und das Inventar ist so knapp bemessen, dass man mit Sicherheit mehrmals laufen muss.
Ein kurzweiliger und lustiger Spielspa√ü, mit liebevollen Details, lustigen M√∂glichkeiten, britschem Humor, verschiedenen Gegner- und Spielerarten und einem genialen Soundtrack im Abspann, f√ºr den es sich alleine schon lohnt, es mehrmals zu spielen! 
Multiplayer gibts auch noch. Alles in Allem ein solides und packendes Game mit Wiederspielwert.
Spielempfehlung! =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198042783058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 3202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2174, 'last_played': 1682265893}
review:
Britain-inspired stealth-action horror-comedy. Not words I would use often.

Unfortunately loses some of its horror elements as you get better, because part of the horror is not knowing what an enemy does.

Blast robots whilst having some tea and biscuits.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216109017', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1597264826}
review:
In Sir, you play as a british man, where everything is british, from the items, to your characters, even the damn robots! A very good survival game, but i do wish it was either $10 to $15. This game is very good and in an overall rating, i rate it a 8/10, now lets look at the pros and cons.

 Pro's

Everythings British
It's multiplayer
It has a different feel that most
You can change what robots are enabled and not
You can change what area is what
You can change what difficulty the robots are at
Classes!
Something different than any other survival
Small storyline
I believe you can finish the game
(There is more small things!)

 Con's

I don't believe its worth the $20, should be $15 to $10. (Don't let that discourage you, and thats my opinion.)
Robots are a bit op
A bit hard to set up
When you fall in water, you have to find a shore to get out, even then a kraken is gonna murder you.
You cannot defend yourself until you get a gun, not sure if there is melee.
No shelter building. (I believe.)
(More small things.)

 Overall, this game is great and you should buy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198122739457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1582689544}
review:
A game suited for all the sirs and madams that want a good bit of stealthy action in their games.
You could go full Rambo and go into massive firefights with the enemy robots, or stick to a slower, calmer and more stealthy way of playing.


Pros:
The game is extremely atmospheric and can downright make the player jump at every noise they hear.

The Robots have some pretty good AI and will be relentless in later points of any given game.

I haven't had trouble with the Multiplayer and it is very enjoyable when playing with someone else (talking to them via a voice chatting app or program is recommended).


Cons:

Graphics aren't out-of-this world in quality (This is a minor detail, overlook this if you don't care about visuals).

The Wisps aren't explained at all and will easily confuse new players. Wisps send you to pieces of The Device.

I have heard that the new Multiplayer is a little iffy, so that may be something to steer clear of (at time of writing).

author: {'steamid': '76561197970837919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1453332999}
review: Mildly funny, simplistic, shallow game with badly outdated graphics and poor movement controls. Its only saving grace seems to be the dose of English humor (that I was looking forward to) which unfortunately wears of in a matter of minutes. author: {'steamid': '76561197975599804', 'num_games_owned': 1465, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1455177275}
review:
Sir, You Are Being Hunted (SYABH) is conceptually and thematically interesting: a first-person sneaker with randomly generated levels filled with killer robots who look the part of british gentlemen. (except for being robots and the homicidal intent part).  

The core gameplay loop is pretty solid, though not entirely perfect.  Stealth games rely on controlling the tension between the calm and chaos, and there are some rough edges in the loop.  As with many stealth games, audio cues and enemy animations play a significant role in determining the state of the enemy AI.  As such, some audio cues and animations were somewhat ambiguous, or seemed ambiguous.  For instance, robots in a heightened awareness who are facing away from you will nevertheless spot you immediately if your visibiility was above some unknown threshold.  Such behavior limits some strategies that were seemingly designed by the developers (i.e. throw a bottle, walk behind them); or perhaps the developers coded these behaviors so that these strategies would not be too effective?  While such AI behavior does detract from the immersiveness, it does artificially add to the tension, which feels cheap.

Also, sometimes robots would get into firefights among themselves; it's unclear what causes this, which is a shame.  One of the greatest feelings in any game, stealth or otherwise, is using the game systems to cause your enemies to wipe each other out.  Since the game makes these conditions opaque, you have no way of causing such firefights.    

Another complaint I had with the game was the UI.  It could have been streamlined a lot more.  For instance, while rooting a building, there's no option to take all useful items or discard all useless items, only the option to take everything.  Or on a map, I can only place three markers.  

SYABH is also certainly nice on the eyes.  During the moments when I wasn't chased by these robots, I found myself admiring the idyllic countryside.  Although this game doesn't have the bells and whistles in graphics as the latest AAAA titles, I was nevertheless impressed by the beautiful environments (which only required low system requirements!)  The character models were likewise exceptional, evoking charm and characteristics of british archtypes.  

Overall, I would highly recommend this game if you like stealth games, like killing homicidal robots, and/or are an anglophile.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972584572', 'num_games_owned': 1620, 'num_reviews': 384, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1453015769}
review:
Time until completion - About 5 hours

Sir you are being hunted is a pretty unique game. You play in a randomly generated world that consists of 5 islands. The objective is simply to obtain all the "artifact fragments" on each island. There are about 9 on the main (Middle) island and 3-4 on each small island. In doing so, you have to avoid robot hunters, their robot dogs, and other enemies, as well as eat.  

The game focuses mainly on exploration and stealth. It is very unique and works - for the most part.


PROS:
- Randomly generated levels where you can set the parameters. So lots of replay value.
- Stealth works well. Even if you are spotted, it is very possible to run away and recover.
- Lots of items and loot.  Use what suits your fancy.

Cons:
- While there IS a map (you have to find it) and the game DOES tell you how many artifacts are left on each island, it doesnt do a great job at documenting what you have searched. I wish it had some sort of map painting feature where i could color the map to mark off things.
- The fragments are in random locations (which is fine) and marked by (white) smoke and (usually) 2 robots. Still, most of your time is spent literally wandering in circles looking for them. This brings me back to the map suggestion. This isnt necessarily bad thing, but some people might find it offputting.

review:
Great game! A valid alternative if you dont like zombies, walking deads and other creepy stuffs like those ones, but you still would like to get into a really cool survival game. If you're looking for great graphic, you wont get that here but I can promise english countryside looks just perfect enough. You'll have to fight, you'll have to run, you'll have to hide yourself and manage what you found around (if you were lucky enough to find something to eat). 
Now I think i am going to take a little break from it, then restarting on a harder level!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067049143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1480833135}
review:
I wish we could rate games like YELP on here.  This is hands down a 5 star game.  The price is unbeatable, particularly when a Steam Sale comes around, but it's totally worth getting it at full price.  The story mode is great and I HATE playing games over again and again, but this one is like... like Arcade Survivor.  You just want to keep popping quarters into a cabinet everytime you die (that's making me sound old, isn't it?  Well google it you millenial brats, it'll make sense).

Seriously though, pip pip and cheerio to the team that put this game together.  I was never a big multiplayer fan, but even THAT draws me in!    

ONE Complaint:  In the story mode, there's these GIANT BEAST THINGS accompanyed by little 'short bus robots' (that's what they seem like anyhow).  They're not in the multiplayer :(

Three Suggestions: First, I'd like to see those Giants and Short Bus Robots (and maybe even some larger / MORE gigantic ones) added for multiplayer as options to pepper the game with. 

Second,  I know the game is about stealth over confrontation, but maybe ONE giant big bad that enough bullets can take down?  How crazy is it to tackle a giant robot while other robots, scarecrows, and dogs are messing with you at the same time?  THAT. CRAZY.

Finally: Capture the flag TEAM mode?  I've noticed going into multiplayer it's everyone for themsleves / only one person can leave.  Can you guys create a team mode, or even a Team vs Team mode, where all members of your team need to be 'checked in' to The Stones before you can leave?  THAT would be epic.  Especially if it's 3 on 3 with cowboy corral showdowns at the stones and lootable bodies.

Those are crazy suggestions though.  Really though, you CANNOT go wrong with this game.  Multiplayer, solo...whatever...it's a total joy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091959655', 'num_games_owned': 1347, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 80484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2018, 'last_played': 1570556117}
review:
[h1]Sir, i'm afraid to tell you this, but it seems that you're being hunted.
[i]*Read it with british voice*[/i][/h1]

[b]This it's not like other games of its genre, i mean, in other games you escape from zombies, aliens and even robots, but what about british robots ?[/b]

[u]Sir, You are being hunted[/u], is an indie stealth sandbox, in which after you (for a strange reason) create a time machine you got teleported to a twisted dimension in which english robots control the earth, as the new supreme race they will not rest until eliminate the humanity. 
[b]The hunting season has begun.[/b]

The objective here it's collect some kind of magical stones and retrieve it to a monolith to return home, not an easy task. 

[b]About gameplay mechanics, Sir, You are being hunted gives to you the option of generate your own world in which you will be chased, mountain landscapes, rocky highlands, a woodland, etc, [i]just choose your grave.[/i][/b]

[b]Something that i loved is the great variety of enemies, you will never be bored of this, trust me, this game has [u]since the classic weak enemies up to a big badass robot.[/u][/b]

[i]The background sound can be boring sometimes if you aren't being chased, but when you're in trouble music does its work and make those situations a great experience.[/i]

Graphically looks a bit odd but at the same time marvelous.

[b]This game definetily sounds like a great challenge and it is due the weird save system,[/b] the save point it's a boat and it's too far from the objective, if you don't put enough attention and you die you will have to begin again from your boat losing your progress, and yes you can save it as many times as you want, but with a big map, will you walk 5 mins each time you want to save ?

[h1]With tea and biscuits this game will make you hate a bit more the english robots (or even the poeple).[/h1]

[b]But the question is ... Did your head will be with the others in the smokestack or you will live to fight another day ?[/b]

10 / 10

If you found this review helpful you can find out more at our [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog#curation]Completing the Backlog's Curator page.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198036539426', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1452305460}
review: Fuck

author: {'steamid': '76561198031474038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1452276281}
review:
This is definitely a FPS that is for those with an acquired taste for this kind of game.

There are a lot of good concepts in the game. A randomy generated world, an interesting survival-esque style of gameplay, and an odd setting in general to keep you on your toes.

However, the gameplay feels sluggish. Also, limited inventory space is something that is seldom fun in any game: but it's even less so when your main objective markers (that are literally scattered around the world) have to be carried back to the center of the world so often due to small inventory space. It's backtracking that artifically increases the length and difficulty of the game.

It's not a bad game. And depending on your tastes, you may end up liking it a lot. But it's certinly not a game that can appeal to the masses.

5/10 "Mediocre"

author: {'steamid': '76561198154683860', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1645656313}
review:
Short version: this game is fantastic.

Long version: this game is a survival extreme game that takes the term "survival of the fittest" and replaces it with "survival of the fanciest". This game could be compared to DayZ or a game of the sort, but I believe it was done better. The game follows a simple yet complex survival algoritham. All items you obtain can be used in one way or another, and sometimes that use is not stated, and experimentation becomes more and more important as the game throws more and more variables at you. The game starts off simple enough: don't die, do a thing with some rocks. But as you get deeper and deeper in and the longer you take, the more complex the game becomes, forcing you to be creative, skillful, strategic, and quick-minded as you take on the growing complexity of the opponent, be it the environment or the other players in the multi-player. Really that in itself is good enough to make an amazing survival game, but it does not stop there! It gets even more amazing as you realize that the developers put enough time and work into the game to make sure there are no cheap wins or losses. The game is well balanced, and this is done by disabling water escape, punishing you for running from opponents, punishing you for assaulting opponents in the open (as opposed to assassinating them or ambushing them), and forcing you to reset... over... over... and over. The difficulty is sufficient to keep you on your toes but not harsh enough to make you give up completely. And because of the aforementioned lack of cheap deaths, you can learn something from every play through, and get a little better each time. Overall, a terrific game, and I'd even go so far as to say it should be the standard for all survival multi-players. Great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007752732', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1452109569}
review: Si no te gusta el sistema de solo puedes guardar en un punto as√≠ que tienes que estar yendo y viniendo todo el rato a determinados puntos, este no es tu juego. Por lo dem√°s buen concepto de vuelta de tuerca al t√≠pico "sobrevive con lo que encuentres".

author: {'steamid': '76561198244954800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1480089843}
review: This game isn't easy, at least not to me (I find it pretty nerve-wracking), so I'd recommend it mainly if you're looking for a challenge and/or you thrive under pressure. You're basically forced to keep moving all the time, because your vitality goes down constantly like you're a ticking bomb, and once your vitality hits zero your health is sapped away right then and there. In other words, you can and will drop dead just by standing and doing nothing. There are a lot of useless items to be found, and I made the mistake of eating a rat, thinking that it would restore a tiny amount of vitality, but I suffered for it. Aside from the robots on foot, there are also hot air balloons, hunting dogs... To top it all off, you can only save at the standing stones or the boat, and only if you're not bleeding or starving. All in all, it's not what I imagined the game might be like from watching the trailer. But I could easily see it being very fun and engaging for people who like games where they feel pressured, so I wouldn't not recommend it, because as far as I'm concerned it does successfully create a good atmosphere where you do feel like you're being hunted. Still, I wouldn't really recommend it for the more anxious people out there. (And I haven't tried out the multiplayer, so I can't comment on that.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198033311048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1502207684}
review:
Ich finde dieses Spiel von der Atmosph√§re her sehr sch√∂n und spannend.

Die verschiedenen Inseltypen haben alle ihre eigene Stimmung. Wenn dann auch noch der Tag/Nachtwechsel dazukommt, wundersch√∂n.

Leider bin ich wohl nicht so der Schleicher. Allzu viele Fragmente habe ich noch lange nicht gefunden - und ich bin schon 9 Mal oder so gestorben - weil ich es immer noch nicht lassen kann, um die Roboter konsequent einen Bogen zu machen. 
Aber wer nicht h√∂ren will muss f√ºhlen - oder am letzten Speicherpunkt wieder starten. ;o)

Wahrscheinlich finden einige die beiden Speicherm√∂glichkeiten nicht genug, da nur an Booten und am Steinkreis gespeichert werden kann. Doch deswegen w√§re es halt besser, sich durchzuschleichen und nicht mit jedem einzelnem Roboter anzulegen.

Ich habe bis jetzt 5 verschieden Robotertypen gesehen + den Patrouillenballon, habe aber noch keine Ahnung, was der einzelne Robotertyp f√ºr sich macht. Von den J√§gern und dem Hund mal abgesehen.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198060139959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1506645195}
review:
Just started playing the game and am already terrified/hysterically laughing from it.
The game really knows how to balance all three aspects, from stealth to brute force to just plain traps and diversions. I played and tried all three types and found that even though the game centers around the idea of stealth, you can go pretty brute as well. It balances all the great aspects of a stealth survival including the occasional terror (those damn patrol squads just come out of no where sometimes) and atmosphere (which is really well established early on, and even more established with the new enemies and their arrivals). Though I really haven't played as much, I have played enough, though not seriously, to witness enough of the gameplay and controls and important aspects to say it is an amazing game worth the buy. I intend to play much more in time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084234468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1450381711}
review: I highly recommend this game for anyone looking for something in the joint survival genre. The game has a lot of potential, and even though it's not fully complete (in multiplayer, for example, you all work together to deposit teleporter fragments, but the person who deposits the last one 'wins'.) No matter if everyone on the squad has weapons, the game will still be challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040989106', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1445298147}
review:
Une petite pr√©cision avant de r√©ellement commencer cette critique : ce jeu n‚Äôest pas fondamentalement mauvais. Je ne l‚Äôaime simplement pas. J‚Äôestime que cette l√©g√®re nuance est assez importante pour √™tre mentionn√©e.

J‚Äô√©tais curieux de voir ce que ce jeu d‚Äôinfiltration et de traque valait et apr√®s avoir vu qu‚Äôil √©tait vendu dans un Humble Bundle avec plusieurs autres jeux qui me faisait de l‚Äô≈ìil j‚Äôai finalement franchi le pas. √Ä ma d√©ception, m√™me si la furtivit√© est une option viable, j‚Äôai plut√¥t tendance √† attaquer les andro√Ødes comme un gu√©rill√©ro, √† fuir comme un couard d√®s que le vent tourne en ma d√©faveur ou √† faire de grands d√©tours pour les √©viter, tout simplement, car la quasi-totalit√© de ces gentilshommes sociopathes qui nous servent d‚Äôennemis ont toujours un ou plusieurs braves camarades qui veillent sur eux, de plus, ils ont une vue stup√©fiante, certains d‚Äôentre eux ne quittent jamais leur poste et, cerise sur le g√¢teau, ils semblent dot√©s d‚Äôun don de pr√©cognition qui les pr√©vient de ma pr√©sence d√®s que je suis √† 20 m√®tres d‚Äôeux. Par contre, n‚Äô√©tant pas un fervent joueur de jeux d‚Äôinfiltration, il est aussi possible que je sois simplement tr√®s mauvais √† ce jeu. 

Bref, dans ¬´ Sir, You Are Being Hunted ¬ª, vous n‚Äô√™tes pas un pr√©dateur cach√© dans l‚Äôombre, vous √™tes une proie, une proie avec tr√®s peu de moyens √† sa disposition pour fuir ses funestes pr√©dateurs et ce d√©tail peut vous faire compl√®tement abhorrer ce jeu.

Comme autre d√©faut majeur, le fait que chaque carte est g√©n√©r√©e de fa√ßon proc√©durale rend l‚Äôunivers de ce jeu vide, artificiel et mort, il s‚Äôagit peut-√™tre d‚Äôun choix des d√©veloppeurs, mais √† certains moments je m‚Äôennuie ferme de marcher dans des zones quasi vierges de vie biologique et compos√©es de lieux beaucoup trop semblables.

Pour finir, je trouve que le contenu de ¬´ Sir ¬ª est trop fam√©lique pour son prix. De mon point de vue, son prix devrait √™tre de cinq dollars et il serait acceptable qu‚Äôil soit vendu √† un prix de dix dollars, mais certainement pas √† vingt dollars. √Ä r√©server √† ceux qui aiment le concept de traque et qui ne sont pas rebut√©s par les d√©cors aussi creux que la fosse des Mariannes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155356929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1608232427}
review: Even though this game could hardly be described as "horror," I felt more fear creeping around from house to house to avoid automated hunters than I've ever felt in a video game. The suspenseful atmosphere and sense of setting are both superb. Worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047331249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 676, 'last_played': 1680395988}
review:
I arrived at the ruins of what appeared to be an old farmhouse. White in color, but with tinges of green with mold, and also black from fires. My heart was pounding. My stomach was growling. A thousand thoughts racing through my mind as I saw a fire pit. My stomach told me to cook some food over it, but my mind told me not to draw attention to myself with smoke. I walked around the property, slowly checking around corners to see if a mustachioed robot gentleman would be there waiting for me. But alas, none were spotted. I carefully tiptoed back to the fire pit to cook food to appease my rumbling stomach. I took the matches and lit the fire. 
"*VRRP* WHAT'S THAT? *CLANK*"
A robot was indeed near me. I quickly threw a rock over his head hoping he would be distracted, but he was not. His sights were aimed at me, and his only concern was that I was still breathing. I drew my revolver and fired off two shots. I still don't know if either hit their target because immediately afterward, I turned around and began running through the gap in the charred walls. 
I spotted a tree and immediately ran behind it. I could hear two robots now. Their clanging joints sounded like the bells ringing to mark the time of my death. I stepped from behind the tree and fired three bullets into the iron torso of one. I then felt a hot, stinging pain in my side. I'd been shot. The other robot was rushing toward me to avenge his fallen comrade. I knew i only had one bullet left. I darted from behind the tree and pulled the trigger.
The bullet rang true! The hot lead surged through the metallic skull cavity of the machine that was hunting me. I was safe!
Or was I?
I was surrounded by the sounds of beeps and whirs and clanks and I soon saw that four new robotic foes were upon me. I put my revolver in its holster and began running. Hot lead flew past me and all around me as i sprinted away from my pursuers. I came to another set of houses, but this was no time to stop and loot. Those robots meant business. Their bullets still whizzing past me, I ran through the houses into the rocky hills by the ocean. After many deep breathes to restore the oxygen to my lungs, i was left with four words that filled up my mind.
"Holy poop. I'm alive."

10/10 would wet my pants again

author: {'steamid': '76561198030123634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1940, 'last_played': 1641947794}
review:
Dear Sir/Madam,

I must regretfully inform you that you are being hunted. While the game itself is fairly straightforward, and easy to pick up, each generated world is unique in it's lay out and the challenges presented by it. While you can find guns to fight back with, combat is not always an option (or the best one), and you'll have to think on your toes to keep yourself in one piece. Each run takes a few hours to complete depending on the set conditions (robot populations, playstyle, island terrain, etc), but every map is generated differently, and new content is steadily being added for our benefit and detriment!

I've put the kettle on, the tea will be ready when you get here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995678342', 'num_games_owned': 1318, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1669235376}
review: This Human-Hunting simulation is a breath of fresh-air, when set against the depressingly high  number of "pro-human/anti-robot" video games.  I know it's just anthropomorphism , but you can almost imagine how it would be to be one of those fleshy bags as it runs vainly hither and thither.  They plainly enjoy it just as much as we do.  But when will the developers let us play as a robot, as the roboGod intended?

review: Though a bit repetetive upon repeated replays, "Sir, You Are Being Hunted" is a unique and challenging experience the first time through. author: {'steamid': '76561198096372013', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1701801434}
review:
Sir, You Are Being Hunted is a great and very atmospheric game. If you like stealth or even mild horror games you are likely to enjoy this. The atmosphere and tension the game creates makes you think twice before you try and loot a house or steal a fragment and this is what makes it unique. It manages to create an atmosphere which many othe games are unable o achieve. The graphical design is almost perfect even if the graphics them selves are no so good. The bots themselves are very challenging, you'll spend more time distracting the bots than you will killing them. Especially towards the end of the game where the bots get brutal.

Pros:

+Great Atmosphere (I know I have already said that a lot)
+Great AI (even if a bit brutal)
+Good variety of bots.
+Pretty landscape.
+Different map every time.
+Large variety of methods to distract/ kill the bots.
+Multiplayer is extremely fun, you can either play PvP or Coop (Coop still has a bit of competitiveness to it).

Cons:

-Stealth is very hard (maybe it's just me).
-Villages can look very similar (you may need to read the village name to work out which ones you have been to).
-Gives you a swetty mouse :)
-A bit to expensive for ¬£15 (should be ¬£10 max), buy on sale.

Overall Score: 8.4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198062712916', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1420316887}
review: This is the closest thing I've been able to find that plays like a game of cat and mouse. Under most circumstances you are always far outnumbered and overpowered, and taking your pursuers head on pretty much never seems to be a good idea. The game is all about stealth and stumbling through a beautiful, robot infested countryside in the pitch black of night or dim light of twilight. Feels perfect. I can't wait to try multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022370609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1450587405}
review:
I can see why people could recommend this game, however it's not really for me.

I find it difficult and slow. It's very common within this game to run into more enemies than you can handle. Therefor progress it hindered by going back to the last save you made. That save point is one postion on the entire map. You can go wandering off looking around, die and be sent thrown back to the save. 

Basically I am looking for five stones on the first island. I got one after dying a few times. I died before I got it back to centre stone where you take it and save. next time I played I couldn;t remember where it was or in which direction. Then the time after that I found the stone again. I got it back safe this time. 

However this is how the whole game goes. I have gradually after many time starting the game to play a bit more, found another two stones. Yet I have no idea where I found them, so I have no idea where not to look again. Since it goes so slowly and you quit-out of disblelief, by the time you play again you have forgotten. 

What's the point then?

It's kind of fun and kind of interesting, but it's not really engaging or has any surprises. I could not in all honesty even consider recommending it to a friend. Never.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961768818', 'num_games_owned': 4045, 'num_reviews': 454, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1450502135}
review:
You crawl around a barron field, looking for smoking rocks.  They're usually surrounded by robots with guns, so you need to lure them away first, which isn't hard.  Then you grab the rock and put it in another rock.  Do that enough times and the game ends.

That's pretty much it.  There's a few items, most of which are not actually useful.  There are some houses, but you can't enter them, they're just scenery.  There's a few types of enemies but the strategy with all of them is the same.

My friends and I were incredibly excited to play this with each other, given our love of stealth and roguelike games.  We were all very disappointed, and don't understand the hype for this game.  It still feels like very, very early access.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032636062', 'num_games_owned': 2816, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1450482433}
review:
Personal Rating: 4 of 10

A simplistic and straight forward open-world survival game. The game starts with a dull naration which isn't humorous, trying too hard to have the British slang and painfully slow.

You are placed into an island where you need to collect parts to escape while avoiding robots. You have to constantly scavenge for fresh edible food to keep your vitality (which is basically hunger) up. This will help you regain health when taken damage. The island is rather barren and dull with tonnes of props and houses heavily reused (you can obviously see the pattern). The island is plagued with robots that are constantly on the lookout for you. There seem to be multiple type of bots including a hot air baloon and dogs but really they don't make much difference.

Weapons and ammos are scarce but trust me it really don't make much of a different. You may need to travel to other island via boat to look for more parts but those island just seemed rather similar to me. I joined a multiplayer (you don't actually get to interact with other players) game where all places have been scavanged with only 1 cloth and 1 drink in my inventory with 2 more parts to collect. One of this part is guarded by 2 hunter and a dog. I practically waltz in crouching, pick the part and ran off without taking damage (yes they spotted me but I just ran). That is how bad the A.I. is.

After 5 minutes into the game I've already seen everything the game has to offer and got really bored because actions occured too little and the game is just plain dull with the pace set.

If you are really into games like these, this can be decent for you with no visible bugs or even hiccups and the multiplayer seem to have dedicated server (in EU) but with 200+ ping I can still play smoothly; otherwise steer clear (I had to leave this game overnight to collect the trading cards since I spent 5 hours into the game and not a single drop).

author: {'steamid': '76561197979284972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1448673569}
review:
Sir, You Are Being Hunted delivers on all the major promises made by all those Early Access open-world surive 'em up titles, sans the massively multiplayer stuff (though multiplayer was recently patched in, I have yet to try that mode out, so if you're worried about that and that alone in regards to picking up this game you can just go ahead and bail now, 's cool, I promise).  Maybe a better comparison would be the old S.T.A.L.K.E.R. trilogy.  Inventory management is very similar, there's a lot of worthless junk in the world like Bethesda RPG's, but you'll be forced to prioritze between nourishment and weapons as you progress through the game.

What makes SYABH unique is surely the English country-side art style, with all the Victorian robots running around.  The designs are not over-designed, if that makes sense.  Their comical dialog, and gentleman's dress code really adds a sense of comedicness to the bleak, foggy marshes and hills that dot the islands you explore.  Unfortunately though, for all their charm the robots are just as freaking deadly.  

The game gives you a chance to save your progress semi-regularly, but the fear of death is still very real as you can end up losing nearly an hour of progress and restarting back on a beach.  This might sound like a challenge but it really emphasives how stressful the game can become, especially as you proceed and the robots begin to spawn in bigger masses with deadlier tools in their belts.  I've sat for nearly 15 minutes in the grass just waiting for patrols to die down so I can get back to the freaking boat.  

I actually had to take a break from games for a few days after completing the final island of the main story purely because of how stressful the robots become.  They shouldn't be scary, but they become terrifying.  The land owner robot rivals Slenderman in terms of terrifying stalker material.  An invcible giant that makes high pitched squeels, and will follow you relentlessly once he spots you.  

I played on one of the easier starting load outs with a randomly generated set of islands, though you're free to choose your starting loadout from several presets.  You can even manually adjust what types of islands and robots you'll receive in your playthrough.  With all that in mind, I can't really think of anything this game does wrong.  You are equipped the tools to configure it to your suiting right out of the box.  There's no crafting system like other major open world titles, but the game doesn't really suffer for it.  

If you enjoy sandbox experiences, especially from a first person perspective, you won't regret putting this on your wish list.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074618214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1421176511}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044965823', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1687224002}
review:
Lord , when I bought this game I thought I would spend hours playing a stealth game , with a good ambiance and able to hold the focus of an ADHD . With breaks for sinister jokes and dead rats .
Getting too happy to blow the neck of a hunter or to flee several of them , as well as simply not be noticed ... Aaaah as I love not being noticed , I spent my whole life doing it! Mostly go unnoticed as they are using a rifle and preparing a bear trap in order to steal a piece of teleportation ! Having to eat enough convincing mushrooms to survive at certain times , naah , just wanted to eat them anyway. Ah yes , sir, where was I? Just say even with all these daily activities I got eight hours to play this game.


Yes it is ! I am using Google translator to write this note and I am fully aware of the confusion and how is this lackluster review.


And I'm here having fun with the translator the audio !!! HAUHAH

author: {'steamid': '76561198119757056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1448793064}
review: Awesome intermediate stealth game! There's never an easy moment in this game because you never start off with a weapon unless you're in single player with some kind of setting. The challenges of this game can be edited to be really easy or difficult and be played together with friends. I recommend this game for people to train themselves with stealth, as it requires patiences, observation and strategy to survive. Ace this game, and you'll do fine for any other game with the stealth alternative.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107978712', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1572830134}
review: This game is great, but it is not for everyone. It is a atmosheric stealth survival game and is very fun, I think this game would have to be one of the best games i have ever played with a few tweaks a little more content and a backstory. I recommend this game to anyone who enjoys survival/stealth games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130239915', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1524657075}
review:
My god.
The creepiest game I own in my Library.
Sir, You Are Being Hunted is quite the long title, so I'll abbreviate it. Let's keep it at "Sir".
Well, let's get to it then.

Pros:

-Very atmospheric.
-Very creepy. Like, pretty damn creepy.
-Acceptable graphics for indie standards.
-Very DayZ-like looting, it works.
-Easy to understand mechanics.
-Wide arsenal of traps and distractions, creating a fair game.
-Multiplayer is fun. Unlike DayZ, you don't get shot on sight, or at least, not often.
-Great boat-system, creating multiple areas to go to.
-Variety of classes to choose from, which you wouldn't expect in a survival-game.

Cons:

-Sometimes feels unfair; you always have to be on the run.
-Not alot of weapons to choose from.
-Not really that cheap. I got it during the Autumn Sale for ‚Ç¨3.99 (translates to $4.40/3.50 Pounds)
-Multiplayer doesn't add much; basebuilding would greatly increase the fun you could have with your friends.
-Most of the time, your inventory is stuffed with bottles. aka The loot usually sucks ass.
-You don't really get anything for taking down robots.
-Loot shouldn't just be in houses, this doesn't give you much of a choice of where to go.

Whelp; long story short:

7.9/10 I'd wait for more immersive multiplayer. Not a bad game though, just not ready for multiplayer fun - Cpt Bridge

author: {'steamid': '76561198012778917', 'num_games_owned': 2877, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1448775852}
review:
'Sir, you are being hunted' is a stealth game that clearly takes some mechanics from Metal Gear Series and, yet, they manage to make the game stand by itself. The game is pretty large and it is actually kinda challenging, you have to understand the game and play it carefully so you can survive in it. Oh, yeah, it is also a survive game.

This game has some flaws by the fact that it may be too hard for new players to come into it. There is no tutorial fully teaching the player and you are throw into the game's world and have to take care of yourself without dying. I also think some things are not clear enough, like when the Robots (the enemies) are near, and the bleeding system makes you die too fast (in my experience).

But this game is actually cool, once you understand (you'll probably have to take one guide, but it is tots ok). Also, the game is pretty, kinda set in a steampunkesque world, and you can actually control how it will look, with the islands. Also, you have some good variety of classes that begin in different ways. It is a game worth buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978745015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1489630661}
review:
So I recently bought this game on sale for 3 bucks or so for me and my brother, and we quickly jumped into a game of multiplayer with little knowledge of what we were doing. As time progressed we were slaying robots right and left and snatching up ruin pieces everywhere. We decided to push for the middle so we can activate the teleporter, which was heavily guarded by the horse riders. But before we could get there we were ambushed by a squad of robots, I managed to kill a few, and hide from them as they hunted my brother who had all the pieces we had found so far. Out of ammo I grabbed my hatchet coming from behind them, and started to kill them off one by one, as I reached the last robot who was about to slay my brother I heard a single shot fire, killing me and leaving my brother to face his fate. 

~10/10 Would get headshot by my brother again.

review:
Zusammenfassend:
Das Spiel sieht nach mehr aus, als es ist. Denn es ist tot langweilig.
2/10

Als "Sir, You Are Being Hunted" zum ersten Mal bei mir in Steam auftauchte gefiel es mir und alles was ich dar√ºber las/sah/h√∂rte. Ich habe es dann beim Sale f√ºr einen Appel und ein Ei gekauft und habe mich auf den Multiplayer gefreut.
Zu Beginn hat es mir gro√üen Spa√ü gemacht durch das hohe Gras zu schleichen und zu versuchen Roboter vom Objekt weg zu locken, welches man um zu gewinnen zu einem Sammelpunkt transportieren muss. Doch sehr schnell wurde mir bewusst, dass das Spiel nicht mehr als eben dieses beinhaltet: Es gibt gro√üe leere Fl√§chen ohne Loot, H√§user in denen man nichts findet und die man noch nicht mal betreten kann. Nicht zu vergessen, die teilweise strohdoofe K.I. denen man oft einfach davon rennen kann und die einen manchmal sehen ohne, dass man sichtbar ist oder sie sieht.
All dies lies mich den Kauf dieses Spiels schnell bereuhen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123768111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1637282227}
review:
I'm not a big fan of terror style, being hunted kind of game. But this is an exception I'm proud to recomend.

This game has a great background, wierd and threatening enemies (keeps you on edge through it all), great gameplay (shooting these robots was so much fun!) and even when you're just walking around you can hear them talking with their brittish robotic accents, making witty remarks about stuff, it's awesome!

Anyway, great first person terror/shooter that keeps you on edge and has great replayability since it's pretty random gen. =D

author: {'steamid': '76561198060754428', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1447881207}
review:
How could a game about british evil robots be boring, I don't know, it's a hard task to achieve and yet somehow that's what happened. I had such high hopes for this one, but I couldn't even finish it. The graphics were basic, the Sirs... well, the robots left me alone for a few hours while I wandered around the moors enjoying a walking simulator. There wasn't much to explore, you couldn't even enter the buildings. And when the evil robots started appearing... they just shot me from far away and that was it. No witty banter. No feeling of dark menace. 

If someday I get to build my own army of classy, murdering robots, they will be more engaging, I promise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068081474', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1548731941}
review: This game is really fun. If you're into survival games, then you'll love this. Unless then you are a complete wuss and will get scared before the menu loads. Otherwise, this game is definately worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071846972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1490678400}
review: Myself not being an avid fan of the survival subgenre of fps games, I picked this up during a sale for the ridiculous price of $2.00. I found it somewhat interesting, but at the time was more interested in other games. A few weeks ago, I rediscovered this game in my library and truly found the correct way to play this sort of game: lights off headphones on. This game delivers! Whether you want to whack robots, shoot robots, or get shot by robots, this is the game for you! Seriously, though, this offers a high level of survival gameplay while maintaining that intensity and nervousness a game like this needs. Though sometimes difficult to get started, once you are up and running in your tweed jacket and bag of tricks, this game will give you hours of rewarding gameplay against fairly intelligent opponents in the robot hunters. Great price, great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035418533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1447044321}
review: I rarely write reviews, but this game was unexpectedly amazing.  If you like to play in a sneaky, stealthy manner in a completely open world then buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995368242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1541653116}
review: The game is amazing. A must have for anyone who like play stealth games or strategy games.  The single player allows you to really develop your style of game play to survive across 5 islands. While the multiplayer allows you to use that developed style to team up with friends and mix it with their styles. In example I am more of a sneaking arround, with my weapon of choice being an ax and a rifle. My friends prefers to hunt the robots using a pistol, shotgun, and dynamite.  In multiplayer I use an alarm clock to call near by robots then hide in the distance. When enough are close to the clock, my friends throws the dynamite to get as many as we can. With the dynamite explose more robots come and I sneak up behind them and take them out with the ax, silently.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986894466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1465336070}
