author: {'steamid': '76561198025301761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 924, 'last_played': 1572466826}
review:
This game is actually very well made. 

The objective is to hunt down teleporter pieces, which are necessary to win, while you are constantly being hunted by robots.

For the positive aspects of this game, the islands are all randomly generated, the artificial intelligence is good, sneaking aroud is fun, and setting up decoys and traps makes it interesting.

One very minor bug I have noticed is that the water robots are sometimes able to come up through the ground on small islands, which can hurt you.

Multiplayer is currently PVP (Player vs. Player) only, but you can still team up if you wish. There can only be one winner, though.

I recommend this game to anyone searching for an interesting stealth / survival game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142690609', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1531084715}
review:
The first thing you need to hear about this game is "Sir, you are being hunted." Literally. You have to find all 20 artifacts and bring them back to some rocks where you spawn. All the while you are being hunted by a bunch of british robots! Its awesome! This is the only game where you can experience the horror, and hillarity, of being chased around by, hunters, dogs, balloons, (FYI I have more on the list) sea monsters, robo kids, no serieously the robo kids are terrifying. Their robo parents let them run around with guns!

This is a horror/comedy game with a little FPS (First Person Shooter) thrown in. You can loot houses for weapons and supplies, and some other things. (I once found a dead rat, true story) but you have to do so QUETLY. 

Rules for Sir You Are Being Hunted:

#1. Long grass is your best freind.

#2. Speak in a british accent while your playing

#3. If you see a cute little dogy, DONT PET IT. IT WILL BITE YOUR ARM OFF.

#4. If you find haggas dont throw is away because its a sheep's insides cooked to perfection. Its actually quite tasty. (not)

#5. Folllow the rule "Dont go towards the light." Because that light is a search blimp.

And final rule: Stay hidden.

28.4/10 recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111181104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1480897821}
review: Of the overly saturated market of shooters; Sir your being hunted is the pond in the dry desert.  Rather than looking for a fight constantly you must use you wit to survive the increasing waves of brittish robots.  The key factor to the game is inventory management, and stealth.   With a bit of a luck factor at times, you've got to raid the hunters homes (and corpses) for anything of use, whilst collecting pieces of the machine to end the game.  At times it can be entertaining online, unless players are hunting each other... that should explain itself but fun none the less. Although players arent quite as polite as the bots. IF you want a good stealth based game this is it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993197902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1523588189}
review:
Co-op'ed with a friend in this game a couple times. Its fun, unique and inventive. I look forward to the over time improvement of the game through more maps, more multiplayer options, harder robots. I would love to see a map like a major city, such as new york in the late 1800 early 1900s.
Only issue ive had is connecting to a multiplayer server through the game. Both times on two different days we had to use a third party program.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381877', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 2586, 'playtime_forever': 2473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 942, 'last_played': 1551035067}
review:
I think Sir, You Are Being Hunted is a pretty amazing game! The survival gameplay and procedural generation of the game world make this a hunt to last! In Sir, You Are Being Hunted, you play as a sir or madam who has become stranded on a mysterious island chain after a grizzly teleporter accident. You are tasked with collecting the teleporter pieces to get home. Fighting off starvation is no where near the biggest threat though,

 The islands are inhabited by a race of genocidal dapper "gentlebots", as you wander the ruins of what once seemed to be a productive human civilization they will hunt you for sport. ducking through thick brush, dodging the "mantraps" of poachers, the scent hounds of the hunter bots, and the ever present eyes of the hot air balloons searching for even the smallest sign of your location, you will never be safe.

Thats just a small helping of what is to come now that you have become stranded on these strange "robo-isles", not even the ocean is safe here, being constantly patrolled by a giant robo-leviathan. Your only way home is to get all the teleporter pieces, and it sure as heck is not going to be easy!



Thats not all to Sir, You Are Being Hunted though! Now with the addition of multiplayer you can hunt with your friends, or heck, even just hunt your friends! Battle for survival with multiple players on a custom island in multiplayer! It is something I enjoy about Sir a great deal since I started playing. There is near endless variations to loot, robots and islands so there is always more content to play. This is one of the reasons I can wholly recommend Sir, You Are Being Hunted to any survival game fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144401519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1694062050}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076773409', 'num_games_owned': 643, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1446928059}
review:
I like the new multiplayer feature, since playing this game alone feels a little too gloomy and lonely.  It's a pretty fun multiplayer co-op game, but it still feels pretty buggy, and feels unfinished.  I mean, there is a lot of loot that has no apparent use at all, and a lot of features in the game are unintuitive.  For example, you can cook items, but it is quite the process to figure out WHAT you can cook and HOW to cook it.  Item descriptions are uninformitive and you can only 'discard', or 'use' any certain item, with no way to know what will happen if you press 'use'.

tl;dr
Fun with a friend, but feels unfinished.
https://youtu.be/CSxio9Y9lOQ

author: {'steamid': '76561198072777539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1446787483}
review: I keep falling through the map around the mansions in multiplayer. That is my only complaint, otherwise the game is a wonderful idea executed beautifully.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046401253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1446169745}
review: I was very excited to be able to play this game when I first saw it. It seems witty and fun, and though it is unfinished, I liked the concept immensely. However upon playing for one session, I quickly realized the world is unvaried and the overall gameplay is boring as hell. While it seems atmospheric when you first drop in, you will notice the world is drab and posesses absolutely no charm. After one completed game, I felt absolutely no desire to ever play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048627984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1638147635}
review: A fun game that has a very interesting art style. A little hard to keep playing it if you  have a short attention span with the pretty slow pace. But, you can still have a lot of fun with this title. Some tense moments when you're being hunted. One big problem though is that the robots are incredibly stupid, hiding in a corner a few feet away can make them lose track of you. Other than that, a great game to play if you have the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153169429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 2552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1636763680}
review:
is it original? no. everything in this game is derived from other games before it. that isn't a bad thing, though; no more than the evil within and soma have remixed previous ideas. it's a stealth game. it's an adventure game. it's a first-person shooter. it's an inventory management game. it's a silly game. it's a terrifying horror game. it's a tea drinking simulator. but is it unique? is it charming? is it worth the price? yes, yes, and... it depends on how rich you are.

good sound design, good visuals, good theme... my only qualms are the sometimes-wonky procedural land generator (i once had a dock surrounded entirely by land without any connection to the ocean), the horribly unbalanced riders (how the heck do you evade them? can you even?0, and the F***** SEA MONSTER (for example, i'm trying to get in the boat and leave because i'm being chased by sixteen hunters, seventeen dogs, and the landowner, but it decides to pop up in the middle of the dock, literally in the middle of the dock, and insantly kill me). other than the sometimes-infuriating bugs and glitches (and the overly simplistic and somehow simultaneously unfair ai in some cases), i have a lot of fun playing this game.

it's not gonna be for everyone. it's brutal, punishing, unfair, and will make you wish you were dead. it will destroy you for the slightest mistake, error in judgment, or misclick causing you to accidentally destroy your food and make you starve to death. oops. i'd put this on the same level as the ensign or lord of the rings: the third age on hard or metro 2033 redux survival hardcore in terms of difficulty. or i guess dark souls. and the worst part is the procedural generation will screw you over more than the tactics of the enemy hunters (which basically consist of 'shoot each other' or 'only look in one direction' or 'not pay attention to my buddies behind me getting hacked to bits by a starving axe-wielding robophobic british man or lady'). but even with all that, it's a great game because these aren't bugs, they're features. and the difficulty is definitely worth it just for the end credits.

also they added multiplayer, but i haven't played that yet. i'd like to. infinite replayability and all that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053917409', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1660298315}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069958003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1445705177}
review:
Loaded up a multiplayer game with a friend who had also gotten this on the recent sale. Trying to figure out the mechanics of the game. One hour later, armed to the teeth with bullets and guns, we attempt to return the last teleporter piece. We get attacked by swarms of robots. We give up after four more tries of sneaking past them all to get the piece back.

10/10, would give up right before victory again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054913513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1608386461}
review:
With 75% of my inventory occupied by bottles and empty guns, but no food or rags, I need to find a source of food. a house to loot, perhaps. I scurry into a forest after the sound of a squadron falls upon my ears; I am in no condition to fight. I wander the forest for a little bit, helplessly watching my vitality droop into the low thirties. I need food, drink, anything. 

And fast.

After crawling through the forest for a few minutes, I hear humming. There is a lone robot here. I scope out the immediate area, hoping to set course away from certain doom. Upon laying eyes on the beast, however, I sit in place, carefully calculating where it was traveling.

For it was passing an unlooted shack.

I watch the shack and robot from above, for I was stationed on a hill just out of sight. My vitality is hitting the low teens. This shack was is last shot at life, for any village would be too far to not starve. This is my last chance, and I need to spend it wisely. I note the robot's steady patrol around the shack, and sprint when he rounds the corner away from the door. I do not care if I am seen; I could run after I retrieved any food in the shack, and any other course of action would leave me dead.

A meter or so away, I note that I can no longer hear the robot humming. This was either my lucky day, or my last. I got within a few decimeters of the door, so close to life once more.

Snap

That is all I hear, and all I need to hear. I am dead. The abrupt and loud snap and accompanying crunch can only mean one thing.

I quickly look down to inpect my injured shin, shattered by a perfectly placed bear trap. I quickly try to undo the traps mechanisms, to free myself and run. I am interupted by a loud click above my head, to which I stand up to identify. I am greeted by the barrel of a large gun, and then by a bright light and darkness. I can feel the ground as I land, I feel it welcome me to a long, peaceful slumber. As I fall into eternal sleep, I am greeted with a lullaby, a familiar song that I am unable to name. It was unsettling, however in the way it was sung, or rather, hummed.

And it sounded oddly robotic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980910801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1445391402}
review:
This isn't so much of a review as much as it is a first impression... But I'm not impressed. Sir/Madam, You Are Being Hunted promises that each playthrough is unique, but in my experience not a single playthrough has been unique. You might be looking at the screenshots and saying to yourself 'Hey those robots look pretty good!' and you're right - but nothing else does. I sure hope you like the colors brown and grey, because that's the entire color palate. There are different seeds available, but within 10 minutes you've seen every house or castle or whatever on any given island because there simply aren't enough assets. 'But hey,' you might start, 'this is supposed to be drab and dreaery just like real England!' Aside from being a lame excuse to justify a bad art direction, perhaps that's why no one else makes games set in such boring locals.

Even if you try to ignore the graphics in favor of gameplay, you get a pretty unrewarding stealth game. For starters, the visibility gauge seems arbitrary. I swear I was about 10 meters away from a robot with two pips on the visibility gauge and I got by no problem. Same exact condition 5 minutes later? Instantly spotted. This is only compounded when robots are alerted and you find out they're psychic. And did I mention the combat sucks? You don't start off with any weapons and when you get lucky enough to find one, it feels awful. 'But it's a stealth game!' some fool is going to say. True, it is, but classics like Thief and Deus Ex gave you a bunch of different options to avoid combat that all felt refined AND both games start you off with a weapon that's useful, if only occasionally. If you fire a gun in Sir/Madam, you've already lost, and if you find a hatchet you've already won. It all comes down to RNG, which oddly enough, doesn't mind giving you loads of consumables making the survival aspect a formality.

Eventually you get to experience the horrible checkpoint system. You can save whenever you return one of the stone pieces to the altar and when you go between islands. That's it. Be prepared to run upwards of five minutes just to get back where you died so you can restart again. Did I say run? I meant crawl, because running makes you visible from miles around. Realistic, but not even slightly fun. And with movement comes the weird camera bob/lean. Whenever you move with the keyboard, your character leans in that direction like he just pounded down a six pack. I've never had problems with motion sickness in video games before, but this one makes my head throb.

Multiplayer is the same thing but minus the mechanics. Everyone runs around like it's team death match in unreal tournament and eventually wins through sheer luck. And if you die? Hey no problem just respawn and you don't lose any progress!

I've been looking forward to play this game since it entered Early Access but resisted the temptation. I recently got it as part of a Humble Bundle and I still feel ripped off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106385321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1444332494}
review:
Malgres le grand nombre d'avis positif sur ce jeu, j'ai decid√© de le noter negtivement quand m√™me, je m'explique:
Tout d'abord ce jeu est un FPS rogue like, la map n'est jamais la m√™me et vous pouvais m√™me la customiser a votre sauce (que se soit pour les lieux ou pour les ennemis).
Vous commencez donc votre partie et la un truc deja tre choquant d'entr√© : c'est moche, c'est m√™me vraiment vraiment moche ! D'habitude les mauvais graphismes ne me derangent pas dans un jeu donc je me suis dit "ok c'est pas trop grave temps que le gameplay y est, tout va bien"
Maintenant le jeu: tres t√¥t vous allez recuperer un artefact que vous allez devoir ramener au point de depart, cette artefact prends beaucoup de place dans l'inventaire (tres bon systeme d'inventaire au passage) ce qui vous oblige a en prendre 1 ou 2 a la fois et la on a le gros bemol du jeu. En gros vous allez devoir parcourir la map pendant DES HEURES (sans rire) pour trouver les 17 artefacts du jeu en sachant que en plus il y a 5 zones au total. C'est d'ailleurs pour √ßa que le fait que les graphismes soit aussi moches est vraiment derangent, si a la limite on se baladais dans une map magnifique comme dans The Vanishing of Ethan Carter, le cot√© simulateur de marche ne m'aurais pas d√©reng√© mais la c'est vraiment perturbant.
Enfin je ne pouvais pas conclure cette critique sans vous parler des ennemis: Dans ce jeu il y a tr√©s peu d'armes, encore moins d'armes √† feu et je ne parle m√™me pas des munitions du coup le jeu oblige a utliser la furtivit√©, prendre certains chemins pour √©viter les ennemis et fuir des que l'on est reper√©. MAIS car il y a un mais, c'est que les ennemis ont des armes a feu et que √ßa met 3 plombes pour finalement les semer, tout en sachant qu'il y a 2 enemis a cot√© de chaques artefacts, que l'on ne peut pas sauvegarder a tout moment et qu'une balle a possibilit√© de causer une hemoragie ce qui fait diminuer votre vie petit a petit, je vous laisse deviner l'arrachage de cheuveux.
Du coup est ce que je conseil ce jeu ? Non, dans la theorie c'est excelent (Rogue like/Survie/Exploration/Infiltration), dans la pratique c'est vraiment decevant et personnellement je trouve √ßa vraiment pas terrible. Apres ce n'est que mon avis et a en juger les 84% de commentaires positif le jeu a beaucoup plu mais pour moi √ßa a √©t√© une enorme deception.
P.S: D√©sol√© pour les fautes d'orthographes je ne suis pas du tout litt√©raire ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561197978546580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1080, 'last_played': 1474254605}
review:
Masterpiece.     Def: A work of art where a single brushstroke added or removed would deminish the piece.

   Sir, You Are Being Hunted qualifies. A modest game, beautifully realised. The scale and pace of this game are absolutly perfect. So well balanced in risk-reward looting dinamics that you just feel right at home. You are given all the information you need to navigate the hazards so if you know yourself ...and you know your enemies....something, something........you get the idea. 

   Sorry I was staring at the moonlight streaming through the branches.

Pros:

-Solid colorscheme, ambient sounds and music.
-Original art design.
-Analog rain. (as opposed to Minecraft's digital rain) Actually pleasant.
-Procedurally gererated world for replayablity.
-Simple mechanics and good stealth tactics.
-Combat is possible but not advised with large groups.
-Scenic playing enviroment with day/night cycle.

Cons:

-None. See definition above.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067033980', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1445721550}
review:
Its fairly good. But there is also room for improvement.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
1. Its a very unique game
2. Graphics are fair
3. Varying robot enemies. They border on creepy to very deadly.
4. There are varying ways to distract or kill enemies.
5. You can not always rely on combat to get you through a situation.
6. Theres multiplayer. (Though to be frank I feel like it could've gone without it.)
7. Good narrator/commentator.

[h1]Cons[/h1]
1. Stealth can be a bit ify sometimes.
2. It can be hard to understand what the robots are saying.
3, If you have a poor sense of direction, your going to have a crappy time.
4. I wish the narrator/commentator would speak more. It seems as though after a certain point, he just leaves you until you reach the stone.
5. I feel as though theres a lack of music at times.

(Still a work in progress)

author: {'steamid': '76561197995210829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1660279598}
review:
Bloody good fun old boy! Definitely for those that enjoy a bit of heavy stealth along with running for your goddamn life!

Difficulty curve was quite steep at first. You will have to come to your own realization how to best handle every different encounter with your hunting adversaries. Hunters will be the most often encountered, I highly reccommend not engaging any group of three or more unless its late game and you have the very rare rifle with ammunition to spare. Far more often than not, discretion will be the better part of valor, think about the reward versus the risk. You can only save at the center of the beginning island and any boat dock.  They have unlimted units while you have.. well, admittedly unlimiited lives. But hey! You probably want the best ending score right?!

With the axe, if you're lucky enough to find one, you can circle strafe around one or two hunters until you hear them let off both barrels with their shotgun, then quickly close straight in for the kill! Don't let them backpedal, sprint. Make sure to check your surroundings, might be that a hunting party or two heard the shots and are now zeroing in on your position. If its safe, then loot them bitches for a possibly working shotgun and bonus items. Traps are one of the best items in the game, learn to use them!

Honestly wouldn't bother with poachers at all. I killed a few when they first showed up but their blunderbuss, while insanely powerful at close range, seemed unnecessary seeing as how a single shot required a 2x1 space in your inventory. And basically underperformed with dynamite which seemed far more worth carrying for tough enemies, as in squires or horse riders, or groups of softies guarding fragments.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990256709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1558784726}
review:
Best ¬£1.49 spent. 

So far I've had a couple of super-entertaining and tense 2-player LAN sessions of this game. We were both very drawn in to the aesthetic and the unease the landscapes create. The stealth is fairly strong from my experience thus far and the guns feel fairly solid. The sounds and ambience are decent too (though the narrator in single-player is a little immersion-breaking and irratating).  The game's balancing is fairly levelled - obtaining guns is a help but does not mean you can abandon stealth entirely. This is great because of the fun you can have with the various distractions and traps you have at your disposal. So far a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064599475', 'num_games_owned': 434, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1444973898}
review:
Sir or Madam, SYaBH is a nice little stealth/survival game about an extremely British dimensional traveler stuck in a land where British hunter themed robots hunt humans for fun... that is until he can collect all the timey-wimey bits of his device and rebuild it.  Toward that end you will sneak around, loot houses (or more precisely their doors),  shoot overly pesky robot hunters, and dodge those that can't be so easily dealt with.  There are 5 islands to explore per game, all proceedurally generated from general parameters you choose, on average 3 bits per island, and several different starting loadouts (occupations?) to experiment with.  The numbers of robots and and their type escalates as you gather more pieces until they become so numerous that stealth becomes tedious and combat a little overwhelming.  Still, with hit and run tactics or distractions you can still outmaneuver the robots whose AI is *usually* not that dilligent or perceptive.  If you manage to reassumble your device you are treated to a short in-game animation followed by static credits and a decent song.  I spent a little less than 5 hours beating the game my first time.  MP seems a bit too PVP focused, and doesn't currently use Steamworks so it's currently a bit questionable.  I would have liked to see more variety of loot, additional story elements to flesh out the narrative, and slightly more rifle ammo in loot caches, but none of those held back my enjoyment of my initial playthrough.

While it's obviously not yet fully polished as of this writing and despite it's currently dubious replay value, it's already very enjoyable, and, I believe, worth full price as is.  I may still have a wishlist, but no major complaints.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000685818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1444974191}
review:
[h1]It's just okay, but missing all of its potential. 4/10.[/h1][list][*][b]Feels Unfinished:[/b] It feels like there's still too much missing to consider it a released game.

[*][b]Mediocre Mechanics:[/b] Nothing is fascinating and everything feels dull and uninspired. Combat is simplistic and so are the enemies. Quickly draining hunger is the only thing that inspires you to move around.

[*][b]Lacking Immersion:[/b] The graphics are at such a low quality, and the environment is so minimally designed, that the whole game feels uninspired and empty. There's literally nothing to encourage you to explore besides the objective and hunger.

[*][b]Minimal Explanation:[/b] You're pretty much just on an island full of angry robots. There's nothing to the story, and many of the story elements are unexplained.

[*][b]Low Content:[/b] There's only a few weapons and fewer ways to hide. You can't enter any buildings, you just click on a door and look at the building's "inventory."[/list][h1]Additional Notes and Commentary[/h1]I had originally given this game a positive rating, but changed it to negative. It felt charming and different at first, but I look back and grimace at how lacking and uninspired it looked and felt.

I don't recommend this game, and I doubt it will ever get more exciting. It's just another minimally developed game with buzz words and generic humor slapped all over to get people to buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054616370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1446782825}
review:
Incredible atmosphere and incredibly fun!

This game does an amazing job creating a world where you truly feel like you're being hunted. It's a beautiful world that feels so eerie as you sneak through the bushes, listening out for any signs of robots. I played this game with headphones which I don't do very often and I love how much of a difference it makes I highly recommend it! But once I was spotted and they started shooting it was absolutely terrifying, I can't explain it. I've never been so scared of getting shot in a video game before, the whole atmosphere of the game is just exceptional, the way it makes something that's never been scary in a game before suddenly become petrifying is just fantastic. Exploring and scavenging the randomly generated maps is great too and feels so different to how you would scavence in other survival games. 

I'm still discovering a lot about the game and haven't tried multiplayer yet but so far it does an amazing job in what it's intended to do. However, I highly suggest getting it while it's on sale. It's an amazing game but I got it for $2.40, I don't think it would be worth the full $24 but I could be wrong...

author: {'steamid': '76561198044066117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1464577709}
review: This game is a fantastic stealth game. Always trying to avoid treacherous robots. At all times. A good rogue-like, always changing and being different from game to game. And all around, just a wonderfully crafted indie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086162912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1445018307}
review:
Gadzooks! After playing this game for an extended period and then turning it off, I had a real "coming out of the cave" moment. I felt relieved to be back in reality where I'm not the only living human, robots aren't hunting me, and the weather doesn't constantly suck. 

Funny thing is, I'm really looking forward to coming back to that world in my next play session. It seriously feels like a warzone, but not the kind you'd see in Modern Warfare. It's the kind you'd see in Stanley Kubrick's "Full Metal Jacket".  Buildings are falling apart and the environment is dusky and depressing. Sometimes the silence is punctuated by a fire fight off in the distance as bots start infighting with each other. It's a dangerous environment where you rarely get a chance to relax. 

And then the game gets unsettling. When you hear an unearthly....."sound" off in the distance and see a giant landowner limping about with its two guard dog bots following. Or when you get impatient and attract the attention of a squad of bots when you're low on ammo. They know you're there, and they relish in the hunt. Which is made apparant by their creepy robotic laughter as they creep ever closer to your hastily chosen and flimsy hiding spot. And after waiting with baited breath with your finger on the trigger as a bot just barely uncovers your hiding place, you hear a siren go off and the area around you bathed in red light. Turns out you weren't paying attention to the balloon sentry floating around the area, and now you have to make a split second decision. Fight for your life, or try to run and hide, hoping that any bullets that penetrate your backside don't do enough damage to end you. Because it's been an hour since you last saved at the waypoint, and it would be terrible to have to find all those hard earned items again. 

I'm not kidding when I say that this very scenario happened to me. I have the sweat that was accumulating on my brow to prove it. I just barely managed to escape with just 2 points of health remaining, and my heart didn't stop pounding until well after I managed to get back to the waypoint to save. It's a kind of terror that is rooted in reality. I would've lost a ton of items if I had died. God knows what would've happened if I had decided to stand and fight. 

The "brutally funny" description that the developers decided to go with puzzles me. Because at least for me, this game is one of the most tense and stressful experiences I've had in awhile. In a good way. Sir, you are being terrorized.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028159733', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1445557030}
review:
Have you ever wanted to lead your friends into battle against robots by sounding the charge by poorly playing your rusty trumpet?

Dont answer, I know this is everyone's dream.

Look no further! This game will take care of all of your needs. Want to hide around the corner from a squad of robot hunters while sipping lukewarm tea? Now you can! Strike fear into the hearts of your enemies by equipping everyone in your game with a trumpet and stroll through the streets, sounding off the war horn, warning all the robots of their incoming demise.

I remember it like it was yesterday, *BUUUUUUUURRRRRRRR* *BURRRRRRRRRRRRRR* *BUUUUURRRRRRR* We took down countless robots trying to gather the pieces of the teleporter all while keeping our spirits up with the lively trumpet of freedom. Living off of the food we scrounged together, mainly wisky and tea, we kept our strenght at maximum. We all had our designated weapons of choice. I was the shotgun specialist with an axe and no regard for the law. Near the end of our struggle to escape, we came across an ammo supply shortage during our biggest battle yet. Thankfully we never lost our morale due to the constant *BUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRR* our trumpeter played, both to keep us from retreating from the robot scum and to strike fear into their hearts. We started to take casualties due to having to make the fight more upclose and personal, but we never stopped the trumpet. The trumpet is a symbol of freedom, of hope. The last one of us starts to make a break for it towards our safe zone, littered with traps and stocked full of supplies. Not once did he let up on that trumpet. At this point it was just so that the robots wouldnt lose track of him into our turf. The trumpeter makes it into the ruins of a large building surrounded by small walls, filled with bear traps. This is the last stand. We need to let the world know. He climbs to the top of the pile of rubble in the center of the ruins and... *BUUUUrrrrrRRRrRRrRRrrRRrRRrrRrrRRrrRR*. Robots stepping on traps left and right. Never once letting go of that trumpet. Never once giving up hope. Not once will we let up on the trumpet. Not once will we stop taunting them with our freedom. The last trap is sprung. A robot dog dashes up the rubble and tackles the trumpeter off of the top.

The battle is over, but we've left our mark.

10/10 would trumpet again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972520200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1445005019}
review:
Le 15 Octobre 2015 :

___ Le but du jeu (solo) :

R√©cup√©rer tous les fragments d'une pierre se situant au centre de l'√Æle centrale.
Survivre et visiter les 4 √Æles qui entourent l'√Æle centrale.
A priori 2 fragments respectivement sur l'√Æle Nord, Ouest, Est et Sud.
La carte est recouverte de robots qui vous traque et le nombre de ces derniers augmente au fur et √† mesure que vous raporter des fragments au centre de la map. 

___  Les plus :

- L'ambiance visuel et sonore (m√™me si pour cette derni√®re on peu pr√©ciser que la musique est trop peu pr√©sente)
- L'aspect graphique/artistique du jeu

___ Les moins :

- Plantage au chargement de map
- Jeu non optimis√© ; moche de base et pourtant consomme beaucoup
- Sensibilit√© de souris carrement wtf ; tr√®s tr√®s lente au menu + inventaire et tr√®s tr√®s rapide √† la vis√©e in-game
- Escalier bugg√©s (biome Castle dans les tours)
- Rechargement revolver wtf (chargement de 6 balles pour un remplacement d'une balle)
- Impossibilit√© de mettre en racourci inventaire les talisman (bonus in-game du type "etre invisible pendant X sec.)
- L'inventaire carrement pas pratique (cause de 50% des morts du jeu)
- Touches bugg√©s en mode multi (je pense aux A et au E pour se pencher par exemple ; mais il y en a d'autres)
- Pas de chat vocale en multi.
- Il faut re-r√©gler les options en multi ; le solo et le multi sont dif√©rienci√©s et donc les options ne sont pas synchro.


__________

Conclusion :

Le jeu donne envie mais au final c'est plus un simulateur de randonn√© qu'autre chose.
En solo on s'ennui vite d'autant que la dificult√© du jeu est bas√©e sur un gameplay tout mou et mal foutu.
Le jeu nous occupe un apr√®m mais pas plus en solo et pourrait occuper une bande de pote en multi  ; mais pas plus.
En multi c'est du gros WTF ; les gens se co sur les serveurs, ils recup√®rent du loot, tirent dans le vide et au final se d√©connectent avec le stuff. Pendant se temps les robots sont bugg√©s et tire dans des buissons √† l'infini.
Au final personne ne va r√©cup√©rer les fragments pour reconstituer la stone au centre de la map.
Inutile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014467862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1444882615}
review:
To be honest I expected much more of this game. Its okay If I were to rate it out of 10 I would give it a 5, why? because the game is quite boring after an hour or two. 

The stealth mechanic is okay not the best but good enough you will find tall grass to be your best friend. The "Distraction" system for me was fantastic and the most fun for me when playing this game, using items from simple bottles, to alarm clocks, toy trains etc...  to distract enemies was quite entertaining. The enemies themselves are funny looking and fit the theme, and you discover new enemies throughout your journey.

The objective is quite dull, you must collect Fragment pieces of the "Device Teleporter" and bring it back to the special Stone circle, the fragments themselves are scattered throughout the island, that being said the fragment pieces take up 16 inventory slots and its quite irritating having to travel back and forth to dump them at the stone to get rid of them.

The Landscape is okay but it tends to get quite repetative with structures. The looting system is a bit of a letdown for me, to obtain loot you must press "F" on a door and it has items (Occasionaly barrels etc..) there are no interiors for any building aswell which is quite stale. not to mention the textures of the building are of low detail which is dissapointing for this day n age, considering the environment looks better then the structures...

You don't sprint in this game, you jog.

*Multiplayer*: The Animations/Character model are quite lame and looks like they were put together in 10 minutes, not to mention the character customization is completely useless (You can only change hat n shirt). The Running animation in this game looks completely bonkers, just take a look at your buddies when they're sprinting around like goofs.

The game itself is okay, playable for a "few" hours before it becomes completely stale, that's pretty much all I have to say about "Sir you are being Hunted".

author: {'steamid': '76561198068918114', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1467612057}
review:
In a world where robots hunt humans... a freak experiment has gone horribly wrong, putting you smack dap in the middle of the robot controlled islands! Now it's up to you to collect the missing fargments of the machine that sent you here. With little hope of getting home you must trek through rural coutrysides, destroyed castles, festering cities, and dark forests. But whatever you do, don't look back... because the robots and their robo-pups are hot on your trail. Will you find a way out of this Mecha-Hell, or will the robots turn you into swiss cheese?

Fantasticly orginial, graphics are viciously average at best but the gameplay makes up for it. The AI, unlike most stealth games, are unpredicatble and have very little pattern to their movements... making it evry hard to know what they're planning. In this "stealth" game, more often than not, I find my self running as bullets wiz by my body rather than sneaking through the shadows. The robots are funny to watch, yet deadly and horrifying. The gameplay is fun and original. The depth is there but don't expect some amazing plot driven game. Overall great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057395097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1444886110}
review:
I loaded it up, read through the character descriptions in the menu, set my keybindings, and watched the intro. I was fairly intrigured. But then I got in game.

There is a clear "goal" for this (collect all these missing parts) but there are what, 20 of them? In 5 HUGE sections? I couldn't even find one in about 30 minutes. If it is going to take me hours to find 1 part I don't want to even bother trying. On top of that, this goal isn't really satisfying and there are no shorter-term quests or anything so you lose track of objectives real quickly.

There are houses and stuff to loot, sure. I started out looting every single one. Then I realized that they are just randomized "chests" that give you the same garbage items 90% of the time (dead rat, broken plate, moldy bread, a rock). It is super time consuming to just go through one by one and loot every door when the reward is useless. My inventory filled up very quickly.

I got to a new area and finally found a pistol and a hatchet. Great. -Finally- some combat. I found some robots wandering. The combat was awful. Their AI is incredibly bad. You can walk right past them and they will be alerted and see you, but then they will take cover behind a house rendering them useless. They cover from you but end up making themselves do nothing since they are just hiding the whole time. There is no threat there. I ran out of my 6 pistol shots quickly and got bored again.

SUMMARY: this game just seems like a grind for the same objective over, and over, and over again. I don't see the gameplay evolving at all as you progress. Too boring for me. I will say the one thing I liked was the atmosphere. They definitely got the creepiness down. I enjoyed hiding from the hot-air balloons with spotlights, but that was about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064434403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1444867101}
review:
Wasnt much of a fan of this. I spawned in, literally took 20 steps to some nearby woods to search a shack, immediately got shot in the back by 5 robots.

Not much of an issue really seeing as how my save/spawn point was a stone's throw away.

Spawn back in, fucked off in the opposite direction of the spooky woods to a set of houses. I searched about 20 houses between the starting island and the East island and never found any kind of weapon...plenty of vitality foods and a few bandage, but no weapons.

The game says the worlds are generated in a way I would assume is similar to Dont Starve, but they are really open and bland.

Just doesnt seem to be my cup of tea, even on sale for only 2 bucks I dont feel much like wanting to play it more than I already have. If you can get past the open-ness with nothing to it and overall blandness, it seems like a solid enough game though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005164574', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1444841957}
review:
I realize that there's a HUGE score of strange, maladjusted gamers these days, who just LOVE extreemly hard, post doomsday, waste 1,000s of hours gathering B.S. to keep playing, so you can gather stuff for many thousands of hours to come... 

   ONE class starts with weapons, yes one out of like 5+ custom to choose from, then if you do happen to agro some robots early on... you can die when you run out of bullets, even though NONE of the bullets you shot them with hurt them even at all that I could tell. (This is offline it wasn't a cheater or anything online). 

 I saw this game in the Steam store, & though: [Hmmmm nice art style, steampunkish, this game claims to be humerous... MAYBE this game isn't like those other million, boring as watching grass grow, post-______ games, & it's on sale, oh well let's give it a try!]

   I spent I think $1.90 on this game, & I feel like I got ripped off! Buyer beware, if you actually have reflexes faster then a turtle, & expect your games' guns to aim/fire/etc. quickly, & effectively... then stay FAR away from this steaming pile of brown stuff, BUT if you thouroughly enjoy REALLY bad games, & want to spend more time hunting down easy resources like some mindless drone, then actually playing a game... this may be your cup of Joe! Seriously when I cannot kill one robot by shooting it with 10 rifle, & 6 handgun shots POINT BLANK, then the game is idiotic at best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045141765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1444837548}

review:
This game rewards you for your failures, by killing you mercilessly.
Over.
And over.

Don't get me wrong, this game is wonderful; It's just cruel and unforgiving.
I don't know how many times I've forgotten about that bear trap I put down hours ago, only to step on it and alert everything in earshot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995176775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1444835102}

author: {'steamid': '76561198129995083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1520328012}
review:
1 stone left to get home 10 health , havent saved in some time... Vitality is getting low but no food.. i see 3 robots 2 dogs and a ballon around a town..... possible salvation, i sneak closer but get spotted by the baloon i run for dear life i hear bullets robot sounds, and an unsteady buzzing i just run... ii run until i dont hear much then hide only to realise my vitality is now at 2.. i stand up to look for food and fast but all i can see are robots.. not too close i make way around them to the town to open the first door at vitality 1...... i found, a few dead rats.... i keep looking through doors and about 2 doors lateer i hear yet again more buzzing... but now my health is falling drastically from 10 to 7 to 4 i eat the rat out of desprateness only to find myself dead by a gunshot...................

10/10 would get killed again

author: {'steamid': '76561198034789289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1444810664}
review:
Hats off to you sirs and madames. This game is a bloody awesome spectacle of jiggery pokery. What what, cheerio, hip hip hooray for "Sir, You are Being Hunted." Graphics are a little ole school, circa 2007-ish. But what it lacks in sleek modern graphics it more than makes up for in addictive fun. Somewhat of a typical stealth game, but unique in its presentation. The complete lack of supplies makes this the ultimate challenge. You start with a handful of items, you pretty much have to figure out how things work for yourself, and you find so much useless junk that an empty bottle or rock you can throw suddenly becomes a great treasure. OMG, when you find an axe or a gun it's like the most epic loot ever.  

Basically you are a human (I think) trapped on a weird set of RANDOMLY GENERATED islands. How awesome is that for replayability. You look for these glowing meteorite-like rocks, then you have to lug them back to a certain location. So, no treasure hording, which I have to admit is very hard for an OCD dungeon sweeper like myself. You are constantly being hunted by clockwork robots with red glowing eyes, robot dogs, some weird stilt like creature, big ole robot constables, and more. You can stand and fight if you have weapons, but most of the time you have to use cunning and skill to sneak around them, distract them, or even lure them. 

Quite simply one of the better stealth games I have ever played. Simple, yet challenging. I grabbed it on sale for a pittance. But I would have gladly paid the full $20 if I had known it would be this much fun. I would easily put this up there with Thief, Dishonored, or any of the bad arse stealth games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044978911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1444808606}
review:
When this game first came out I really liked what I read/watched/heard about it. I finally bought it on sale for $2 and even had a friend buy it as well because multiplayer was a new feature. At first I was very excited. Sneaking around thruogh the tall grass and trying to lure some robots away from a smoldering item that you need to collect in order to win (there are quite a few of them around the map). After about 30 min I began to realize that there wasn't much more to it than that. Big empty fields with nothing to loot, houses that are just glorified item chests that you can't even enter, and dumb a.i. that are easy to just run away from made me really regret buying this game. 

TLDR;
The game looked like it was a lot of fun but turned out to be quite boring.
2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197968428238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1306, 'last_played': 1485044719}
review:
After only 2 hours of gameplay this game is easily one of the best games I've played this year. Its wacky visual estehtics are such a fun change of pace from the standard AAA visuals and the gameplay is stupendously addictive! I picked up 2 copies while it was one sale and I'm buying at least 2 more for friends. Can't recommend this game enough!

**As a follow up to my review, this game is still absolutely fantastic a few more weeks in. Its got such charm and with the procedurally generated content, there's literally millions of hours worth of fun here. Sir really brings me back to the glory days of the 90s with a huge emphasis on gameplay and yet it also holds its own against any modern shooter. Having an absolutely tremendous time with this game and I imagine I will for years to come. Probably the most fun I've had in a multiplayer/coop shooter since Left 4 Dead!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004535810', 'num_games_owned': 959, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1445686439}
review:
A simple stealth game about trying to collect the peices of your dimensional portal thing after an accident in your lab sends you to a world in which humans are hunted for sport by murderous, brittish, gentleman, robotic, hunters. They will send forth killer wappy dogs to track you down. Some of them sit high up in spotlights mounted to balloons, always on the lookout for the elusive creature called man or sit astride rocket horses and attempt to ride you down. Some of them will lay out traps in an attempt to poach your precious human ivory. Some of the robots are only interested in guarding the ruined homes of the archipelagos previous residents while others are more interested in following you around like a horrifying neon sign that makes way too much noise. There are greater threats still, as some of these robots are great, hulking, malicious, monoliths who will pursue you until they have pulped your corpse with the tip of their great cane.

It's a good game for killing some time and with multiplayer, it's even better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018016709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1590014729}
review:
Pros:
*Varying enemy types are quite interesting and their introductions are well-paced throughout the game (this can be configured to the player's specifications - I speak mainly of the default settings)
*Combat is balanced well enough - meaning that you while you can pick off a group of two or three hunters, anything more is a fool's errand and will attract too much attention in any case, forcing you to be stealthy for the majority of the game
*The game's atmosphere is great for creating tense moments, especially when hiding or evading pursuit
*Limited save system is effective in making you carefully consider any risks you take

Cons:
*The game gets repetitive by the third island - you won't change your playstyle much once you've got a gun, ammo, food
*Fragment placement can be quite stupid - one of the perils of a procedurally generated game - I found that often, fragments would spawn within sight of island entry points, incredibly near each other, or in one jaw-clenching instance, in an inccessible location, forcing me to abandon my first run, and on the very last fragment to boot
*Fragment detector makes the game go way too fast - starting with one on my second run after the aforementioned doomed run made that run last under two hours
*Survival elements may as well not exist - I never had to cook meat on a bonfire and was never in any sort of danger of running out of food, even with bare minimum scrounging
*Distraction items were never useful enough to let me avoid a fight at a guarded fragment
*While the game mechanics are robust enough to pull off many sneaky tricks (allowing the Squires to fight for you, setting and baiting traps for unwary robots, setting bonfires to draw attention away from guarded areas) none of them are really more practical than finding a good hiding place, waiting until there's only two guards and/or a dog, attracting their attention, strafing to avoid their first two shots, then giving them a buckshot sandwich while they reload, grabbing the fragment, and running away

Overall? It's worth the time I put into it, just don't expect to get more than 4-5 hours out of it. Buy it on sale or in a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970401790', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1694595849}
review:
Would I recommend it? Yes!

But it's not my cup of tea. I expected more exploration and deeper management to the survival, but this seems to be a very distilled experience. Houses cannot be entered - they are merely things to hide behind and their doors are loot windows. I expected to feel drawn to explore the place more, but quickly felt like I had a very set and strict goal - to find the lost machine pieces spread around the world, and everything in the world was just things to hide behind or find some ammo or health in. Meh.

The atmosphere is really something, though. The little I played (which must have been more than 1.3 hours?) had me really feel absurdly alone in a world where intelligent beings were hunting me for light entertainment. Weird feeling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011476285', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1591450063}
review:
The game is nice, but there's a a lot to improve yet...
What makes me angry at the moment:
- Saving system. Really? Do I need to run through whole island (which are f****ing big) to save the progress? This is ridiculous. I can't play long, because I'm scared that I will have to end without saving the game!
- Music is really poor.
- World sounds are even more poor. What I hear are only my footsteps and robots... But I can see rain, grass, wind, animals... It feels to empty.
- The plot... There's no plot at all.

If you'll get this game on discount (for example humble for 1$) you won't regret. It's worth this money at the moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976093583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1452539546}
review:
Fehlende Langzeitmotivation.

Von Robotern gejagt werden, aus Hei√üluftbalons und mit Robo-Bluthunden.
Klingt spannend. Ist es auch. Stimmungsvolle eher d√ºster gehaltene Grafik. Tag- und Nacht-Zyklen. Musik und Soundeffekte sind auch gut. Die Atmosphere wird wirkungsvoll aufgebaut und gehalten.

Leider passiert dann nichts mehr.
Mann kann keine Geb√§ude betreten. Schade, dabei sind eine ganze Menge da.
Die Bots in Fallen zu locken (was in dem Video cool aussieht) ist unverh√§ltnism√§ig aufw√§ndig, da sie dadurch nicht drauf gehen, sondern nur verz√∂gert werden. Es sind auch zu viele Roboter da.
Das das Inventar zu klein ist - kann ich verkraften.
Das die Map ein schlechter Witz ist - kann man dr√ºber hinweg sehen.
Roboter spawnen irgendwo in bereits ges√§uberten Gebieten - nervig.

Aber wo ist die Story? Wo ist mehr als schleichen, sammeln, ablenken oder schie√üen?
Der Survival-Faktor ist sehr klein - man nimmt erledigten Gegnern Essen ab, findet es in H√§usern oder erschie√üt Hasen/Rebh√ºhner.

Fazit:
Das Game ist kein Survival-Game. Es ist kein Shooter. Es ist kein Hit&Run. Es ist irgendwie alles, aber von Allem nicht genug.
Anfangs: Yeah.  Nach vier Stunden: laaaaaaaaaaaaaaaangweilig. Schade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254047554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1444337780}
review:
Ambiance sympathique, mais plut√¥t lent √† d√©marrer.
Dommage que la vitesse de d√©placement soit si lente, on met beaucoup de temps pour parcourir le monde.

Je le recommande √† tous ceux qui aiment les ambiances particuli√®res.

review:
A fantastic survival adventure with tea and biscuits.

Travel the grim Archipielago, a dark version of the different biomes found throughout the British Islands, filled with gentlerobots (yes, robots with moustaches, can it get any cooler?) that won't hesitate to shoot you on sight. Avoid the patrols, retrieve the pieces of the device that can get you out of the Archipielago, and try to survive!

Only recommended for true Sirs and Madames!

review:

we have a shotgun with around 4 rounds per person
never managed to use mine against the patrols of 11 hunters

put my pieces into the stones
go free

author: {'steamid': '76561197984505368', 'num_games_owned': 1529, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1443661213}
review:
I'm recommending this on the basis you it does what it says on the tin.

If you like the idea of being an English gentleman/woman being stranded on an archipelago surrounded by robots trying to kill you - this will please you enormously.

It nails the atmosphere and mood - the game plays as you'd expect - it has charm (and tea!) in spades.

Only downside - it's a bit unfair in places and you can get very, very lost - very, very quickly.  No mapping is a massive error in a game which reuses assets/generates worlds (no useful landmarks!)

After a few runs I found myself with getting totally lost or surrounded by enemies with no way of passing them - the randomness of the game is working against the chances of having any fun/making the challenge a bit - well - random.

The concept is there 100% tho - it's just that it really, really needs some sort map tool and maybe offer more tools to get around robots because - well - it often gives you no choice but to have to do that!?

author: {'steamid': '76561198093148511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1443345146}
review:
One day I was walkin' 'round town when I saw a bright green glow in the distance. I thought to myself, "What could that be?". As it got closer, I saw that it was a robot. I noped myself out and ran away, only to have my anus penetrated by a stray screw from the robot.

7/8 would be 8 but anus hurts

author: {'steamid': '76561198003823257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1444002107}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197997715158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 462, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1691367640}
review: This game is actually thrilling. You start with nothing, surrounded by groups of hostile robots, looking for you. Every noise you make, every time you set a campfire or scavenging for food and supplies, you are running a great deal of a risk of being spotted by these guys and let me tell you, it won't be pleasant at all. So, play smart, stay hidden and su—Å–∫er-punch them when they less expect it, it's the only way to survive in this game.

review:
I wanted to go to the UK before I played this game and realized it was overrun by Victorian robots hunting humans for sport. Humans who must live off the land and scavenge through various depopulated foggy islands.

Now I want to go even more.

10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061775540', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1468728409}
review:
I'm sure the game is fine. I'm sure it's fun if you could play it, but unfortunately, you cannot.

I have a decent computer and even on low graphics this game runs like a dog with one leg. The highest framerates I was getting was maybe 20, and I spent longer finding solutions to it crashing than playing it.

Nothing I found online helped, so as far as I'm concerned, this is a broken game. Not worth the dollar I paid for it on Humble Bundle.

7/16/2016 Edit: I have a better computer now and I tried running the game again. Still ran awfully, but I managed to get it to work. I thought I would give it another chance and see if the gameplay was actually any good since this time I could actually play it. Err, thought I could actually play it. 

I restarted the game Four. Fucking. Times. Every single time, I got a gamebreaking bug within TEN MINUTES. 

Tried to check inside a door, game froze. Jumped onto a rabbit, couldn't move, had to restart. Tried to climb over a fence, fell through the world. Tried to check inside another door, game crashed. At least it didn't freeze and force me to restart my computer this time!

So again, I am forced to say it.

As far as I'm concerned, this is a broken game. Not worth the dollar I paid for it on Humble Bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126939378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1440937880}
review:
A game for a sale ;)

Pros:
 - interesting concept, sneak through a world of british gentlemen robots that try to kill you
 - neat design, looks funny enough to me
 - everything works smoothely ... kind of an exception nowadays

Cons:
 - so far it turned out to be way too easy

Verdict:

I'm not sure on this one, I give it thumbs up as I haven't found a flaw in the game, but I have yet to hit a point where it got engaging. 
if you have the coin to spare for a little stealth game that is not too serious about anything, Sir, You Are Being Hunted is worth a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070910775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1442725861}
review:
Sir, you are being hunted.

Oh, what's this-- my inventory?  *BLAM*

Load from save.

Okay, hide behind that tree, open inventory.  *BLAM*

Load from save.

Okay, so it wasn't quite *that* quick but I have to admit being awful at this game. But that does not preclude my recognizing the game being of decent quality which is why I recommend it.  I am not going to badmouth it just because I'm not very good at it.

Pick it up, if it sounds like your style, and may your survival be longer than mine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056396175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1442287293}
review:
Short and simple: It's a survival game where you run and hide sometimes attack your enemies, find food to stay alive, and bandage yourself up. 

I don't dig this, but a lot of other people do. I don't see myself playing it again because it losts it's novelty almost immediately for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180947766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1491876837}
review: It is amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019022316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1580348248}
review:
This game is different. This game gave me nightmares and thats something ive not had since i was a child. 

Here you're a HG Wells type traveller (like The time Traveller but across dimensions not time?), and you really dont want to stay in this place you landed, its not a fun adventure,

I play lots of survival/horror type games and most are easy and a bit formulatic...."you gain experience from killing the enemy allowing to power up, then explore to loot to get weapons that really can wipe out legions of the enemy etc" But this is hard. Hiding in long grass, afraid to shoot a gun because it will draw in lots more hunters. Getting lost cos theres no map unless your lucky to find one so have to remember landmarks. Theres no crafting, only survival when you have to find matches to eat recently killed rabbits in the rain. And always hungry. Always hunted. Hoping to esape the Islands.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982448935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1530665635}
review: This game is amazing! Open world, survival, stealth killing.. and holy mackeral the robots can be terrifying at times! Seeing the rider come charging at you is panic enducing.. I highly recommend this game to everyone.. just keep a change of underwear handy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198317638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1843, 'last_played': 1563576831}
review:
Terrifying.

Hid in reeds until I got hungry. Ate a mushroom - satisfying for a moment, then the after effects kicked in.... while being hunted by robots is not the best of times to be eating those kinds of mushrooms.

Recovered from the mushroom..... moved on, ate a mouldy rat and some dubious eggs - bad idea.

Cooked a pheasant on a fire - happy times, decent food in inventory, but the smoke drew the robot hunters nearer.... not so happy times..... RUN!!!! BANG!!!! Dead... perhaps crawling away would have been the better option in hindsight.

No idea where I am going, stumble from small hamlet to small hamlet that all look alike hoping to find something other than dead rats and bad eggs. I just found a boat.... I'm off this island.... to another just the same no doubt... at least it is a save point apparently.

Challenging game that makes YOU the prey, stay low and quiet, you are being hunted.... 

Will eat pheasant stuffed with mad mushrooms again :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198073543873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1491273095}
review: I say, good fellow, this game is certainly worth a peek at. Nary a single instant did pass that I was not taken in by the pristine countryside, or quaking in my boots at the thought of the horrible automatons no doubt searching for me at this very instant! A thrilling and intriguing jaunt across fields, through forests and fens on a quest to retrieve the peices of your experiment gone pear-shaped. Alas, it all indubitably ends in death by maliciously programmed mechanical hunting chap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202383617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1508091000}
review:
Ever wanted to run from a giant robot with really long legs?
Ever wanted to eat a dead rat and not question what might happen?
Ever wanted to kill a tweed wearing british robot who is hunting you?
then buy this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198052311675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1667235334}
review:
I find this game like the opposite to other popular survival games there. While these games have complicated survival and crafting mechanics with boring enemies, Sir You Are Being Hunted is not so deep in the survival elements (you only need to take care of your hunger meter and your wounds) but the enemies are really funny to deal with. Robots can be challenging and they increase in number and type as you progress in the game. Combat is based on stealh, but don't expect something like Thief. It's just ok, but it works.

I would call this game "S.T.A.L.K.E.R. meets Slender" It's very atmospheric and tense. Does it worth your 20 euro? Mmm no, but if you find it on sale it is a great and fun deal. And the improvements they're adding to multiplayer (currently on beta) look very promising.

author: {'steamid': '76561198236713732', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1456477275}
review:
You have 2 choices: Be devious, sneaky, and never get caught by using gadgets to distract the bots. This is the smart option you should do if you want to finish the game.
Be ruthless. Murder every robot you see. A lot of fun, even though you WILL die a lot. This game makes most fights fair, but sometimes they become one sided. Never in your favor however. There will either be no advantage, or the robots have it.

I suggest you get this game. Its amazing. Good for both stealth lovers, and for those who like a good fight.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2302, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1522303659}
review:
A lot of games benefit from having random or procedural elements, but it never occurred to me to apply those principles to a stealth game. I always thought stealth games needed to be tightly tuned, with carefully-designed levels and sharp AIs on patrol routes. Sir, You Are Being Hunted proves that isn't the case, but also illustrates the flaws in such an approach. The result is challenging and engaging, though not without periods of tedium and frustration.

Sir drops you into the middle of five randomly-generated islands, each populated by murderous metallic monsieurs out for your human hide. A mysterious device brought you here from your presumably bourgeois lodgings, and is now scattered into 16 or so useless pieces across the archipelago. Each piece must be returned to the standing stones at the center of the center isle if you are to return home in time for roast phesant, but the robots are not about to let you off so easily. To aid in thwarting their deadly directives, you can scavenge items from the ominously ruined structures that dot the landscape. As you find more pieces though, the robots step up their efforts to include robo-dogs, scarecrow sentries, hot air balloons, and more monstrous machines to hunt you down.

The robots are the heart of this game, and they can be terrifying at first. Sure, they make conspicuous beep-boop noises as you draw near, but once they spot you with that heart-stopping bleep, you're in deep trouble. The 'bots are almost as fast as you and have rifles they are not shy about using. They also follow more logical search patterns than most stealth enemies, tracking you all the way to your last known location and then combing the area, making educated guesses about where to search from there. Most robots patrol the islands in groups, paying close attention to structures that can be looted but following and suspicious leads they find. Patrols can be avoided but there are always two or more clankers guarding the artifacts, requiring you to either come prepared with distraction items or a willingness to lead them away with your own sorry hide as bait.

You have two important numbers to keep track of, Health and Vitality. If either one bottoms out, you're not making it to tea time. Health regenerates slowly unless you've been shot, in which case you need to bandage yourself up using rags. Vitality drains over time with activity, and must be restored with food recovered from buildings. More intact buildings are more likely to have unspoiled comestibles, but they're also patrolled more heavily. It's worth mentioning you can't enter any of the buildings in the game, they just serve as giant loot containers. It's a bit of a blow to immersion and options for hiding, but other than that the loot system is solid. You have limited space to store weapons and traps, food and bandages, and any other interesting odds and ends you find. Some items have hidden uses as well, which adds an element of mystery and experimentation to the game.

You can only save at the standing stones or the boats to other islands, so you really have to think twice about risky moves. Stealth in this game is trickier than most, because movement and proximity have a much greater effect on how concealed you are than you might think. You're free to roam most of the islands at a brisk pace, but once robots are near your ass better be down in the grass, creeping along when they're not looking. It'll take time to learn how best to circumvent patrols but it requires a great deal of caution and patience, and slows down the game considerably. It's here that the procedural elements take their toll, sometimes plopping down patrols all around you without consideration for the stone walls or cliffs that funnel you into them. And if that doesn't happen you might be treated to huge tracts of empty land to scamper across in search of those faint wisps of smoke marking an artifact.

Is it a good game? Yes, but one you have to put serious time into. Finding 16 fragments across 5 islands is going to be a tall order, especially as patrols increase and stealth takes more and more time to get right. The randomization keeps the game fresh but can lead to unfair situations between patrols or artifacts in nigh-impossible locations. The sound design is on point with creepy ambiance and amusing voice work, but the graphics don't exactly impress or inspire. The nicest thing I can say about them is that they really capture the post-apocalyptic British countryside. Still, if you can settle into it and dedicate some time, it'll keep you on your toes for a good long while.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11322459/]curation page[/url]!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079625936', 'num_games_owned': 555, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 11, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1710121894}
review:
Sir/Madame, you are being hunted is a survival open world game with a simple objective on mind: Collect pieces of device and get out of the place, where british robots chase you.

A game doesn't need fantastic story to be actually pretty decent. The graphics look nice, the controls are responsive, the gameplay has variety, while keeping it simple and also posses one of the things I like; customization.
I can toggle on/off enemy showing signs or make my game harder by making robots be more common than ever through editing robots. You can also generate your own island by choosing what you want on it.

It feels nice to have limited and rare ammo, since I don't need to go all gun blazing back at them. And of course, there's always ax for anyone of lads who has hard time spending ammunition on pasky robots.
Play it for fun, you don't regret it. If you like resource management games with little bit of shooting and traveling, it's one game that should be tried.

4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198056902770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1442586250}
review:
You are being hunted: this is the main point of the game, and while it's a really good premise for the game it suffers from very glaring problems.

-the enemies can and will spot you from offscreen, combine this with almost no weapons and even less ammo and the game becomes unplayable.

-there is near to no music playing in the background during the actual game so i hope you already have some playing in the background.

-controller support is cluncky and full of bugs.

-the narrator sounds like he played with the volume button instead of using an audio editing program.

-general movement is slow and jumping is useless since you jump so low and enviroment objects are quite tall.

-the interface is intuitive enough but it feels dated and lacks flavor.

So grab this game while is on sale, it is a fair price only under 10$

author: {'steamid': '76561197996334028', 'num_games_owned': 811, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1687018116}
review: You know a game is good when you play for nearly 10 hours straight finish it and only want to play all over again.  Survival games are a dime a dozen these days so this one adds a refreshing twist of being about robots after you instead of zombies or whatever every other game on the market does anymore.  There's personality to it that cannot be matched.  Randomly generated islands with an actual goal that doesn't include just survive another day.  Those can be fun but having an actual objective helps a whole lot.  The tension of hiding in some grass as 10 robots are searching the area is incredible.  How to get this piece when you're out of ammor or dont' have any distraction items?  A survival game where stealth is the ideal solution is great!  I want more of this!  I want Big Robot to expand on this formula.  Make a sequel where the maps are bigger.  More variety in landscapes would also be nice.  Either way this is rather short but has limitless replay value.
