author: {'steamid': '76561198052011711', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1444784144}
review: This game is the literal definition of tense anticipation. Dropped down in the middle of an archipelago, you are forced to fend off endless amounts of dapper robots and their brethren while trying to hunt down fragments which are the key to your escape. This game utilizes a subtle element of fear which may seem unlikely for who you're up against (that being a hunting party of gentleman robots) but once you hear that first gunshot from behind you, you immediately start to think otherwise.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988374218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1399526401}
review:
You're going to die. You're going to bleed to death, you're going to starve to death, you're going to be shot with shotguns, or blugeoned with giant robo-canes, or gnawed on by vicious robo-hounds, or spmething equally unfair.

That's sort of the point though. This game isn't at all fair, and it makes that the central theme. You, Sir (or Madam) have been unceremoniously deposited in an alternate dimension. In Britain. Your interdimensional whatever has exploded all over five islands, and in order to get home, you needto find the smoking remains and cram them in to a conveniently sized hole in a magic rock.

Also, there are a lot of robots, and no people.

Robots have a pretty good idea what you want, and despite some clearly worded letters to the contrary they aren't inclined to give it to you. They'll do a pretty decent job of patrolling, on foot, in baloons, with robo-hounds, and they'll make a habit of frequenting the places where you find things you need to not starve to death or die from being mauled by robots.

As you retrieve the pieces of your gizmo, the robot hunt will intensify, adding new types of robots to the hunt and increasing their number.

Luckily, you have the opportunity to save your progress at the aformentioned magic stones, or at the boats that carry you between islands. You should do that, because you're probably going to die once or twice.

Aside from weaponry (which is pretty scarce) there are plenty of insteresting gizmos to spice up your experience including bear traps, fire, trombones, alarm clocks, toy trains, hallucinogenic mushrooms, and a slow of other useful or just fun to find stuff to help, hinder, or amuse you along the way.

I highly reccommend this game to anyone who enjoys a decent stealth experience, roguelikes, or those who like survival games like DayZ or Nether but don't appreciate the PvP focus found there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966721701', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1399225812}
review:
It's exactly what it says.  You're on a group of islands in the English countryside, where a bunch of robots dressed as hunters and gentlemen are stalking you as the last human alive on the island.  This isn't a shooter; you are prey.  Run, hide, ambush, loot, survive.

An interesting game mechanic (besides not allowing save-anywhere, which is as it should be for a game such as this) is that your health is constantly draining.  You need to eat to keep up your health, and you need to forage to get food.  This keeps you in constant motion and heading in new directions rather than camping.  A second mechanic which I haven't seen in a game before is that messing with inventory doesn't stop the world...do you finish moving your inventory around to pick up more loot, or do you keep an eye out for hunters?  It adds a decent sense of fear to the game.

I haven't played much of it yet, but it is unlike anything I've played before, and has a sense of whimsy to cover up what is essentially a horror/survival game.  Definitely a fun game.  Unlike how I normally play shooter-type games (slow, learn the ground, keep to defensible positions), this game forces you to take risks, to keep moving, to get out of your comfort zone.  It's done a good job of that and I hope as I learn the ropes that it will continue to be as enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067763384', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1470192685}
review: This game may be the scariest survival horror game I've played. Where as other horror games rely on jump scares and gore to scare you Sir, You Are Being Hunted uses a lingering fear of the robots searching for you. Great game. I can't wait for the full release. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198053175296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1448925739}
review: This game is fun. It's very stressful (ie when sneaking through the grass slowly so as not to alert your enemies, especially when the gigantic Poachers are nearby with Dogs) at times and also can be quite frustrating, and not in a good way. I understand this game is supposed to be difficult, but running away from enemies just sucks at times. When you have no weapon, and you're spotted, you literally have no choice but to run as fast as possible, and even at a distance your followers still hit you over. and over. and over. again with their shotguns, which at range suck, but still annoy the f*** out of you by making you flinch or ocassionally causing bleed damage that you must stop for a second to bandage. It's just seemingly impossible to get away from them unless you find a tall grass field to hide in, otherwise you're quite literally screwed. But oh man this game can be fun too. Finding the pieces isn't too terribly difficult, you can easily tell how many are left on which islands, and all you have to do is follow the little floaty spritey thingies and they'll take you to a piece which will usually be guarded by two Hunters (the most common enemy, carrying shotguns). Collect all of them and you're done.

Gameplay itself is just boring. I barely started playing the game and got bored. Robots are easy to kill, hot air balloon is easy to run away from after I got spotted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070918290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1506836542}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002871405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1399146163}
review:
A lot of great ideas put together into a game with a fundamentally bad structure. You run around islands collecting fragments and then lugging them back to the center. That's your objective. This means that you'll be going through the same areas over and over as you run back and forth like a courier to the centermost section of the center island. This is tedious, needlessly time-consuming, and not very fun.

There is a reason stealth action games have not historically been open world/sandbox games. When you have all the space you need to navigate, you can just avoid most dangers by taking a wide route around them. There is no tension 90% of the time you are playing. It's just running, running, and more running. The amount of time you spend not playing the game and instead running and searching from place to place is absurd. It's seriously as bad as an MMO.

There are plenty of other small issues: Houses and buildings don't actually exist, they're just gigantic loot crates where you can click on the door to search them. There are huge inconsistencies in what qualifies as grass you can hide in and grass that's just there for show. AI is not any more intelligent than in other games, even though the developers brag about it in the description.

Fortunately, most of these issues can be fixed post-release, if the devs pay mind to them. Change the objective of the game in some way so that we aren't running back and forth, make the entire world WAY more dense with both loot and enemies (so that players are never just mindlessly sprinting across an entire island), and add more stealth elements to the game than just hiding in grass or behind a building every now and then.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961533523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1455644492}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007107085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1399449227}
review:
So far I'm about half way through my first playthrough of S,YABH and I'am enjoying it quite a bit. it starts out a tad slow and I didn't really feel threatened but I imagin that is the point. as you progress new and more abundent enemies appear across the islands. Now, I am enjoying the game, as I said, but it is really not going to be a game everyone can get behind in my opinion simply because of the simplicity of the game, i.e. go here, grab that, come back, repeat. Sure you have to avoid all the enemies along the way and yes, that is quite a challange but thats it.

Now, I like it. I like how the game made me jump the first time I was shot at, how one of the ememies gave me chills and how stressed out I have constantly come to feel will slipping through the grass. My only real complaint is that sometimes the enemy seems to give up to quickly which seems to be because you can run much faster than most of them and are able to put a large ammout of distance between them and you; but a paniced flee from a few robots can quickly lead you to more, immediate danger.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983548320', 'num_games_owned': 3594, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1405185483}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CPwFUZQ3vGQ
Above is my video impressions of the game.

Sir, You are being hunted certainly has a lot of style going for it. It features unique visuals and design, as well as interesting open world stealth mechanics. The game is a sandbox when it comes to how you tackle your goals. Though the environment and character design are interesting and unique, it's not all smooth sailing. There are certain execution issues, most notably the low res, and dull textures. It is the one most dominant flaw with Sir, but other than that, It's an enjoyable game.

Positives:
- Randomly generated worlds offer more replayablity
- Unique theme, character, and environmental design
- The world feels large
- Strong stealth mechanics
- Challenging game play
- Good sense of humor
- Supports mods

Negatives:
- Low res and muddy textures
- Could be too difficult for some
- Depending on the generation of the world, it can some times feel empty
- Lighting is passable, but nothing special

author: {'steamid': '76561197971527463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1396647657}
review:
Superb! Excellent stealth mechanics (which many games try for and fail to deliver properly), smooth, good looking engine and all with a sense of humour.
With more of this kind of thing in the world we'll be back to an empire in no time.
Colour should be spelt with a "U" in it at all times.
Tea is for drinking, not throwing in rivers.
Software installs should have the option of "Proper English" or "Proper English"
The letter "Z" should be in very few words such as "Zebra"
The phrase is "I couldn't care less", not "I could care less" which is a nonsense as it clearly indicates that you care to some degree.
NTSC is a silly television standard.
DO NOT leave the house without your hat, cane and gloves and for GOD'S SAKE MAN, when you bring me my tea DO NOT slop it in the saucer, I HAVE TOLD YOU ON MORE THAN ONE OCCASSION.... now go and iron my copy of the Times and bring it to me in the study where I will be smoking my pipe and staring at a picture of Queen Victoria.........

author: {'steamid': '76561198009092397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1399231996}
review:
Jolly good fun! Play as Sir or Madam Squishy Meatbag as you leg it on splendid english countryside, ducking, diving, and hiding from dastardly mechanized (and well dressed) robo-englishmen.  Scrounge around for any nick-nacks to aid you in your quest of perilous escape not limited to weapons, biscuits, and assorted rubbish.  You will spend hours of rib-smacking good entertainment as you lie in the thicket pleading to an anti-robo deity you just made up at that moment to not get spotted by the party of 3 robo-gentlemen having a shot and a smoke 5 feet from your hiding location.  Writhe in empathetic agony as your character darts around a stone and uses an old discarded evening gown to bandage the nicely rounded hole in your chest kindly administered by a rather tenacious hunter.  Fun for the wife and kids!  Highly recommended.

Also don't trust scarecrows, I trusted a scarecrow once.  Don't do it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016125976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1422681528}
review:

I cannot recommend it at this stage because of the glaring problems that lie in the core structure and the Developers mentality. Even "it's an alpha" can't excuse some of the awful design decisions made by the developers,especially when it comes to core aspects of the game.

Not worth the money :(

02/2015
Ok one year later the game still sucks pretty bad. Nothing has changed! sad sad :(. what a shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043291439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1061, 'last_played': 1664774440}
review:
The one thing I thought when viewing this game was "Wow, this looks....different" However, when I bought it, I realized how much fun it was, even though I bought in early alpha. The intensity is non-stop. The entire time, you are searching 5 islands for the mysterious stone fragments, which then need to be returned to the center of the center island. However, with each stone found, the robot hunters become stronger. The game becomes even more intense when you hear the beeping of the robots, indicating that you've been found. You can run, or you can try to fight back with the little ammo you have in your shotgun. Be careful, because each shot you fire is very loud, and will attract many other hunters. The game features stealth with terrain, a visibility meter, vitality (which is hunger and thirst), a day/night cycle, building searching, looting robots, and many kinds of enemies. Overall, the game is horror in its rawest form: you, alone, with many wanting to kill you. That being said, the game isn't really scary, but extremely intense. I highly recommend it. 

9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197993375417', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1510366403}
review: In an era of stealth games that miss the mark, this game gets a rather lot spot on. For me, it scratches that hidey-sneaky itch that has proven elusive since the age of the original Thief titles. Sir is not without its flaws. A dabbling player should expect to die a bit and get put off without a robust dose of patence. The cartoonesque weapons contrast gauchely with the more realistic other objects (compare the trombone and the shotgun in the trailer). It is my expectation that better models will be added in time. And, granted, these are rather minor nits in an otherwise strong performance. Good show, Big Robot. Good show!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004899373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1575073883}
review: When this game first came out on Early Access it was already well rounded - in fact bloody brilliant and its only improved with the updates.  It creates great moments of drama, in a way only a sandbox or procedurally generated game can.  And at times it can be a superb tactical shooter given the options available to you.  For a gamer i'm long in the tooth and a bit jaded, but this game puts a big smile on my face.

This is an intense game! You will spend most of your time either hiding in bushes, running for your f****** life, or shooting and getting shot in return.

You can scavenge for food and supplies to keep yourself alive or to fight back against the robots. In this game you must find the pieces to a machine you built that exploded all while you are being hunted.

Each time you play is different because the world is procedurally generated so there's no getting used to the map and remembering where all the pieces are.

Would run again. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198048354386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1421434242}
review:
May 1st, 1897
My dearest player,

I have been on the hunting grounds for a long time and have been a witness to all it's changes. Wheather the changes benifited me or aided the enemy to my dismay, I have seen it all. It was a relentless journey that filled me with the upmost fear. Yet, depited my cowerdice, I still managed a brave face and went on my journey, and I enjoyed every step of it. When I was told the news that I was being hunted, I must say, I didn't take it well. THe grounds were plain and empty at first, but as the time went on, things begain to change. There was more to find each and evry day, as well as more to hide from. This hunt. This dangrous game. This sport of man verses robot. This was terrifing, yet exelerating. I don't know if it was because I've gone mad with the idea of a semingly difficult victory or if I just grew to love the sport. Whose to say really. My dearest player. How much I miss you. I wish I could wright you a whole novel of my adventures here on the hunting ground, but I must go. I can hear them coming ever so closer to me.

Keep good care of your self daer player
-The hunted (for now...)

review:
Amazing indie game! At first i saw the graphics and was turned off but then after an hour or two i became addicted. The trick to this game is to get a gun. Dont use the gun unless absolutely necessary, try to sneak through towns and collect loot. The goal is to find a finite amount of mysterious objects scattered across 5 randomly generated islands. 

Gotta say this game is a must play for indie fans

author: {'steamid': '76561198051067163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1500775148}
review:
This game has a simple goal. Only problem is an army of relentless robots aimed purely to stop that. 
Can you scavenge and survive.
Can you avoid the many roving robot patrols.
This game is addictively fun and perfect for anyone wanting something different.
Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053021376', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1473705222}
review:
"Sir, You Are Being Hunted"

The last words you hear before entering the game and the only real guide you have.
This game is a genre of its own, there are no other games like it on the market. Theres nothing like walking through a field in the dead of night and suddenly hearing strange robotic noises. you duck down into the grass only to see several automatons come marching past, you hold your breath praying that they didant see you, adrenaline rushing through your veins. you rumage through your backpack searching for something to defend yourself with. you find an empty bottle and toss it over the hedge line. your hunters turn and hastily march over to the source of the noise. you turn and run as fast as you can.

Dispite my description sounding as if you are helpless and defenseless you are really not, there are plenty of things to use to decieve and kill your enemy.

I would reccomend this game to anyone who loves hardcore survival games and people who love stealth games in general. it has amazing combat mechanics and stealth mechanics and is one of the most finished early access games on steam.

Sadly is has a few flaws like a complicated directions system and it can be very difficult to find good loot and food to keep your vitality alive, but dispite these flaws the game is still very playable and i have not encountered a single bug.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198081439394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1447370274}
review:
This is one of my all time favorite games, even though it is pretty short and can be done quickly, the atmosphere and gameplay make it all worth it.

Searching all alone for a way out of an old-timey and british i-robot scenario is made extremely entertaining with all of the various types of robots searching for you and with all of the things to do in the game. 

The game is slightly difficult and has a little bit of a learning curve, and you are really only given a slight nudge at the beginning of the game as to what you need to do. The developers and the rest of the team that made this game are extremely helpful and friendly and make the forums a welcoming environment.

If you enjoy stealth, suspense, a world to explore, whilst being hunted  by a bunch of gents in need of a spot of oil and repair, then this is the game for you. It's cheap and if it's on sale, I would call it a must buy. Again the game is short, but it's very fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972739270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1398402976}
review:
Let me assuage your fears: the game is good, and isn't half-built like other Early Access titles.
The difficulty progression is very solid, and the variety of robots is impressive (and keeps things from getting old). The map generation doesn't feel too predictable, and i never felt as if the game had put me into a no-win situation (which is impressive, for such a randomly/procedurally generated game). But it was a little weird to have to travel between islands - i would have preferred to have one giant island.

That said, there's definitely more work to be done before I could honestly recommend this as a gift for someone. More variety to the map set pieces would help a lot, as well as more variety to the items. It also wouldn't hurt to have higher resolution textures, i felt like i could fit my whole character into one texel of the ground's texture.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012683073', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1640123759}
review: When you get a gun, the hunters become the hunted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027207436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1467314346}
review:
A good example of a Early access game that is really good. 
It was launched stable and with some good content. It was updated once a month with lots of bug fixes and content. 
Now its close to release and its better than ever! 

This is a fun, challenging and scary survival game. You have an open world of 5 islands to explore and the objective is to find pices of fragments that will help you get out of there. Around each island there are robots roaming/guarding villages and the fragment locations. You can sneak past them, distract them and/or ambush them with different traps and weapons. 

The stealth system is great and there is a good viarity among the robots, Normal guards with shotguns, dogs, flying patrol units, cavalry, scarecrow, land owner and a few more that i dont want to spoil. (some of them are really creepy) 

The story is pretty cool, its nothing special but its not bad. 

Is this worth you money? 
If you like a challenging game where it will take you some time to learn what to do and how to do it, if you are playing for the survival feeling, not the Call of duty "run and gun" gameplay.. this is a game for you. 

Its not officially released yet, but for me its a solid 8/10.
When the Multiplayer arrives i will update the review.

EDIT: Its now released and its awesome! 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198063056022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1400994085}
review: A survival game with interesting elements I have not seen in a game before, it is easily worth the price of entry. Stealth/survival gameplay in a format that in my experience ended up feeling like a survival horror game. Gameplay mainly consists of looting towns while avoiding the hunters searching for you. A bit slow paced at times, but increadibly intense at others there really is not to much else to say. For those wondering about how much playtime you can milk out of this I would expect somewhere between 10 hours for those just looking for the casual toy, and easily over 40 hours for the hardcore that crave experiences such as this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968662214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1310, 'last_played': 1397177428}
review: It's a fun and challenging game, its come a long way from when I bought it and I still enjoy it. I'd recommend it to anyone who enjoys stealthy FPS games. I'd like to see additional content for the singleplayer game such as functioning buildings and perhaps some undersground areas (like the english tube system could be interesting) I enjoy the outdoor feel for the game but  I'd like to see less large open areas and more dungeon'ish content. You can easily sidestep most of the mobs without just a little patience and to me, it can get a little too easy. Overall, the game is fun and worth the investment and I'm sure the multiplayer content will extend its shelf like even longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009973965', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1398046253}
review:
Overall, a very fun, tense, and comical survival game.
The atmosphere feels perfect. Especially when the sun goes down and you jump at any sound that sounds remotely like a bleep and/or bloop. I've yet to find a gun through my few attepts but I've managed to get by with using rocks for distractions when I need to. Improvising should be something you should always keep in mind while playing. Your butler Walters also helps you get an idea of what you should be doing upon your first time playing.
There are a few things that can and WILL screw you over though. Such as the robot's pathing glitching into eachother...on one of the pieces you need to collect. The music (being very well done btw) is a bit of an annoyance. It starts playing when you need to keep your ears open when you've got your face buried in some shrubery and is completely silent when you're being chased.

If you can overlook the small problems/bugs you find in the game then I would say, buy it. you'll get a lot of fun out of it and you won't regret it. Unless they release a patch that breaks the game forever. Then I imagine you would.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004035331', 'num_games_owned': 3651, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1469690743}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994076906', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1477641399}
review: Sir, You Are Being Hunted is a great example of Stealth action games still alive! While not entirely 'Metal Gear Solid', for an Indie game and Early Access at that, Sir brings a great sense of insecurity and laughs. The stealth system is very great! And the enemy combat is quite difficult if you are completely un-armed(As in, if you don't have a weapon you should run!). This game gets it right with it's perfect blend of sillyness, stealth, and insecurity. I mean really, Stealth action AND looting!? Oh and one more thing, British. Robots. I EXTREMELY reccomend this game to anyone looking to get lost in a new world of fun, and steriotypical Britishness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004065946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1653756611}
review:
Originally this was a neat little idea but over time its become a real experience. First off, just put up with the voice acting... it is terrible but.. persevere. The thing is that when you get into this game it can really get to you. The atmosphere is fantastic, your heart will be beating out of your chest every few minutes. Your goal is so simple but its so open and long winded that it'll seem like a journey. You'll find yourself being the hunter and you'll find yourself hunted and each part of it is thrilling. Well worth... waiting for it to go on sale.

TL;DR: Fantastic atmosphere, rough around the edges, good for picking up during a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080686576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1501724322}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972422416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1480770949}
review:
Sir, You Are Being Hunted is a brilliant First-person-sneaker, set in a typically quaint British countryside populated with sadistic killer robots.

The game is definitely inspired by classic sneakers like Thief, and the focus is on using stealth and deception instead of brute force to fool the robots, and collect fragments of a mysterious device to enable your escape from the islands.

The five islands are procedurally generated, and are absolutely stunning, with beautiful sunsets, dark woods, and eerie moonlit moors. Everywhere the robotic voices of your pursuers pierce the silence, and hearing the thumping and screams of the Landowner approaching is a truly terrifying thing.

I highly recommend this game for anyone looking for a stealth/horror game which at times leaves you with heart beating, running like mad through the woods with crazy robots in pursuit.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996964031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1400449087}
review: Game had/has great potential, if it would ever start back up. Ever since my first play session, the game has refused to launch for almost a year, despite the many patches, reinstallation attempts, driver updates and the works. Until this gets fixed I'd stay clear.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081314074', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1408274476}
review: If you thought that Amnesia or Minecraft were survival games, you have no idea how wrong you are. Sir, You Are Being Hunted is a real man's survival game; you're pretty screwed as soon as you set foot into the world, being a posh wealthy person and all, with next to no real combat experience, you start small, only picking off robots when they're alone, and then you get cocky, sooner or later the game will kick your ass and make you re-think everything. I would honestly recommend this game to anyone who thinks they have the balls or the brains to try it, but take my word for it, You Never Will.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964172037', 'num_games_owned': 1306, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1424499615}
review:
Sir is something like a British S.T.A.L.K.E.R., full of tea and English countryside and terrifying robots with monocles and pipes. Or maybe a DayZ, with a twist of Minecraft‚Äôs procedurally-generated landscapes, and a ton of tweedy charm. The environments are beautiful, and the robots are equal parts terrifying and amusing. Sir is everything that‚Äôs wonderful about systemic games, and I felt like a goddamn genius when I lured some robots away from a piece of the device by lighting a cooking fire, then snuck around behind them to grab the piece and bugger off.

I really, really like this game, but I have two concerns. First, ‚Äúcollect the MacGuffins‚Äù is becoming overly familiar as a goal in procedurally-generated games. Second, and more complicated, is that procedurally-generated games always make me feel like I‚Äôve seen pretty much everything I‚Äôm likely to see, far earlier than their promise of endless variations might suggest. While the environments are never identical, variations that feel significantly different are fairly rare, and the nature of procedural generation means you‚Äôll mostly see stuff that falls within a certain band of stuff that looks much the same. It‚Äôs nice that the monkeys occasionally produce some Shakespeare, but the truth is, mostly they don‚Äôt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042981969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1478204967}
review:
I have been wanting this game more than anything since I came across Big Robot's first preview video on youtube all those months ago. Welp, I finally got round to buying it today and I've fallen into it's grasp already.

Sir is an exceptionally fun and entralling play, from the moment you step into the world you find yourself tingling with excitment at all the possibilties that lie ahead. The world is procedurally generated mind, under 5 different categories, so every player has a vastly different experience, which really builds on the excitement. 

The British touch is terribly amusing as well, and really adds a unique feel to the game that I have yet to experience elsewhere. In fact, the whole game is original to that same extent. From the simplistic yet gorgeous scenery; to the merciless droids that prance around in hunt for you; everything about this game is truly one of a kind.

All in all, 'Sir, You Are Being Hunted' is an excellent game. It's intense, un-nerving and heart-poundingly thrilling, but, by the same token, tranquil, soothing and beautifully scenic. It all depends where you are, and what you're doing, and I can only suggest one thing... that you purchase it now and dive into the world yourself, unlocking the exclusive, unique experience that lies in wait for you, and you only.

10/10, a real MUST buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111381413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1440941959}
review:
Take a simple survival formula (food drains slowly over time, full belly means health regenerates, empty belly means health drains), some spot-on first-person stealth, incredibly limited supplies and a huge set of randomly generated worlds. Now add incessantly British humor and unbiquitious robots with tweed vests. With shotguns. Hunting you.

"Sir, You Are Being Hunted" is the singleplayer equivilant to Day Z, with much better gameplay and vicious AI that is all-too willing to fill you full of bullet holes. The terror of finding a weapon and realising you only have two shots for five enemies, or holding your breath as brit-bots search for you in a feild of tall grass is an incredible rush, and the victory of outsmarting a patrol and nicking their supplies with nothing more than a pair of binoculars, an alarm clock and a thermos of lukewarm tea is wornderfully satisfying.

Quite so. A full recomendation, good chap!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991997389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1392571940}
review:
A refreshing & alternative take on the "lone wolf survivor" genre - which (if you include co-op survival games) has essentially been overdone in recent times.  The core element of the game is to survive.  Loot, sneak, kill, repeat to paraphrase a popular song of 2013.  

The thing that impressed me the most about the game was the environment - the randomly generated areas are great and depending on where you are (industrial, moors, mountains etc.) you will have a different experience dependant on how easily you can get from point A to point B, who you may or may not encounter along the way and how much cover you might be afforded.

The humour is another element of the game which is great, from the robots screaming "Ah! me leg" when they're caught in a bear trap, to the ability for the player to set up an alarm clock or a model train set as a distraction, the game will both surprise and humour you.

Would easily recommend it to someone who is jaded with the whole zombie scene of survival games or is a bit of a steam-punk fan - or they just want a fun & humourous game.  Whatever way you look at it, Sir (or Madame), you are being hunted is a bit of fun and you can make it as casual or intense as you like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111286397', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1682230015}
review: This is THE definite survival horror game. While it seems easy at first glance, it soon becomes a nightmare. You think tweed wearing british robots are not scray? YOU ARE DEAD WRONG!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062015974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1537690108}
review:
Stealth and survival game unlike any other.

DayZ als Solo Spiel, mit Roboter-Steampunk Setting, gemischt mit einer Prise britischem Humor. Wer Stealth und Survival mit knackigem Schwierigkeitsgrad mag, sollte einen Blick drauf werfen. Grafik und Atmosphere sind fesselnd, vor allem f√ºr ein Indie-Spiel. Normalpreis ist ok, bei einem Preis unter 15‚Ç¨ auf jeden Fall zuschlagen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053697383', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1571429715}
review:
This is by far one of the best, if not the best, open world/ sandbox survival game I have ever played.  Despite having a few performance issues on maximum settings which should be expected for an early stage game (The lowest drop I have gotten is 38 FPS).  The art style fits the lore perfectly, and the suspense is thrilling.  This game is one of a kind, and one of the most genuine games I have ever played. Keep up the good work Devs, Im loving it.
8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197987326605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1389457772}
review:
The game has potential which might grow into something beautiful in the future. However at this moment the game feels clumsy. Mouse movement feels unnatural and combat feels empty. I am interested what multiplayer will bring however.
Buildings are not visitable, rather they have an inventory. This to me breaks immersion.

Pros:
- interesting concept.
- nice setting.
- going to get multiplayer!

Cons:
- gameplay feels unnatural.
- can't go into buildings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047379356', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1394614072}
review:
alors , il faut savoir quelque chose sur "sir , you are being hunted" c'est que c'est un jeu assez sp√©ciale qui ne plaira pas a tout le monde , je m'explique :
le concept est sympas , en gros , c'est de "l'infiltration en campagne" , vous avez une archipel de 5 √Æles , vous pouvez choisir le type de l'√Æle( par exemple "rural" pour campagne "industrial" pour industrielle "mountain" pour de la montagne etc‚Ä¶¬†) en d√©but de partie , et vous aller √™tre l√¢cher dedans , votre objectif ? VOUS BARREZ A TOUT PRIX , le moyen ? , ramasser diff√©rente roche violettes √©parpill√©s autour des 5 √Æles ( √Æles bien sur g√©n√©r√©s al√©atoirement ) mais la t√¢che ne sera pas ais√©e parce qu'il y a des esp√®ce de robot bizarre qui vous chasse et vous cherche , donc : infiltration ( le combat n'est pas conseill√© bien que vous aller avoir des armes a feu ) on a aussi une gestion de l'inventaire proche de celle de r√©sident evil ( avec la limite de place ) et une pl√©thore d'objet plus ou moins utile 
graphiquement le jeu est pas terrible mais fourmille de d√©tailles. il faut √©galement pr√©ciser qu'on ne peut pas rentrer dans les maisons et que pour les "looter" il faut cliquer sur la porte

bref , un jeu de survie qui baigne dans une superbe ambiance de l'Angleterre du 19√®me si√®cle , apr√®s , a vous de voir si √ßa vous plaira ou pas‚Ä¶

author: {'steamid': '76561198084055545', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1493502060}
review: This game is pretty fun but kinda empty, as in there's not enough features. I reccomend getting it when its more updated, after all it's only in the alpha version. Still a fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993588787', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1503173609}
review:
I can really recommend this game.
Be warned. It is not intended for easily disturbed minds.
You are being hunted. There is a slight possibility You will be shot.
Be very sneaky about it. Don't be a hero. Heroes dies.
Sneak cowardly around. Found a gun? Think twice about using it.
The hunters are attracted to the sound, like mechanics are to the musk of WD40.
Now, then. Do You have the stamina and patience? No? Well, then. Step away from the game for a while, have a great day out in the sun, then come back to later.
If You are, on the other hand, a nerdrager, Keep someone next to You that can tell You that You MUST relax. Being hunted is stressful, but it is only a game. -A good stressful game, that is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012351789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1469911590}
review:
The most fun I've had in less than one hour with any game in living memory.

Decidedly British, jolly good.

Sneak around, locate the machine's fragments and return them to the standing stones so you can go home, hopefully in time for dinner. Simple enough, and yet it's not so easy as all that because, sir, you ARE being hunted.  :)

Worth every penny, or shilling as the case may be. And it's not even finished yet! We're still in Alpha!

It is a pretty game, at turns humorous and sometimes a little scary.

Original and refreshing.

Bravo! A+ 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197997224985', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1403317010}
review:
So why should you play this game?

Well the fact your being hunted by a bunch of tweed wearing, country gent Robots who like hunting a bit of game.(which happens to be Human). Its the survival open world thing, eat, shoot, set traps, find supplys and such. Still a work in progress but its shaping to be somthing. 

And I like that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083957418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1399341209}
review:
Sir is, in a word, brilliant. The concept may seem whimsical or a little bit ridiculous, but the game has its fair share of great moments. The thrill of finding your first weapon, downing your first robot... wonderful. The game works well, plays well, has a great variety of items and item uses to keep you entertained. The islands are fun to explore, the visibility system works well enough, and the game is not easy; nor is it overly difficult. It finds a good balance, and is one of the few recent games that works well with set save points.

Also, since it's early access, there are the occasional texture bug or whatnot, but for the most part, the entire game is very fluid. All I'd really like to see added are higher res textures, even more items (to add upon the already great selection available), more island environments and perhaps even more islands eventually. Definitely pick this up if you have the chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118948372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1453573083}
review: This game is really fun. It has so many great aspects, with stealth, fps, and survival. I don't really like horror games, but I love the way this game is incredibly tense, but with no jumpscares or mutated zombies. It is in beta, and thd game is quite laggy on my mac, but the devs are always adding stuff and improving it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033628676', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1507573194}
review:
First I like to say "It's time to kick ass and drink a cup of tea, and I am all out of tea."
I would recommend this game to players who enjoy stealth type first person shooters(though none automatic weapons). It's challenging and the atmosphere puts you in the position of being a prey. At first it is scary in an environment where humans are replaced by robots. Once you are settled the fright factor is not vanished, but you know it's becoming a survival and a vengence game. Absolutely love it! I have just completed this game. Spent a solid 15 hours. It's like British Ninja vs Vintage Terminators. 

I have over 300 friends on my Steam and none of them has got this game and only 3 of them wants this. If any of you read this, buy it! Would love to have achievements on this! Anyway thank you Big Robot Ltd can't wait for new updates and keep up the great work =)

A truly gentleman's game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086162454', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1987, 'last_played': 1617833963}
review: Sir You Are Being Hunted isn't the average run and gun, blow everything up in your path type deal. This game really puts your stealth, strategic, thinking skills to the test in all ways possible! If your a person who likes to be a ninja stay in the shadows of the night grab all the loot and get out of town without being detected than this is a game for YOU!! Don't worry if you like running and gunning than it wont be your favourite game but if you stick with it long enough and save your ammo you might be able to go on a killing spree!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! thanks for taking the time to read this and hope you buy the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041446221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1420007027}
review: Don't be fooled by this game's silly title; it is SCARY. Not because its dark or the enemies have their intestines hanging out, but because of the amazing sense of apprehension and fear it manages to build with minimal sound or graphic complexity. There is something about being hunted by robots with guns, horses and dogs that makes you feel powerless and weak. However, this is probably the game's negative too: it can be quite frustrating when you have 2 shotgun ammo, a rock and alcohol to survive 10 robots (this happens often later on if you're not stealthy). I would like to see mod support added (not sure if it is possible with Unity), some more biome options (there are greyed out "edit" buttons so I assume its coming) and maybe customisable difficulty (like robot spawn rates, robot health, accuracy, and senses). Overall, this Early Access game has to be one of the best on the system. It has tension, 19th century guns and plenty of British accents. Definitely worth $15 - $20.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995642936', 'num_games_owned': 1006, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1101, 'last_played': 1680288084}
review:
Some of the loveliest landscapes I've seen in a game - I believe the best depiction of UK rural landscapes I've ever seen. I love games that, rather than tell you a specific, same-every-time story, creates instead a responsive environment and allow the stories to emerge from player interactions. Once you get the basics down, you will find you have stories to tell. And with random, procedurally-generated islands, you can revisit and revisit. And because the game is so open, you can play pretty much however you want to. Tempted to do a "traps and axes" playthrough next.

Right from the first Alpha build it seemed complete. Everything that's subsequently been added has built upon the experience, in both aesthetics and gameplay. They are pretty much done, now. One more mob to add and one more biome, then a balance. Co-op(ish) multiplayer to follow. That should be fun - multiple players all working towards the same goal, but only one can escape...

So yeah. Get some.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973800026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1398625190}
review: For pure inzanity (Insanity + Zanyness) no game is better. Prepare to be tracked and hunted down by tweed and kilt wearing robots in the Scottish countryside. But also be prepared to be murdered by all sorts of craziness, from a robot dog, to a giant robot kraken all while living on a diet of pickled eggs, fruit cakes, and tea. But watch out for the hot air balloon pilots, they'll get you good.

review: If you have an irrational fear of robots, love survival horror and consider yourself a patient gamer - look no further.  The game is a work in progress, so don't expect to be blown away by fantastic visuals at the moment.  The situation you find yourself in paired with a dark atmosphere is compelling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061622819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1532817974}
review: This is pretty good for a game in alpha, yet it has a lot to have done to it. Such as, the graphics seem far from finished, yet the artstyle is engaging and interesting and feels like it will get a lot better in the full game. The AI is good, but it doesn't interact with the enviroment very well. For instance, the enemies will get stuck, and occasionally see you through the enviroment you're supposed to hide in for no reason at all. It gives a not-so-much "horror" atmosphere as much as just being tense and suspenseful, you feel like you're always being watched. Overall, this is a good game with an intuitive artstyle and and a good feel to it, and I recommend buying it if you're looking for something "different".

author: {'steamid': '76561198045966854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1443135766}
review:
Sir, You Are Being Hunted is a british robot adventure, that can make you at times jump out of your skin. So what has it got going for itself?
Sir, You Are Being Hunted is an Action Stealth game being created by Big Robot Ltd. In the past, they have created a game under the name of AVSEQ. To say the least, it was a mixed opinion. Now this has come out, and to say the least, AVSEQ can't even compare towards SYABH. In the game, you are stuck on a total of five islands. You require to collect some artifacts, bring them to the central location on the map, and use them to save progress. The game is beat, when all the artifacts are located, and used. To keep you from completing your target, a good number of robots will try to hunt you down, and shoot ten shotgun shells into your skull. Charming to say the least. While avoiding them, you must also find food to stay alive. These three concepts mix together to create the enviroment you will be in, and it works amazingly. You have to keep so much on your mind while you explore this world. Where is that robot? How hungry am I? What caused those crows to fly away? It really keeps you on your toes. At the moment, enemy mixture is decent, but not all content at the moment is final, considering its early access. 

Gameplay. A big part to say the least. The game is mostly stealth, so you will be crouched most of the time. Noise and visibilty is view by a eye and noise icon at the bottom of the screen. Stealth works nicely at the moment. You feel any action COULD have its problems. Anything noisey will cause the robots to invesigate, which could be your death, OR your key to survival. Distractions become a big part of the game when the robots just wont cooperate to move away from a location or something along those lines. A well placed alarm clock or even a toy train will divert their attention just long enough so you can complete your task. However, keeping in mind, I said this was a ACTION game. At some instances during your looting of buildings, guns or ammunition will be found among the skulls and mouldy bread. Your options now open up a bit more. A problem could be controlled, a divertion could be caused, or you could simply run and gun. The last option is NOT recommended. On a personal note, at times i have played this game in the pitch dark. A few encounters have made me spoil my boxers to say the least. My point is, under the right conditions, you can turn it a bit into a horror. 

As a sum up, this game is great. More than that really. Exploring these vast wastelands while worrying about all the issues has never felt so good. Even a few times, this game has made me chuckly due to the slight humor. (Robots taking a tea break to say the least is one of them.) I really recommend getting this game, and as time goes on, more content will be added. As of writing this, i have not even tried the January Patch yet! There is nothing more to say that this really:
GO.    BUY.     THIS.      GAME!             8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198022108691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1419406546}
review: Equal parts silly and scary, this game is loads of fun even if it is a bit unpolished. As the description says it is you, on a small set of islands, being carefully hunted by a never ending supply of well armed (and dapper) robots of all shapes and sizes. You scavenge for food, lay traps, and learn to dread any and all electronic noises as you search the islands for a number of stones to make your escape. Despite its somewhat goofy premise this is very much a survival horror game with enemies that are both fiercely intelligent and almost omnipresent. There will rarely be a time in which firing your gun won't leave you with a sense of dread, knowing that it's going to bring every hunter within a halfmile jogging towards your position. I'd almost call it remniscient of DayZ, only with a brutal AI instead of other players. If the concept sounds at all interesting to you I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968458254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1391558118}
review: I do not see the appeal of this game. It's boring, and you die of starvation all the time. You can't carry crap, and can't fight. The stealth mechanics are ridiculous, and once you are found it's all over because you can't run without them finding you. I found very few redeeming qualities about this game, except that I got to eat dead rat.. So there's that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005581490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1387940273}
review:
Have you ever had the irresistible urge to go on a scavenger hunt? What about walking aimlessly around an island for a long time? Or do you enjoy encountering robots with the aim of storm troopers? Do you enjoy games that don't challenge you at all? What about games that become repetitive on your first playthrough? If you answered yes to these questions not only are you lame but you will also enjoy (insert your gender with a fancy flare), You Are Being Hunted.

Note: Just because I don't recommend this game does it give you the right to thumbs this comment down you ungrateful bitches. Yeah, everyone that has actually reviewed this game gave it a thumbs down and everyone else who bought this game and realized they wasted 20 bucks rates those reviewers down just to make themselves feel better and that they actually made a good choice on buying this game. Let's be completely honest with ourselves! This game is 20$ I beat it in around an hour on the hardest difficulty and that's that. I'm done with it! There's no replayability and even playing the game for one play through got repetitive! You literally just walk about and pick up god damn thermoses! It's a novel idea but implemented to a degree of shit that makes it look like the Harrison administration actually accomplished something, it's ridiculous!

review:
The setting is cute, the world looks amazing and the robots genuinely terrifying. However all interaction is extremely clunky--particularly packing one's inventory. Still, I persevered (the game is very hard). There were new worlds and new monsters, but nothing unexpected happened. Lost interest.

Do I recommend this game? As it stands, no. This game could be fantastic when it's finished, but it's not yet.

Edit: To clarify, I played about 10 hours (but wasn't connected to Steam).

author: {'steamid': '76561198039474885', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1454993059}
review:
Having just finished the game no more than an hour ago, I felt it appropriate that I write an honest review. "Sir (or Madam), You Are Being Hunted" is a 'procedurally-generated' first person shooter, set in a hilariously extreme British world, where robot gentlemen hunt humans for sport.
The game does a lot of things right. The setting is unique, as is the plot. Your job, as the human, is to survive against the robotic apocalypse and track down fragments of a teleportation device that will get you safely out of this 'tweedpunk' nightmare. There are 25 fragments, scattered across five islands. If and when you are caught, the robots will not hesitate to shoot. Should you lose all your health and fall to the ground, you'll be sent back to the place where you last saved.
An impressive array of weapons awaits you, however, should you pick and choose your battles wisely. There are weapons ranging from the close-encounter woodcutter's axe to the fine hunting rifle, along with a pistol, shotgun, and blunderbuss. Ammo is scarce, and should be conserved.
Along with ammo and weaponry, there are foodstuffs and bandages. If you've ever played Minecraft, you understand that eating food doesn't refill your health. It refills your hunger, which when close to 100%, heals your health. Sir, You Are Being Hunted is very similar. As you traverse the British countryside, your vitality will drop. Eating food will raise that, which will in turn raise your health, should you be recovering from an encounter.
tl;dr, This game is great. You'll laugh, you'll jump, and you'll have a heck of a lot of fun. I totally recommend this game, to anyone who enjoys stealthy shoot and loot type games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063470294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1574194319}
review:
no, I'm not going to tell anybody if (s)he should buy it or not. but if i could, i would give it back

why?
-well, the saving system is realy bad. just on boats and at the circle

i couldn't go on, why? there are two devices-fragments, with two groups of robots one in a forest, the secound at the border of that forest and the pretty plain fields. if you go to one of the two spots you also have to be aware of the group of hunters with the dog and the robot-hunter-guy in the forrest. how should i say, random or not, there are with the solo-hunter 9 robots at the same spot and a little village in noise-range for some more.
the first try, after my dead was nice: returning, killing the solo with the hatchet, between the small gras spots near to the plain-fragment, because of the scarecrow and the "i see you" i have to attack with the second group in my back, but well i could run.
killing the two robots with my hardly saved ammo and run like hell... well the dog is faster.
second turn, again crawling to the spot, again killing the solo with the hatchet, this time i'm starting with the forrest spot, more hiding options. sneak to them for an hatchet-kill... well there comes the hunting-party with the dog again... third try
finally killing the plain-group, ready to pick the fragment up and run like hell... well this third time i forgot to empty my inventory for the fragment => there comes the party, death
fourth one, sneaking to the spot, kill the solo, so i could hide my stuff in the little shack in the woods, again sneak to the plain group, well this time the hunting party is crossing my way to soon. death
...
i try and i try, several times, the fighting and sneaking is funny and cool but well, the running to it, hidding the stuff, 20 times or more is getting really annoying. i'm sure, if i could save right there or at least at the shack, it would be ok. i would try it 40 times more, because i bought the game for sneaking, planning, trying and fighting. but the hole running part to it, because my next savepoint is the circle... that sucks, really it sucks.

-the bleeding
two shots dead, ok. that is ok, but two shots nearly dead win the fight, open the inventory and bleeding kills you, that sucks.  i died several times after wining a fight (with sneaking, running or a combat gun vs. gun) because i was to slow with the inventory to stop the bleeding. if somebody shoots you down to a few hp-points you could give up, because you need real luck to be quick enough with the inventory

-the inventory
remindes me to diablo I and this stuff, you have small space, could only sort it out while the game is running and you could get killed all the time and don't have a quick-sort-button. not the big deal, but if you find out the fragment is big and you have to pick it up fast or die, it could be really making you happy, even if you die anyways, it give you the feeling there was a chance

The big problem for me is the saving system, you could handle even bad luck like a big group of robots on patrol around to fragment-spots with two groups of guards with tactic and trying. but it sucks if you have to run everytime again to the point, crawling and sneaking on the way to it, hiding the stuff because you have to much of everything and then die to repeat it...
even a barrel or two at the circle would help, so you don't have to run allways to your store-places and get in, out and return sneaking to get shot...

I'm going to watch the next updates, maybe it becomes better (or me^^) but i'm pretty sure, making the fighting/crawling and so on easier would be a bad way, because thats the game. i think the saving-system it the problem for me

author: {'steamid': '76561198031811691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1388945690}
review:
This game is awesome! Survival mechanics are really well implemented (even on this early stage of development): you need to think to survive and you need to plan every movement in the robot - hunting reserve. The only thing that I would change, or rather add, is the possibilty to save when quit: it's frustrating when you can't save and you lose a lot of work because you have to quit the game and you're fr away from the stones. I think that a non - reloadable "save when quit" will make the game more enjoyable without spoiling its survival spirit.
For the rest: I really like it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198109354571', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1489211437}
review: I love this game! The whole concept is amazing and i'm glad I purchased it in the alpha stage because i'm completely devoted to seeing it through. The only problem is the robots. Not that i'm not thrilled to have tweed-wearing robots as the enemies, but sometimes I play and its too much trouble for me to try to go into a town to try and loot some houses. It seems that the robots in a town are so closely linked so that if you set off one it alerts all of the other robots on the island. Well, im exaggerating a little, but the robots are very alert to the others. When the robots shoot you, the blood loss is incredible. I know thats what rags are for but you can bleed out in a matter of seconds so they're not the bet choice sometimes. Maybe add a syringe for health? Anyways, I like this game a lot, but there are some problems. Thumbs up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030491976', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1481140791}

author: {'steamid': '76561198115202853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1419710324}
review: This could be a great game. But for those of us who don't have large chucks of time,  the game  now it is almost impossible to play and get ahead.  There is no map of the game so you get lost easily and there is no way to find out where you are, so you have to just run around hoping to find your way.  Saving is a big problem, there is no saving the game  except for Standing stones and boats, which you can't find in a hurry.  Also if you need to leave the game in a hurry (due to time) you can't save it on exit, everything you have accomplised will be lost, leaving you with a feeling of great frustration!!!! I rarely play this game now...hoping they will add a map and saving on exit in the coming up-dates. Other wise only true gamers with lots of time will be able to play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981680777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1388794749}
review:
It's not finished yet, true, but it feels sort of... empty. The premise of the game seems to be: Find the special glowy things while running away a lot. Sometimes you'll find a weapon, but using one is usually more dangerous than not. That sounds great in theory, and the game has potential, certainly, but currently the game feels a lot emptier than the time it takes to generate each world would have you believe. There are several buildings, but you can't actually enter any of them. The reasons for this are well explained in a developer blog (and essentially boil down to "it'd be too easy to escape from the robots if you could and would take too much time away from things that are far more important") but that doesn't help with the emptyness factor. 

I'm not sure if it's actually true (or if it's something to be worked on later), but it feels like you're literally the only non-robot in the world; every time I play it I'm left with a feeling of loneliness which makes me want to stop playing. My one hour of game time on record (which I'm sure is slightly more than that in reality but probably not much) is spread over at least 4 sessions, because I just couldn't keep playing it any longer. Not because the game is bad, per se, but because there (currently!) isn't much to do other than run away from robots. Nobody to interact with, no side-quests or missions to complete (that I've ever found). It feels less like a singleplayer game, and more like a multiplayer game with nobody else on the server. That kind of 'there should be something else here but there isn't" kind of feeling. Admittedly, that could very well be due to it's Early Access status, but nevertheless it's for sale now, so worth mentioning. The fact that your opponents are literally a bunch of machines intentionally devoid of any individual personality doesn't help here either (they're characterful, certainly, but they're all basically the same other than 'Baloon Guy' and the new Poacher).

I like the ideas in the game, and I'll keep checking back every now and then, but so far it's not a game I enjoy playing. And not in a Spec Ops: The Line style "you're not supposed to enjoy it" way. Entirely willing to admit however that it might just "not be my sort of game", because a lot of other people love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018721492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1522201681}

author: {'steamid': '76561198118593692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1510999467}
review:
i really like the feeling of the game, i really do feel hunted. playing the stealth approach gives so much to the game, checking for paths to reach your destination, crouching through bushes on the lookout for hunters, setting up a safehouse for storage, managing your inventory for the next looting trip etc.
this is the survival game that feels best in my opinion.

on top of that, it's just plain beautiful. the flavour of every biome is so well done, it's lovely, and much fun to just roam around the islands. the lighting adds much to the feel.

if you're looking for a dark, yet humorous steampunk themed survival game, grab this wonderful piece of software...and a cup of tea maybe...

review:
I can't really recommend this yet.  The AI badly needs rebalancing, as does the combat in general.  I'm fine with weapons that aren't hitscan pixel-point accurate murder machines, but it's incredibly common to miss while iron sighting at ranges where even a blind geriatric could successfully score a hit.

The spawn placement of the artifacts sometimes is a giant middle finger as well.

Great concept, just still very clearly alpha quality.  Recommendation will probably change to a yes once there's more functionality and features implemented.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079594711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1401895288}
review: This is a unique game with great potentials. The story is quite playable in this intial form as well, graphics look quite ok compared to it being an alpha version, and new contents/aspects are added with each patch. There's a lot of creeping around, looting houses, evading/fighting robots and being thrilled by all the dangers lurking around you and hunting you from the shadows. In this game the whole world seems to be against you, including the mad scientist who started it all, his evil/funny robots, the hot air balloon chasing you silently from above, the houses storing only rotten food when you're starving, scarecrows and sea monsters giving away your position, camp fires attracting the evil robots, and robodogs woofing as you try to outrun them. All in all, the game is a great challenge and a lot of scary fun. Depending on the patches, the game gets either really challenging or too easy at times, but this is part of the development process. In spite of balancing issues, the game offers several hours of fun gameplay that won't get boring due to the randomized and ever-changing gameworld.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963806518', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1387729963}
review:
At this stage I wouldn't recommend it - there is not much to do other than collecting these stones/crystals dotted around the islands. So far there is one enemy type - the ai doesn't seem that great either. I can see it becoming very repetive...and boring unfortunately. 

I fully regret in getting this (hopefully they can add some variety and interesting things to do) and it has really made me wary about early release/access titles. I would just wait until the game is completed and then see if its any good.

However, it is fun to see how long you can last before something spots you and blasts your face off, or you starve to death. Im looking forward to future updates!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023936106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1404433549}
review:
Absolutely brilliant concept and execution, even for an incomplete game. As opposed to DayZ, where survival is a goal in itself, "Sir, you are being hunted" has a general objective. The latter which is single and clear, but while still giving you immense freedom when it comes to choosing your way to success.

Although you have multiple personas to choose from (trapper, drunk, artist...), the Aristocrat is still the one that gives you the fullest experience (nothing but bandages at the start). I'd recommend starting with him.

Note for Vista users: It works, BUT will drain more resources than it should because of the lack of support for this OS (and hence optimization). Older average computers running Vista will be put under stress and can overheat as a result.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993729320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1401676018}

author: {'steamid': '76561198092334001', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1464217104}
review: Amazing enviornment, flawless atmosphere, incredible concept. Few words can describe this game. From close calls with a pack of hunting robots to scavenging the landscape, everything feels wonderfully original and well crafted. Though the controller support is lacking, most will want to use a keyboard anyway. Lack of music doesn't detract from the game, but enhances it. Since it is still in development, we can expect better AI, more story, and even multiplayer! I recommend this game to anybody looking for a little bit of everything. The only other thing I can say is... watch your back when playing this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992985917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 811, 'last_played': 1673106508}
review:
Sir is an incredibly addictive game with a great gameplay foundation -a survival simulation based in an open environment, in which you have to manage your energy, health, and what you're carrying while searching for 25 artifact fragments strewn about 5 islands...all the while being hunted by intelligent, agressive robot gentlemen. This supposedly simple setup of 'get the fragments and escape with your life', spirals into a remarkably dense balance of combat and resource management, due to its underlying gamplay mechanics -not unlike Sir's spiritual predecessor, the STALKER series. 

Also of note: the procedural generation of the islands and buildings insures that your experience is unique (you won't find a "let's play" video walkthrough of this one), and the aggressive enemy AI and their deliberately overpowered weaponry always keeps you on your toes.

I'd recommend this game to anyone looking for the next hardcore first-person shooter challenge. Despite it's semi-cartoonish trappings, this game is only for the brave.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023147596', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1507746591}
review:
I say good sir!
This game blew the socks my mother knitted me last christmas right off my feet! Dispite normally whileing away my days playing cricket or eating scones I was struck at what sport it was to be hunted through the brush. At first I had no clue what to do but that was quickly sorted as I gathered a collection of goods and set off to find pieces of a strange machine.                               As I paddled from island to island i discovered the biome system and the vast changes between the islands. One was dark and filled with industrial objects while another kept to a country side feel. 
Being hunted is not the only thing to do while you are on these islands; you can hunt birds or robots, cook them up and enjoy a solid feast. 
All in all i find this game to be splendid and ask that the chums who work so tirelessly at it to carry on!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026733248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 6779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1396, 'last_played': 1630718561}
review: (while still in alpha at time of writing) sir is very enjoyable little stealth game in which you (sir or madame as you may chose to addresed by either) are stranded on a chain of islands infested with very English robots who hunt humans for sport. your objective is to collect mysterious peices of "the device". you'll spend most of you're time scavenging, running from, hiding from or fighting off you're robotic persuers. The game itself does a good job with it's mechanics, lovers of stealth games will enjoy the tension and suspence of ducking behind a wall at the last moment before a robot see's you, sneaking through the underbrush to ambush opponents and whatnot, combat doesn't play a major role unless you want it to, and it's well balanced enough so that while a gun may be useful in a snag, you can be just as effective using the limited inventory space for provisions and other usefull supplies. Overall a very well crafted game. it may get a bit repetitive if you try to complete a game in one go, but with more content coming every update, this is a game that is well worth a few bucks during sale season.
