author: {'steamid': '76561198027217002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1473665358}
review:
I have not recommended a game is quite some time, if at all on steam however i feel like i must. Although the game is still in its early development stages it has a sense of urgency and humour while playing that marry together perfectly to create a kind of gameplay that is unique to itself. Keep in mind that it is not a complete game by any means and there are a LOT of things that need to be tweaked and added, however, in its current state the game is more than playable and will give hours or replay value. 

It is a game that i recommend following through its development and to play as it changes so that you can give feedback and shape it how you like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012133002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 12558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2131, 'last_played': 1590271136}
review:
Dawn - south island
I've just arrived after making a desperate escape from 5 clunkers that flushed me from my hiding spot near Long Bucket. The thicket and the little draw allowed me to lose them in the dark, and when I saw the boat I just kept running; I'll return to centre island when things settle a bit.


http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=207515370


The minced pie I ate on the trip has me feeling pretty good, I'll head along the coastline and try to stay out of trouble a while. So much for staying out of trouble, I've just walked right into some ol' boy's bottom brush and it appears he's out for an early stroll. I'd bet my last bottle of brandy that's a blunderbuss tucked under 'is arm too. 

I'm far enough away he hasn't noticed me, I'll head for that big tree now that he's turned and started back. Still not too light and the tree and tall grass has me well hidden, I'll wait here a bit and see what this chap's up to. There he is, heading back this way again, coming down the hill out of the trees. Where you going, Gov'nor? As I suspected, he's coming this way, going to stop right out there 40 yards from where I'm crouched. 

Okay - I'm quite hidden, don't think he will see me at all, just have to be quiet. Gonna be you or me, sparky, blunderbuss to blunderbuss - I get one chance at this, don't rooster it up. Here he comes, I can hear his whirring gizmos. Little closer, bit further, there - stopped right where I thought you would, pretty mornin' ain't it..? 

Now turn, start back, now or never - creep from my hiding spot a few feet, NOW RUN! Run right for 'im! No 2nd guessing now, I'm committed, closer, closer, almost to him. He's turned! Shoot! Shoot now or I'm dead! At this range there'll be no hope!

GAWD, what a roar! The blast! Was it mine or his? I'm still standing... he's NOT! I got him! He's there on the ground, sizzlin' and cracklin' like June bugs in a camp fire. I'm alive. HA! Take that, ya clanging pile of bolts. Crap, I'd better make myself scarce, no time for celebration the whole county must've heard that. 

I'll just see what chap has first - a pair of pliers, nice - and if you don't mind good sir, I'll trade my empty blunderbuss for your loaded one, 'preciate it. Gotta get the hell outta here now...

~YEAH, you want this...

author: {'steamid': '76561198007585893', 'num_games_owned': 1941, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1485242184}
review: This is stealth/survival done right.  Great mechanics, serious challenge, and a highly entertaining and original environment expertly devised to fill you with creeping fears of tory robot death.  Headphones strongly recommended for a proper experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070608534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1396237725}
review: Great game! Always challenging but incredibly flexable to your style of play. Looking forward to all the future updates..especially multiplayer!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013491256', 'num_games_owned': 365, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1437366032}
review:
Sir, You Are Being Hunted is a game where you take on the role of a Sir or Madam and are placed in a randomly generated terrain based off of the British Isles.  You have two goals: assemble pieces of some sort of mysterious artifact to return home, and most importantly survive.

Surviving is easier said than done, however, with well armed hunters, poachers, robodogs, and even a scarecrow that follows you around all trying to exterminate you.  Even if you get your hands on a gun the sound of gunfire will attract other nearby robots and they will rush to your location to investigate, so attacking quickly and quietly with an axe is your best option if you can't avoid a fight.  You have a vitality meter which acts as a hunger meter that you have to constantly keep your eyes on.  You can't run most of the time unless you're positive the coast is clear, for these robots have 2000x2000 vision and will instantly spot you.

This is not the game for you if you desire a casual romp through the fields, and it's unlikely the devs will make it any easier.

You will run, you will hide, you will loot, you will kill and almost certainly be killed.  Sleep with one eye open and bring some extra tea bags for it's hunting season, and you're the prey!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971645346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1387860238}
review:
I want to like this game. I really do. It does have potential and is still in development, but the robots aren't the ones hunting. You, are the one hunting the fragments.
The robots are always either patrolling towns or sometimes patrolling where you get the fragments, but never are they actually trying to track you down. I never see any scouting parties combing the countryside.
But I can be running around for hours, and not have anyone hunting me. As they're too busy patrolling buildings.

Again, this game is in heavy development. I hope in the future that the robots actually do what this game title is; hunt you down, where you're forced to run and watch your back.

I'm not saying the game is completely bad. The survival aspect is hands down the best I've seen of any game. You constantly have to watch your Vitality (your Hunger level) and make sure the robots don't see you when you're trying to loot and pillage a town.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020267225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1492301025}
review:
Sir you are being hunted is quite a wonderfull game.

So far it is in alpha but it with the coming updates and tweaks to the game it will be even better, it is a fps survival game but is also kind of like a horror just from seeing the robots and getting chased by them is horrifying enough for me. basically you are stranded on a island filled with british robots that are out to hunt you down as if you are game, there is 5 islands that each ahve 7 fragments that you must collect in order to escape. 
take heart though since you can find weapons to defend you self from the robots whilst you find your fragments as well as random objects you can throw to distract them.

i have heard their will be multiplay for the game as well in the future so it will be a good game and i recomend it getting whenever you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027597667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1640640774}
review: Save points??? Are you kidding me. You fight hours and when you will save your progress you must first go back to a save point. You can't save when ever you want. So if you whant to end the game you must go to a save point, which is miles away from your position. This ist stupid an a technic from the 90' for console games and not for PC. This makes no fun! I whant my money back!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030383668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1306, 'last_played': 1600094822}
review: One thing is certain about this game, PURE BRITISHNESS!!! I have never laughed so much in the face of fear at the fact that bumbling British robots are chasing after me with shotguns, blunderbusses and dogs, Never have I found it so amusing to ambush unsuspecting hunters or scavange for food. Pure brilliant, we need more games like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064193744', 'num_games_owned': 994, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1445150696}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037403995', 'num_games_owned': 461, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1394638155}
review:
The title "Sir, You Are Being Hunted" is a very good description of the game itself.
You wake up on one of five islands (which are generated at the beginning of a new game) with almost no equipment and the instructions to find the parts of an experiment, which lie scattered across the islands. However armed robots lurk everywhere and will hunt after you as soon as they catch sight of you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062554016', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 952, 'last_played': 1609644855}

review: This could be just due to bad luck on my part but my first runthrough of this game involved being constantly surrounded by enemies with nothing to defend myself with, yet all the weapons seem to be commonly found on dead enemies. author: {'steamid': '76561198047143384', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1624820033}
review: This game is worth every penny that goes to it's developers. Let yourself fall into the immersion and get paranoid or get aggressive. This is some of the best survival genre gameplay, I have experienced myself, that many of the 'bigger' survival games miss. Love the art style. Love the sounds. Love crapping my pants as I'm keeping an eye on a pack of hunters in the cornfield when that damn balloon siren goes off!!!! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198035742889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1402288267}
review: This game is insanely fun. It can be pretty frightening, and the first few times of playing are the best because you dont know who the enemies are and how they will respond to you. Weapons are plenty, but ammo is VERY scarce, and it takes quite a few rounds to down one of the hunters, and it is quite easy to miss. I would recommend this to pretty much anyone. the stealth is hard to stay calm in, and the combat is crazy hard. overall it is a difficult game, but worth the money when its on sale

author: {'steamid': '76561198045692299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1522872101}
review: Sir, You Are Being Hunted, as far as early access games go is on the path to a truly decent survival game, with certain potential. If you have doubts on whether to buy it, it may make sense to buy it when it reaches its later stages or release. It is a game that is worth spending significant amounts of time on. 7/10 in its current form, but the idea of the game means that when it actually comes out, I reckon it will go up to an 8.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045856889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1405612222}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036533143', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1664653042}
review:
Finally got a new update which enhances the game  by a good bit and fixes some important issues that had plagued the game. 

It's a fun hide and seek game in which you are collecting meteorites while avoiding robots and collecting items on your way to help you. 

To add replayability to the game the devs added the option for players to invent their own islands and play on them which I enjoy.

Game is pretty simple but enjoyable

author: {'steamid': '76561198012509455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1638754803}
review:
Good game, but wait until it's out of Alpha. (2013)

---

Revisiting the game in 2021, the game is SUBSTANTIALLY better, and in fact extremely fun. Between a voiced intro sequence, character classes (sets of items you start with), and a bevy of bug fixes, the game is 100% worth it at full price now. 

The only caveat is that the multiplayer is based on very old code, so you may run into bugs playing with your buds. I personally haven't had any problem with multiplayer, but I have heard that they are not uncommon.

If you like the concept, I would definitely grab it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993444397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1402163088}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042726457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1451520374}
review: This is an extremely interesting game concept and so far a great game to play. This is an extremely challenging game and not for the faint of heart. Most of your time will be spent crouching trying to find more supplies until you finally find a gun. Once you find that gun and your heart leaps with joy, you'll become a little less fearful as you creep around trying to find the pieces you need. Game is already pretty hard to begin with and will only continuously get harder with the future updates. Overall I highly recommend this game as it is an extremely unique game and really fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034199687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1399307255}
review:
-Update: reviewing of release version-

Ok, they added stuff like classes and persistent containers now but the core gameplay is still the same. Search stone, pick up stone, return to portal (walk), insert stone, repeat. If enemies appear, sneak around. Don't know if there'll be some change then but I can't imagine doing this for hours so I won't know.
I really want to like the game, I like Don't starve and the classic Thief series and steampunk and England and sneaking around in general but I'm just not having fun here as there is not really much to do.


Early access review below->

-Sir, can't recommend buying at the moment-

I'll retry in half a year though since it's early access if they add more content and completely change the gameplay. The setting and the ideas looked good so I gave it a try. I'm always for some good stealth in a randomized scary robo-england.

However that's it. Endlessly creeping through the grass. Like some stealth-"don't starve" minus the crafting. The houses are just large loot chests and there's a lack of detail to the surroundings. After searching some of the item storages I found it's not really worth it - maybe they'll add some crafting for the junk items? Leading up to the next problem with the small inventory. The game's mission is to search out key items in the landscape which take up half of your inventory and carry them back to the start. (They'll probably add permanent storage chests to fix this which means even more backtracking through murky environments).  Mostly the key items are guarded by some robots so you'll have to sneak there. I did that three times and realized it wasn't fun anymore then (you're supposed to do this over and over apparently). 

I'm not really sure if they will change the gameplay entirely when the game releases so buyers beware. Indeed beware of all early access games from my experience but that's a complex topic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098646568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 2616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1511569680}
review:
LOVE IT, LOVE IT, LOVE IT. Is so creepy, you have to hide as best as you can. i prefer to hide at night because I can't see too well then.

Now professionally......
I quite enjoy the game. When I first tried out the game, it was relatively simple. Squires in towns that you can't let see you looting houses otherwise they get irritable, poachers in the woods that force you to be wary of bear traps, scarcrows that work like living weeping angels that don't kill you but scream like crazy, a blimp, a seamonster, and normal hunting robots with their temporary bear trap dogs. Now, It has branched out a fair bit. Now there are very speedy horsmen who run you over with the force of a steampunkish floating car and knock you flat in doing so, a castle biome, the landowner with his cane & freaky horn noises & knocking you flat on your back where his 2 pet hounds finish you off and or trap you, and much fewer fragments to find beefore you win. As a side note, something weird happened yesterday in the game for me while I was offline but that can wait until later. Anywho, all this christmas pudding and brandy and such, is simply delicious. For me, this is a game of eats, sweets, meats, hunting, running, hiding, ambushing, trapping, eating bad food, hurting, eating all sorts of random mushrooms you find, shooting, hacking, sneaking, stealing, escaping, and definitely more but I don't know what.
Also, I propose 2 new things to add to the game. Fishing, and either digging or undrground tunnels with exceptionally well hidden entrances. the tunnels would probably be in the mountain biome. I know that you are working on the multiplayer thing right now probably, but I mean when you are done with that I think it might be a good idea. Maybe adding a mine biome? There is or was such a thing as mines on small islands.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056340630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1569904308}
review: This game is fun, but sometimes it gets really boring. I like the new class setup when starting a new world it really helps out with the game and makes me want to play it more. I give this game a 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198071532767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1452606885}
review:
You find yourself pinned, your pistol only has three bullets.


You hear those damned voices again. You don't know how many are out there, Just that they will not stop until you are dead.


So what should you do? Run, Try to make a last stand? Could you possibly kill them all, Weaken them? 


You take a peek out of the bushes and see them looking through the grove to your right. They are sweeping to area in a counter-clockwise fashion and will soon near you. So you grab a rock and lob it in their general direction, in trying to keep their soulless eyes away from your hiding place.


Success! The rock appears to distract the hunters from your impending ousting. You wait for them to turn their backs to you while they attempt to find the source of the noise.


This is your chance! You decide to take out the first hunter you see and make a break for it. You grip your pistol with both hands and start squeezing on the trigger, raising your weapon up in front of you. The crude sights aiming near the sounds of footsteps and crunching of the grass. 


Now! You burst out of the brush and hastily fire off two shots into the back of one of the automatons before veering into the opposite direction of the group.


You hope you sent that bastard to android hell.


You assume you are southbound but you don't have time to check your compass.


"I'll try to find a path out of this place later, the only thing that matters now is that this direction is away from those monsters."


Inhuman screeching followed by gunshots breaks your train of thought as bullets whiz past you. Your speed doubles and your heart pounds faster than it has even pounded before. You were never a working man, your legs and heart used to feel as if you had just ran a marathon after you went up the stairs. 


The fact that you are possibly having a heart attack is the least of your worries right now as a second volley of lead is the more immediate danger.


You make it over a hill and believe you have broken the predators line of sight.


They will catch up soon, think fast! You leap over a fence and sprint towards a nearby ditch. You lie down in an attempt to make yourself less visible and make yourself quieter. You start piling mud on top of yourself to make some impromptu camouflage.


Catching your breath you greedily inhale air for your deprived lungs. You hear voices approach and you slow your breath, hoping that they will ignore you and move past. You hear the wet thumps of metal hitting mud as the pack nears you. Your body tenses up just like the metal demons that are hunting you. You attempt to stay quiet and motionless as they search through the nearby brush searching for you before you finally hear them move on. You lay for what seems to be the longest few minutes of your life before letting out the longest sigh of your life as you reflect on these last few hours and how you nearly died multiple times. The last words you heard before you were deposited on this accursed archipelago echo through your mind.

"Sir, You are being hunted."

author: {'steamid': '76561198041972389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1387256478}
review: From the amount of time I played this game I can already tell it is amazing. The world is beautiful (if a bit too low-res textured), the theme of the game is implemented in a lovely way and there's a ton of ways to loose. I just died my first death (after eternities of hiding in bushes because I was too scared) and am still shivering a bit because it came surprisingly fast. I will definitely continue playing this and give an update once I had some more time with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084691068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1564579546}
review:
Sir, you are being hunted is a beautiful game with an art style tha may not be for everyone but is certainly for most. Most of the gameplay consists of distracting, running, hiding and looting. While there are guns and you can shoot people it's not really an ideal way to get past an enemy to loot something.

Negatives: You can't go in buildings, you can't save very often, you can breath underwater (for now), you have infinite stamina for running

Positives: Great sneaking system with few glitches, beautiful world ( a lot of effort went in to the way things look), clear objective, can go on forever, books everywhere that are very interesting to read and are about all sorts of things including the 'scary' tale of what the first of the robots were like, a bit of humour

As you can see above the positives easily outdo the negatives. This is truely a stealth and survival game I will never forget.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112280846', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1652343385}
review: This game is interesting. It really isn't your basic adventure game like, say, The Elder Scrolls, I would compare it more to the likes of Minecraft or Don't Starve except for a few things, such as the night being your friend, or the complete inability to make anything. It's really a great game, but it's price really isn't quite worth if you're looking to buy this game, I say get it when you can, it's lovely, but wait a bit, until it's out of alpha, because $20 is a bit pricey. I bought this game for $10 on a weekend sale, and I don't regret it at all. But here's some more about the game. The gameplay is great, the controls are a bit odd for me, but they can be changed, and there is never a loss of excitement. Robots hunt you for sport, and you have to choose at every junction whether you want to fight back or lay low, the latter generally being the smarter choice. Believe it or not, there IS a possible ending, but don't worry. The game is in no rush to get you there, and you can simply run around the island (or 5 islands, as there are a total of 5) shooting robots if that's what you like best. This isn't really a "horror" style game as it is categorized. I'd say more adventure.  But, it sure is a heck of a lot of fun. Whether it be unlucky and scrounging for food, or simply hacking away at robots with your trusty hatchet, it's truly fun for all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967807967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1403265859}
review: This is a great game so far. You play a scientist who finds himself on a dreary archipelago resembling the english countryside after an experiment goes wrong, and you must collect pieces of your machine so you can fix it and return to your normal reality, all the while being hunted by murderous tweed wearing steampunk robots. Reminds me a lot of Gosford Park, but with robots. Great balance of fun, difficulty, and suspense without having too steep of a learning curve. However the gameplay could use some more layers as the basic concept does become a bit repetitive after a while, but seeing as it's still in development, you can expect more features to expand the experience are to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056593149', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1590102408}

review: A game that can finally have you fear dying. Where most games let you easily get a gun in your hands, you are lucky that you get an axe! This game is absolutely brutal in the way in throws challenges at the player, whether it is sneaking pass an entire robot hunting party, being chased by a dog, nearly starving to death after you have plucked all the houses clean, or nearly having you organs burst due to the suddeness of blunderbuss sounding off. I suggest this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982494482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1382750453}
review:
I can sum up this soon-to-be-finished game in two words:  posh terminators.

If you can put up with the fact that the game isn't done and there are some very obvious issues with the game, buy it.  Otherwise, wait for the full version to be released.  A different take on the newly popular genere of survival games where you're being hunted by British robots who remind me of Alfred from Batman TAS.  You'll laugh, you'll cry, and you'll probably never look at terminators the same way ever again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075075560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1477706583}
review: This is a GREAT game! Be warned though- this is a hard game. You cannot fight off all the robots, especially late game. It has a randomly generated world that consists of 5 islands. You can transfer from the islands by docks. You start on the central island and docks are to your north, south, west, and east. The transfer is not seamless though. You must load the new island, but this takes no more than 5 seconds. The current build is alpha, so there is a few bugs to work out. Stealth is stable for the most part, but sometimes a bit "rickety". The game is stable enough to play and enjoy though, so I would definetly get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047065471', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1468093919}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009935550', 'num_games_owned': 2123, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1395184011}
review:
At first look I wasn't sure if this was a game I should have bought.......
I need not have worried, it's a game unto itself, original, fun, dark, moody, replayable & dripping with atmosphere and dark humour.

It's a brilliant survival game, the art style and mood is one of a kind, If you turn out the light's & put headsets on, then prepare for epic suspense, the game just has that kind of feeling about it.
Make your way through 5 different Biomes Castle, Fens, Industrial, Mountains & Rural, all of which have a distinctly different feel but all ties to the british countryside.

Hunt the Robots, Run from the Robots, Trap the Robots, Hide from those pesky hunting laser beemed eyes with Robots attached to them.
Patch by patch, the game keeps getting better & now we are at Version 1.0.
Stealth wins the day, being in a rush will ruin it, stay hiden, think sneaky & you'll be fine........maybe.

The devs know what they want and they listen to thier backers.

Buy the game, you'll love your time in Sir!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085477871', 'num_games_owned': 1328, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1410133122}
review: Even in its current form, SYABH's stylised graphics are fluid, the environment tense and varied, and the pokes at being British in general are never far away, with the gameplay being sort-of like DayZ but not as needlessly labrynthine and over-analyzed. Buying this game is an investment into something great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037629668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1539339390}
review:
At first glance, the overpowering aroma of hipsterness fills the nostrils at the sheer amount of top hats and moustaches, but do not be taken in. This game is a fully fledged survival game.

The gameplay is really fun, ranging from heart pounding duck and cover shooting to hiding in the undergrowth waiting for the enemy to pass. 

Overall what makes this game good is the replayability, every game is different, the exploration is particulally fun, altough the shooting aspect leaves a little to be desired, most of the time you will either be hiding or sniping from a distance, so that's not such a large problem. The hunger bar feature, although questionable in Minecraft, works well in this, forcing you to venture into the heart of machine infested villages for food, rather then making an encounter with a machine a very rare occurance.

With a wide variety of enemys ( some terrifying slender men scarecrows), an open ended constantly generating level system, and with a multitude of different playstlyes, tactics and playthrough options available, you'll need to get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969913402', 'num_games_owned': 3553, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1485550453}
review:
Quick first impression, I'll change this later when I have more time in the game:  It's a survival game but there's so much open space and the robots can see so far that it's very difficult to do anything.  

You don't get very much in the way of weapons with the default character, so you're left with some distraction techniques and that's it.  The rest has to be scavenged from the island, except good luck with that.  Also, visibility is really poor no matter if it's day or night, but again, that seems to hinder you and not the robots very much.   

If there was a simple takedown, even if only temporary that I could do, this would be a cool mashup of survival and stealth.  So far as I can tell though, there isn't one, or at least the game hasn't told me about any takedown techniques.  Then again I did find a book in one playthrough so maybe it's something you're supposed to scavenge as well... books about how to deal with the robots?

Anyway, this is early access, but it looks OK... just way too dark, gloomy and yet way too wide open with few areas you can really hide out or sneak in.  The name of the game is to find these pieces of something and bring them back to a set of "Standing stones" like the standing stones in Skyrim... 

You can change the layout of the various islands to certain set archetypes (fens, industrial, rural, and one I can't remember right now).  Unfortunately that's 4 different island types but there are 5 islands (a center island with four islands to the cardinal directions).  I guess if you fancy a specific type of terriain you could make the whole thing the same, or you could try to make every part somewhat different (but two islands have to be the same).   

It's procedurally generated so you won't be able to get used to the landscape too much, but at the same time, it's not so different that it will look unfamiliar either.   

The bottom line is that right now, the default character is a tad difficult.  An easier character starts out with lots of traps and ways to stop the enemy from chasing you, but that may well be TOO easy.  Updated review coming when I've had time to play with it more.   RIght now it's a thumbs down though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071050372', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1382469894}
review:
This game is an interesting Indie title that has not recieved the attention i think it deserves. It is a Survival/adventure game, but could be classified as survival/horror. The game puts you in the shoes of an English lord who is being(you guessed it)hunted. Hunted by what? oh, just robots...thats right, the game pits you against robotic hunting dogs, hunters of all shapes and sizes as well as air balloons. The game features a good stealth system, as well as providing tension and such. It may only be in alpha, but it is already a great game.

+Well devoloped stealth system.
+A large enviroment to explore.
+Already great even in alpha.

-Needs work on glitches and bugs.
-Could use more enviromental biomes.
-More survival aspects would be nice.

Overall, i would reccomend this game to those seeking a good survival game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056155576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1494620040}
review: Just started playing this game. already died in three worlds. This is not a FPS don't think it is. This is a mild horror game with survival. Think slender, don't starve and crysis combined.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963744519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1586212190}
review:
Is it worth it? 

Yes, and here's why. 

Sir, You Are Being Hunted is a very fun, different, and interesting open world sandbox game. In the game you will be primarily exploring a few randomly generated islands that have their own specail theme such as open country, industrial regions, and mountainous regions. In order to survive you will have to be stealthy to avoid detection. You will have to loot buildings for food and other supplies. In some cases you may have to use weapons to dispatch those pesky robots that are hunting you, but do so with caution, as gunfire can attract even more hunters which would make your already desperate situation even worse. 

The game is an early release but it is in a very playable state. No need to wait for the final release, start having fun now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992787303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1536974817}
review:
First Impression of 'Sir, You Are Being Hunted', Alpha Beta.

I blindly bought this game knowing absolutely nothing about it and having not heard even the title before.  However something about the first 30 seconds into the quick video "December Festive Teapot" had me hooked and before even finishing the trailer, I bought it.

Now obviously this is a Beta, this does have bugs and is not a final product but this is a very exciting opportunity as a gamer to be a part of the continuation of improvements it will undertake, ultimately ending up as a finished project.  That being said, as it stands, it's remarkable!  Coming from someone who always looks for reviews or some form of general acceptance or denial helps me at times to filter through the vast array of games available.
  
This one bypassed a frequent filtering system and found its way into my game collection - boy am I glad it did.  Right from the beginning I was hooked on the art style, the Steam-Punk appearance to the UI.  It was nice to have a handful of choices prior to starting the game as to who you want to wonder the eerie islands as.  Once in the game and quickly advancing past the "tutorial" if you will, I began my journey - no idea what kind of journey or what to expect.  But with my binoculars, and rags, I began to walk.  As I said, I had no prior knowledge as to what the game was about I just installed it and started playing and before I knew it was I quiet literally being hunted, and yes I feared for my life.

The audio is raw, it's intense, it really suites the environment and the atmosphere.  It felt like I was actually being gunned down as I ran for my life and literally jumping in my seat at each sound of gunfire.  This was intense as very few games legitimately have me jumping out of my seat but the sounds of gun shots in the atmosphere had me completely engaged in my survival.  By seeking shelter in a field with some form of grain I crouched and managed to get away only with a few shots making contact.

As the environment goes through its day to night time cycle there were times my eyes played tricks on me making me think there were people around me, this was effectively conveyed through the spooky as hell tree shadows.  These shadows sway along the ground and surrounding environment displaying some eerie shapes.  The sound design for the environment at this time compliments the eerie environment the night time paints around you, equally so when the suns shining.  

However there is a fairly long wait time to actually start a new game, this of course is because the game is procedurally generating new environment layouts and such for a fresh experience every time, but the wait time can take a few minutes.  Once in, the game runs smooth other than a few laggy moments when looting buildings, this of course was to be expected.  The graphics in game are quiet nice considering the stage of development, though my only comment is they are lacking in the building areas as the resolution on some doors and walls is quiet poor.

I can't be too critical at this time as I'm certain they are aware of all these comments and graphics really are of no concern for a Beta experience.  As for gameplay i've only encountered those few laggy moments - as it stands, it's extremely impressive and am happy I pushed aside my usual routine of check up and went through with purchasing it.  I look forward to future development and advancement and will most definitely be an active player along the way!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981070391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1393944822}
review: Pip pip cheerio and the like. Sir you are being hunted is a survival game, pitting you against a diabolical robotic foe. Sneak through a 5 island cluster gathering food, weapons, tools and chunks of rock to power a portal outta there. Evade your enemies through various distractionary tactics. Several different class of robot roam the land attempting to execute any human they spot...or hear.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970746485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1536522046}
review:
Sure am enjoying this game, as I find First Person Sneakers to be extremely immersive.  Although your options are fairly minimal when it comes to manipulating your surroundings (we are in Alpha here, remember) I am reminded just a bit of the original Thief series in that it's thick with atmosphere and you are encouraged to take some risks to get where you need to go.  

Unlike Thief, you spend quite a bit of time traversing open space, which is a kind of nervewracking unto itself.  The recent addition of fat scarecrows with "Slim Man" tendancies makes open fields even more worrisome. 

Picked this one up during a sale, and it's definitely worth $10.  If you like sneaky stuff, it's worth the regular price as well.  If you dislike Alpha/Beta productions (though it's more stable than many games gone gold) you might wait a bit. But keep an eye on it, I would suppose that it's just going to keep getting better.

review:
/!\ Recommendation de la version ALPHA du jeu /!\

"Sir, You are being hunted" est un m√©lange entre un jeu de survie √† la "DayZ" mais aussi √† la "Don't Starve".
Vous y incarnez un homme (ou une femme) qui ce retrouve coinc√© dans un monde o√π les robots vous chasses comme du gibier. Grosse parodie de la chasse √† l'anglaise, vous devez retrouver 24 artefacts pour pouvoir revenir dans votre maison mais cela ne va pas √™tre si simple croyez-moi !

Le jeu propose un certains challenge et vous allez devoir g√©rer votre survie √† tout prix ! C'est en s√©lectionnant une classe en d√©but de jeu que vous allez pouvoir choisir votre niveau de difficult√© et partir avec plus ou moins d'√©quipement. Le monde dans lequelle vous jouez est divis√© en 5 zones diversifi√©es ou non et g√©n√©r√©es al√©atoirement. A vous de choisir avant de d√©buter votre partie. La g√©n√©ration de monde est assez longue et vous prend environ 5 bonnes minutes mais une fois en jeu, la partie peut commencer ! Graphiquement, le jeu est moche (on peut le dire) mais pas vraiment. A vous de voir. Pour ma part, je ne le trouve pas si moche que √ßa mais rappelons que c'est encore une version ALPHA. Une fois dans la partie, tout vous est expliqu√© (ou presque). Vous √™tes constament sur votre garde essayant de ne pas rencontrer ces salet√©s de chasseur qui vous veulent au mur de leur salon. Le jeu est tr√®s prenant et l'adr√©naline monte une fois rep√©r√©.

Malgr√© que le jeu soit encore en ALPHA, il vaut le coup quand il passe sous la barre des 10‚Ç¨. 20‚Ç¨ pour une version ALPHA, c'est un peut ch√®re pay√© mais du contenu est constament mis √† jour. "Sir, You are being hunted" √† vraiment du potentiel et pourrez s'av√©rer tr√®s fun √† jouer une fois la version final faite.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961034816', 'num_games_owned': 923, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1386652041}
review:
Tweedpunk STALKER. 

Okay, so there's more to it than that. After a science experiment gone-awry, you're alone on a small group of islands occupied solely by birds and murderbots. Your helpful butler informs you, voice in the head style, that you need to find fragments of a machine to get home safely. And that's it. The islands are procedural generated at world creation, and look like you would expect rural Britain to (if you have never been there like myself). Outwit and avoid the robots, gather the pieces, scav the tools and food you need to survive, and escape the islands.

review: The game is fantasic, but with few flaws. The game's NPC robots are very difficult to hide from. when your clear of them they seem to know EXACTLY where you are, aswell as the hatchet not registering hits at times and some items such as throwing items used for distractions leading the robots to your position instead of where you threw it. Besides the games minor issues the game is only in Alpha and i'm enjoying it greatly. The suspense when your hiding in a bush and theres multiple robots all around you, it's suspenseful and just great! I would like to see the game grow and grow to see what great and funny features have to come.

Many people are upset that the houses are unexplorable, but its not really the type of game this is, plus if you have to rumage through houses to get your items, it would add HOURS on the total completion time because its already long enough. author: {'steamid': '76561198041324775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1532561774}
review:
A very interesting concept of a stealth / strategy first-person.  The maps are very detailed and robust; when you first start a "world" it is generated and saved, which can take a few minutes to build.  First impressions is it is a simple game but as it is a stealth / strategy game, a single game looks like it could take a very long time to complete if you stuck with stealth and assassination (~3-4 hours), or if you just want to tank and spank you can but there are no difficulty controls so you may die a lot and well, that also may take ~3-4 hours too!

The overall gameplay is also quite challenging in many senses - limited inventory so when you find an objective piece you usually won't have the space for it and have to decide to ditch items.  Easy enough, but, you also have to continue eating so that can be rough too.  There are two variables - Life and Vitality.  Eating restores Vitality, which decreases over time to 0.  Once at 0, then your Life begins to decrease over time to 0 in which you die.  This type of challenge is also what make this game very challenging even for simple concept.

Highly recommend and can't wait for it to be out of alpha release, but do know this is alpha - there are bugs and missing features.  For example I had t restart a few times in order to get resolution up to 1920x1080, when moving from one world to the other it locks up on the Loading Map screen and I have to CTRL+ALT+DEL to get out and start over.  No difficulty controls.  Small things like that and you will absolutely run into them, but considering the developer(s) are putting out patches every month and doing a great job (the best of any software development I've come across) with video updates, I can overlook this for now as an alpha and just restart the game.

Oh, and there are only two times you can save - when at the "recall" point, or when moving to another map, so be sure to save each and every time both for the alpha bugs but also well, you are almost guarantee to die a few times :)

Cheers.

review:
A tense fight for survival amongst the Dark Hedges of rural Victorian Britain, hounded by Gentrified Robots (the rotters!)
Stock up on tea, scavenge villages for fruit cake and marmalade (and if you're lucky, a shotgun). Sneak around collecting the pieces of your teleporter, but be wary, because Sir, You Are Being Hunted.

review: Terrifying and fun, Sir you are being hunted is a no holds barred steam blockbuster that'll keep you on your toes and keep you trying to outwit your foes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980593659', 'num_games_owned': 1493, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1386467438}
review: Hilarious and extremely frightening all at once. Certain mechanics are definitely still in their infancy, and because it is random, it is at times insanely difficult to find what you need, and at other times laughably easy. However, fighting the robots is purposefully NEVER easy, and as such, suspense-filled, heart-pounding stealth is the name of the game. The atmosphere is amazing. It's set to the ambience of a British countryside, jarringly cut with beeps, clanks, and bits of robotic dialogue and monologue, that at times will have you laughing, and at other times will have you covered in gooseflesh.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987968532', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1461370225}
review:
Even at the currently reduced price (50% off) it is difficult to recommend Sir, you are being hunted. I wish I could comment on the gameplay but sadly I gave up on the game after five minutes of play. Like many recent games that rely on the Unity engine 'Sir' runs slowly at all but the lowest graphical settings. Even on my I7 with 16GiB of RAM this game skipped frames galore. Shame, I have been looking forward to playing this game for a few months now.

Sir, can I have a refund please?

review:
Great game that gets better all the time.  The game is full of robots and their dogs hunting you down and occasionally stopping for a tea break to compare the human trophy heads they've taken. This is a great stealth game very enjoyable, with great scenery and even animals to hunt for food.

There's nothing better than creeping through the undergrowth ready to loot a prize, then running for your life as robots hunt you down.

I dare you to creep up on a bot and shoot it in the back!

Come dicevo un misto tra FPS e Stealth ma senza effetti speciali. E' come un buon libro, loro mettono lo strumento ma sar√† la vostra testa a creare suspense e divertimento

author: {'steamid': '76561198029852280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1649615125}
review:
Sir, I believe it would be ill-advised to attack that group of robots with nothing more than a hammer.

And believe me, that was very VERY il-advised.


SIR, YOU ARE BEING HUNTED.

It's a stealth survival game and a pretty decent one at that. You are a poor sod of a.. Erm.. Scientist ? Who very unfortunately gets telly-ported to an alternate dimension of sorts.. Or something along those lines, you know its really hard to hear what the narrator says in the intro. As i was saying.... The poor sod of a scientist gets telly-ported to an alternate (And very British) dimension. Where Robots of the tweed wearing kind, hunt silly humens for sport. And here is where the game starts.


GAMEPLAY:

The gameplay element rolls around stealth about 80% of the time, the remaining 20% are centered on collecting food and SOMETIMES, and i really press SOMETIMES. Attacking a hunting robot, or their dogs. (mangy mutts..)

The main objective is to find and collect the pieces of the experiment that our unfortunate science fellow was working on and transport them to a circle of standing stones... for... I dont know, to finish the game i quess.

But anyway collecting food and certain items to distract the robots are usually found in houses and shanties in the wilderness.  Rarely you will find a firearm, which makes fighting those tweed wearing, posh, pipe smoking metalheads alot easier. Unfortunately it also causes a lot of noise and usually alerts every single hunting-party on the whole bloody island...

Anyway for those, trigger-happy, no sense of self preservation types. This game is not for you, since you die. Very very VERY fast. 


GRAPHICS:

Not much to say really, i'm not the best person to evaluate the graphical-fidelity of something. But there were a few places where the graphics weren't quite up to snuff... But if you keep in mind that this is still in early access, that is rather easy to forgive. But not forever....


SOUND:

Ambient sounds, "Bleep-Bloop" Bots and the standart gunsounds. you really cant hear the robots coming easily, which caused me some cheap deaths... 

*Needs some work.


CONCLUSION:

Well, i'm not going to say that this is the best stealth-game ever. It has enough small quirks to prevent that.. However it has enough to merit a play, but yet again it beinng a stealth-survival game. It really does not sound that.. "Appetizing" to some.
 
So for those who love survival games, i could recommend this rather easily, although with the small issues within it. I could also recommend this for stealth fans, but rather carefully explaining it first...

A solid 7/10.

Its decent in what it does, but as always with everything in an early state, it doesn't do it perfectly.
But i still believe this has the material to come a good game, when it is fully ready.

Alpha Review: For being an alpha, Sir, You Are Being Hunted has a lot going for it and I believe should be supported. It‚Äôs unique enough to warrant a purchase from almost everyone. I want to give the game a higher score, but the melee was one of the things that I was looking forward to the most once I got my ax in the first play through and then to have my dreams dashed left a pretty sour taste in my mouth. I know it will be fixed, but as of right now it hasn‚Äôt. The game is still being worked on and I have a great feeling about how this game will be when it‚Äôs finished. I recommend picking this up at it‚Äôs full $20 price tag!

Full Impressions: TheVideogameBacklog.com

author: {'steamid': '76561197982246223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1476569202}
review:
Splinter Cell et Hit Man peuvent aller se rhabiller! Ici, le lapin, c'est vous!
De joyeux robots totalement d√©pourvus de la moindre √©motion vous traquent sans piti√©. Le but du jeu est avant tout de survivre, et accessoirement, de r√©cup√©rer des fragments d'une machine qui permetra de vous sauver.
De plus, vous commencez avec...
...Rien!
√† vous de vous d√©brouiller pour vous d√©gotter une arme et des munitions, de la bouffe, des pansements, des leures,...

La dur√©e de vie de ce jeu est quasi infinie, car les cartes sont g√©n√©r√©es au d√©but de la partie. Rien n'est fig√©. A chaque nouvelle partie, un nouveau d√©cor.

Il n'y a pas de mode "Facile"! Vous serez jet√©s dirrectement dans le grand bain!
Courrage! Fuyez!

"EDIT": Depuis la derni√®re upgrade, il est possible de choisir diff√©rentes classes, rendant plus facile la prise en main du jeu, dont certaines classes avec des armes dans l'inventaire. On peut √©galement choisir son genre, homme ou femme.

En r√©sum√©, un "must have" pour les fans du genre. √† consommer sans mod√©ration!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991712514', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1402179877}
review:
I was initially somewhat anxious about the art style in the game, as nothing in particular jumped out at me. I'm still not wild about the UI, as the flat graphics aren't incredibly appealing (It's still in beta, so take with recommended salt) but the overall visuals have completely won me over. The game immediately impresses both the haunting dread of being stalked and mercilessly hunted, but also a fantastic sense of the dark and drearily consuming English countryside. I can almost feel the wet, muddy chill of the air just sitting at my desk. 

The tone is perfect so far, and I am enjoying it greatly - though the anxiety it causes me may spell why I have so few hours under my belt as of yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028892967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1483594838}
review:
This is a really fun little game. I still haven't beaten it, but that may just be my playstyle; I tend to enjoy a local stout or too while being hunted. The updeates are very nice, and the new biomes really add a layer of depth and strategy to the game that some may have felt missing. The robots are fun, I particularly enjoy the scarecrow. The narrator is cake. The Britishisms and overall snarkiness of the game is my favorite aspect. 
It reminds me of the feeling I get when playing Day Z, running around, knowing someone is always watching you, looking for loot - suddenly shot at and running away like a little bitch with dirty britches. It's a lot of fun and I can't wait to see the full release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116497017', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 12519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5137, 'last_played': 1671358344}
review: You protagonist appears on creepy, gloomy randomly generated archipelago. You have to collect crystals avoiding, distracting or even fighting back enemies. This enemies are merciless robots, that  are always outnumbering you by quantity, gun power and speed. The only way to survive - to hide in foliage, scavenge for weapons and supplies, keeping your character well feed. In this game you are alone, only the voice of you butler sometimes gives you the part useful, part useless advises.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066310618', 'num_games_owned': 3184, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1387265721}
review: An amazing game of survival. Unique game where you have to survive and collect pieces to escape while being hunted by British robots. Travel through vast randomly generated British landscapes and drink tea and eat cookies to survive. (plus many more British foods/drinks) find items such as axe, guns or even an alarm clock or toy train to distract enemies.  Use foliage to hide from the seeking robots. it will keep you on the edge of  your seat. Unfortunately no co-op or multiplayer. 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970426099', 'num_games_owned': 1332, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1169, 'last_played': 1613341881}
review: very high learning curve.  I had to read the wiki entries on how to play the game as there are no instructions. I died a lot trying to survive.  Almost done with the first playthrough and I am getting the hang of it.  It's pretty fun sneaking up on robots and killing them.  Most of the time I end up alerting a pack of 10 robots somewhere and they come to kill me quickly.  Stay away from hot air balloons and scarecrows.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030789129', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1765, 'last_played': 1675943154}
review:
[b][This review was written in 2013 when the game was still in Early Acess!][/b]
___________________________________________________________

Sir, You're Being Hunted is my personal favourite Early Access.

For being fairly entertained by stealth-based games, and devoted admirer of the british culture and folklore (I also like to live dangerously), I couldn't ignore this title!

In [i]Sir, You're Being Hunted[/i], you find yourself teleported on a island after a mysterious experiment went wrong.
Your goal is to collect all the lost fragments of the device that had been scattered around a procedurally-generated archipelago made of 5 distinct islands with a different setting (countryside, forest...) But beware! As you progress, you become hunted by robots with high-hats and traditionnal tweeds. And they love to practice that noble sport that is manhunting. Being careful and methodical is required : the ennemies will grow in number, and they will become tougher as you gather the fragments.

Although it may still be an alpha version, the game in its current state provides more than a decent, enjoyable content so far; and there is even more to discover in the future (new island types, new robots, multiplayer...).

[i]Sir, You Are Being Hunted[/i] has a lot of potential, and already offers a difficult challenge. What a feeling when you beat the game!

Undoubtedly a must-have for all stealth lovers!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996667795', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1458425934}
review:
The best English Countryside simulator I have played to date.

Now that I've played this game, I have lost my desire to visit England and go wandering in the heath. (No, not because of the killer robots, silly -- that constant drizzle of rain is just depressing.)

I die a lot when I play this game. Usually because a robot shot me a second time while I was desprately rummaging through my inventory looking for something to stop the copious bleeding from the first gunshot wound.

You will spend a lot of your time in this game hiding in the long grass, desperately hoping the balloon robot won't find you.

Game offers gender options! Can be either a sir or madam that is being hunted.

Great game. Sometimes I play again. Then I bleed to death, alone on the windswept heath and have to go do something less depressing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034960672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1590206817}
review: Guys, play this game. It's really good. A nice indie game that has awesome atmosphere, pretty good gameplay, and some ridiculously foppish British robots. It's still in Alpha so there are some bugs but support it now and you wont regret it. It can only improve from here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037044572', 'num_games_owned': 854, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1686444146}
review:
An open world first person stealth survival game that shouts originality in times when big game companies force us into the mundane and overlooked genres. 
This game here can be what you want it to be: It can be scary if you play it fearing the Hunters, avoiding combat whenever possible, adrenaline-pumping if you want to reverse the roles, setting traps or going guns-blazing, but on each case, it is amazingly rewarding as you make out alive from the dangerous-filled islands. 
To this, add a randomly-generated archipelago, which is unique every time you start a new game,(and there is even the possibility of co-op multiplayer hinted on the game's Kickstarter page) and you have an indie gem with very high replayability, whose price of 20 bucks will put much full-priced games to shame.
I personally recommend this one to anyone that loves open-world games, especially Dayz.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042593522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1389857468}
review:
Sir, You Are Being Hunted is, in essence, a poor man's DayZ.
It's stealth mechanics are lacking some depth, and in general,
your objectives lack much meaning, you kind of just go to
where the game pushes you. I found myself sprinting past
enemies instead of sneaking around them with barely any
repercussions, simply running past their shots as if it were 
nothing.

This may be an issue with me or my attitude towards the game,
but this game isn't really a good example of an early access
release in that i have little to no reason to want to return to it.
The point of Early-Access is to create an atmosphere and a bit 
of hype for a game that would otherwise go un-noticed upon
release, but i found myself telling friends not to buy the game
as apposed to telling them to, or even describing its better
qaulities.


The way I see it, there are only two solutions.

1. Wait for the full release and see if it's any better.

Or

2. Buy DayZ instead...

author: {'steamid': '76561198091557847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1445978164}
review:
"Sir, You Are Being Hunted" is a game about survival. in it, you have been stranded in a set of five islands after a mechanical device you made malfunctioned and sent you there. Your goal is to survive long enough to gather all twenty-five of the pieces of that mechanical device, in the hopes that completing it will allow you to escape the islands.

Now, you might be thinking to yourself "You keep on hinting at some danger and survival elements in the game. What exactly is threatening your life and preventing you from just gathering all the parts or deciding instead to live out your life on the islands?" The answer to that question, simply put, is: British Robots.

No jokes, no puns, no witty humor (which is normal from me). I honestly mean British robots. Upon your arrival to the islands, the robot denizens will do their damnedest to search you out and kill you for sport. These guys mean business. They've got shotguns and rifles, as well as robotic dogs, hot air balloons with spotlights, and many other things at their disposal that they will use to get you and mount you as a trophy on their wall. You don't want that. Being a wall trophy sucks. Trust me.

This map is randomly generated each time, with resources distributed randomly throughout. There are food items (because yes, you do need to eat), distractions you can use, useful tools, and the occasional weapon that you will thank whatever you worship for. As you find more parts, the robots try harder and harder to end your puny organic existence. Have fun trying to survive. I know I have, and I completely recommend that you at least give this game a try to see if it's for you. I love it, and I hope you do to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042029441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1509130392}
review: Sir, if you are reading this, then you've seen the right recommendation for this game. It is a somewhat hard game if you end up in a world where the loot isnt as good, but that makes it great. Everyone loves a good challenge. The story, It's a little confusing. Apparently you were doing some experiment gone wrong and you ported into an archipelago with... robot hunters who are searching for you, trying to kill you. I got a little confused by this because it didn't explain much. Just how you got there and how to escape. I would have wished for more of a story, but this is an early access game so there are going to be more updates as time goes on. I definitely think this is a survival game worth getting!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968429887', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1430173097}
review:
A very British themed stealth-em -up where you are being hunted by twead-punk robots - Professor Ellemental and Mister B would love this.

Each game world is procedurally generated, so each time you start a new game from stratch the 5 island based world is different and you can choose which "biome" each island has as a basis for the generation.

It is in Early Access though (Nov 2013), so I'd wait until it is properly released while the loot tables, enemy AI and difficulty are tweaked as it could be quite different from as it is now. Its is good now and worth playing, but will change I reckon, so I'd hold out until it is finalised.

review: Even though this gmae is in its Alpha, I strongly recommend you buy and play this game. Sir reminds me a bit of Amnesia minus the primary horror and physics engne but with guns, a day night cycle, and the ability to acually be able to KILL things. That said, this is a game about stealth, and requires you have alot of patience, distraction devices, and anti robot gun bandages. Seriously though, play this thing, totally worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024873178', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 2834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2186, 'last_played': 1589043276}
review: This is the first early access game I ever purchased on Steam. Luckily it made it all the way through to release and has received much support as well as monthly patches to add more content and fix bugs. Made by an independent developer Big Robot it's a unique stealth/horror survival game set in the British countryside were you must scavenge for food and supplies whilst avoiding the red gaze of the tweed wearing robots carrying hunting rifles. Tea and biscuits anyone?

review: With Sir you are either afraid a robot is going to see you and start shooting or scavanging  houses for food  while starving  It is always intense and finding a weapon is rare, but if you do find one good luck finding ammo for it. In conclusion when you play this game you will be scared of bots hunting for in you in fields or forests or planning a scavinging with binoculars looking over a village.

review:
I can only barely force myself to play this game due to how stressful it is. But therein I think likes the simple brilliance of this title.

It may look somewhat cutesy on the surface, but the feeling of being constantly stalked and outnumbered is every present. Every sound, animation, location, it is a wonder to behold and enjoy. If this is in early release, I can't imagine how much better it may get with time.
I wholeheartedly reccomend this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970825610', 'num_games_owned': 800, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1382609027}
review:

And it's only in alpha!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048501492', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1434352051}
review: Sir is a very special kind of game. Stealth, survival, tweed wearing robots who never lose their manners even when trying to kill you. The game drops you into an archipealgo and leaves you to your own devices. Oh and the islands you dwell on are also home to hordes of shotgun wielding 19th century terminators. Sir is a good game, and a fresh new take on the survival genre. The gunplay is decent, nothing special but nothing particulary bad. The stealth system is almost too easy but still presents some challenge. The robots are amusing as they are terrifiying. The scavenging system is alright, and the cooking function is a good idea as well. The enemies are varied and intresting, and for such a simple engine as Unity, they are actually quite intelligent. Graphically the game is pretty bad, but I dont really care about graphics personlly. The game is pretty hard though. The game throws you absolutely no bones, and your lucky to find anything of real use while scavenging, so the name of the game is adapt or die. In the end im giving Sir a four out of five. It's nothing revelutionary or really any kind of breakthrough. But it does what it tries to do realitively well. If you like stealth and sruvival games, I would definetly give this a try. And do be careful sir, you are being hunted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047517186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1384590046}
review:
This game is very important. 
The protagonist, who you are in control of, is an exceptionally well-crafted piece manmanship that none other can compare. A true man who, in the face of adversity and robots with guns and annoying bleepbloop noises, never forgets his heritage. He is a gentleman. So he scrounges through peoples' houses to find hisself some tea and crampets, so he can shove them down his crumpethole like a true gentleman would. 
This determination to remain a gentlemansir even on a godforsaken island filled with angry native robots that say stupid vaguely aristocratic things to each other is an unparalleled look at the human condition at its very finest, the unbudging will to remain true to ourselves. I view this game as a psychological critique on mankind, and a well-made one at that. 
Marmalade aside, this game is bloody hard and I've eaten more bullets than I have consumed bottles of whiskey and sherry combined. And let me tell you, I've seen this guy's drunken stumbling many times already. True story, alcohol makes you high, yay for sir. 
This game, if I were to compare it to other games, is like pokemon. You creep around through tall grass, praying that nothing attacks you. When they do, you run away and hide to the best of your abilities, which isn't very impressive. 
Later you supposedly get weapons, but since I'm both a gentleman and really bad at this game, I haven't found any yet. Instead, I found some of the objectives. Device parts.
Device parts, when taken to the magical stonehenge in the middle of the island, will let you make a device that does something probably helpful like making you the winner. 

I rate this game a good game and I need to play it a lot because I need to feed my aristocratic commentary on humanity some more tuna cans and stuff. I will do what has to be done, and live up to his family name.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994243403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 805, 'last_played': 1617098773}
review:
This game is a First Person Fox Hunt Simulator, with the most dangerous game of all:

A live Human!

Once thought eradicated from the Archipelago, the wily creature will be sought out and taken down by only the most experienced of hunters!

Experience the thrill of seeking game by it's disturbance of Wildfowl, smouldering Bonfires it leaves behind, and even the salvaged tools of it's kind set in motion!

Those of you who have yet to have a head taxidermied, now is your chance to show your friends how far you've come! Hunt well, for even the Veterans will be mucking in to aquire what may be the very last Human as trophy!

What's that now? You ARE the Human in this game?
Oh, dear...

author: {'steamid': '76561197990264200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1444297755}
review:
While this game is still in a bit of a development stage, the core mechanics all work rather well. The stealth is a little buggy, in your favor however. Robots can stroll right up to you so long as your visiblity meter is low enough. Combat and evasion is difficult, but exciting, and the envorinments give off a very nice atmosphere. There's no quicksaving, and there's alot of parts for your escape machine to get, so if you're into sneaking around and fooling your pursuers, this is up your alley.

I'm also really looking forward to their multiplayer they'll impliment later down the road. I can only imagine how fun it'll be slithering around with friends in an attempt to pull one over on the calvery~ Til then, it's about as close as one can get in terms of a British Escape-the-evil-robots simulator as we can get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060306769', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1483640703}
review: This is a great Indie game to support and purchase; I feel as though other titles such as Rust, DayZ, and Nether are blocking this one out. While it is only singleplayer at the moment, you can spend many a good hours playing this, as I'm already on my second playthrough. It's got stealth, looting for items, firearm and melee combat, laying traps for enemies, deploying clever distractions to attract enemies, and vitality (hunger and thirst combined), among many other things. With every update more enemies are added, more items, more gameplay aspects, and sometimes more weapons. It's a great singleplayer game to buy when it's on sale - you'll have great fun with this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050537945', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1396294613}
review:
This game is unique, I really do like the concept. You're trapped and you need to find these 24 rocks seperated on five different islands, whilest being hunter by robots, blimbs and more! Survive and thrive, find guns, axes and food! Sneak your way around the terrain, hide in bushes and stalk your prey, on hide from your preditor!
I highly recommend this game, and even more so that's it's on offer.
If you're worried about download time, it doesn't take too long and this game (Hopefully) will be getting updated a lot! As we've seen from the "Pumkin update"

author: {'steamid': '76561198084203609', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 1, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1381605905}
review: Procedrually generated tweetpunk humorous survival horror?  You've got it!  Get stuck on an archepelago of ruined towns and hostile robots.  Seek supplies as you try and reassemble the teleportation device that stuck you there.  DO NOT expect to go in guns blazing because you will die.  Even in Alpha this is a promising game, and one that's definitely worth your time if the ideal appeals to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013757420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1403314821}
review: Sir (or Madame, yes there is a choice!), You Are Being Hunted is a magnifcent game. It's a tense game of cat mouse where factions of "tweedpunk" robot hunters scour the dreary British archipelago looking to hunt down, you start with only some basic healing items and bincoulers. You can find weapons by searching houses and sheds and even rubish bins. Although attempting to fight the robots should genreally be left as a final option as the fighting mechanics are purposefully left shanky, floaty and with high recoil as you play a scientest not a soldier and the robot hunters are a much better shot then you will likely find your self, outmanned, out gunned, and low on ammo. The game balances funny with suspense, the randomness of the archpealgo generation makes for reat fun as hiding in a wheat field less then a foot away from a hunting party holding my breath waiting for them t pass away far enough to make my move towards the town they had just departed from is one of the best moments I have felt in game in a long while. The game is not yet complete yet already gives so much that you definetly already call this a time sink. I can't wait to see what future updates Sir (or Madame), You Are Being Hunted will bring!
