author: {'steamid': '76561198077033293', 'num_games_owned': 740, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1169, 'last_played': 1413838417}
review:
This is a re-review of this game post-release. I don't usually write reviews of games, but I felt compelled to write this in response to some of the fair yet slightly misleading user reviews I see on the front page.

** THE PROBLEM WITH USER REVIEWS **

Firstly, I don't like steam's user review system. I have no idea how to fix it either. The problem is apparent with games like this, which have some legit criticisms from some gamers, but others would find it immensely enjoyable. The button that "upvotes" reviews is labelled "helpful", but I do believe that a bad review can be helpful without my holding the same opinion. On top of that, it seems that people with a lot of review "helpfuls" have a large group of friends or are in guilds, etc. I am not criticizing anyone...just a flawed system that might lead people away from a niche game that many would enjoy.

** GAMEPLAY **

In fiction, there is a thing called a trope. A trope is a often used device, such as a fallen hero or a damsel in distress. These things can be over used, and genre fiction has a habit of creating whole works based on them. The point of a trope is to use something people are comfortable with so that they can spend their efforts enjoying the important bits...like characterization, or sometimes a fresh look at an old trope. Tropes are a creators shorthand because wholly new things are dense and difficult. The greatest works of literature and film use tropes, some creating new tropes, so that they aren't over long and dull.

The gameplay in this game is the trope. It is resource management, fetch quests and stealth. While the game is not quite a survival horror game, it uses the same limitations for an effect that I will get into in the next section. There are games which expand what a game can do...some successful, some not. This is not one of those games, nor does it try to be. You will understand what is expected from you early on and you will be doing it a lot. I would like to point out that the combat in this game can be easy for some, but I would contend that this game is not about hammering through with a weapon and those people who do are missing the point.

** MOOD **

This is where this game shines. Back in the 1960's, some folks at a small British movie company decided to remake an old classic film, Dracula. By that time everyone had seen the original Bela Lugosi film, so really what is the point in remaking a film when everyone already knows the plot? The answer is mood. Hammer films are not gory in the way contemporary films are, they are not jump scary, they ooze creepy. There is something of the molester in Cristopher Lee's performance in Dracula: Prince of Darkness, something that is in the original text, but sadly missing in Bela Lugosi's self-indulgent performance. And yet, Hammer films always have a wit. It is a mood that had never been reproduced in gaming...until now.

I roleplay this game. What I mean is that it might be possible to manhandle the robots, but I refuse to try because I let the mood sink in. I am more quick to run from the dogs than wisely set a trap for them. Not because I am a bad gamer, but because I let myself get into the environment. In sucking at this game I heighten my enjoyment of it. Winning is not the point of a game like this, experiencing it is. Ultimately, Dracula gets a stake in the heart, the end. This could have happened on page one, but it didn't.

** STORY **

There isn't one, and thank god for that. I am so sick of game makers thinking they are novelists because they largely suck at it. With some exceptions, almost all being in the adventure game category (I hated Bioshock Infinite,) good stories in games are second rate rehashes of better novels or movies. If I want character development or a solid plot I will read a book. If you don't read books and need videogames to get some narrative, well then please don't breed.

That isn't to say there isn't a narrative. There is, but it is one that I felt I was creating myself. Gone are the overwrought cgi cutscenes. Gone are the "easter egg hunt" notes on why we are here. What you have is a series of islands, some evil robots, and an attempt at surviving impossible odds.

** CONCLUSION **

This game isn't for everyone. Anyone who reads the negative reviews should take them to heart. But I am aware that people will see the number of "helpfuls" and think that is a vindication of their opinion, rather than what it says...it is helpful. I greatly enjoyed this game for the mood and emotive character of the world and level design. I had no problem jumping through the fake hoops required to spend some time within. But fake hoops they are. If you want an original experience, a successful experiment, check this one out.

review: There is nothing quite like this "Tweedpunk" survival experience. It is a sandbox fps set in a very British setting. It is hard to categorize, because it can be both humorous and unnerving at the same time. Your goal is to gather the parts you need for escape while avoiding your victorian dressed robotic pursuers. I really dig what they are going for. The landscapes are very European and suck you in. Nothin like the gloom of the open fens. It is still in Alpha at the moment so it'll only get better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047880844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1401971682}
review:
OMG LMAO SO BRITISH XDDDDDDDDDDDDDD

It's a fetch quest, over and over and over and over and over and over. The AI isn't that good and easily cheesed, the landscape feels empty and boring, the loot is generic and repetitive. There isn't any real survival involved, just getting around robots and shooting those blocking important spots. That's it. And don't even get me started on the ' textures' in this game. Good lord.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029663440', 'num_games_owned': 846, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1399049977}
review:
This one is dedicated to Jonex.

"Sir, you are being hunted" is a game where a sir or madam(you have an option to change how the game adresses you right in the main menu) got stuck in a world/dimension full of robotic "Ye old hunting British" gentlemen that, as you could guess by now, are hunting you. You are given the mission to survive and find parts of a machine that will send you back home, which sadly are scattered across the entire arcipelago(5 Islands in total, which have different biomes by your choise).
Stealthing in this game really gives you a suspence feel, the damn beeping noises and sadistic laughs and comments that the robot chaps make gives a nice tension while you are trying to stealth the hell out of there. I can happily say that the AI is well done, I won't spoil much here, the the variety of enemies is well done and original.
You can loot various houses for food(you need to eat also in order to survive), traps, tools and if you are really lucky, you might find a gun, changing the ties of who is the hunter and who is being hunted. You can hunt small game and cook them to replendish your hunger, but houses seem a better source of food.

Overall is a nice game, give it a try will ya?

review:
There's lots of promise in this game. It is playable in its present state (August 2013) but clearly there is refinement to come.

I am generally not a fan of playing games in an early access state. I will withhold a proper recommendation until a later date. But as it stands, it‚Äôs interesting. I had no game crashes.

‚Ä¶I‚Äôm not convinced that it‚Äôs going to be *fun* though, or a game that makes me want to play it again after successfully completing it once. Looking forward to seeing how this game turns out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080061662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1621798947}
review:
You start off vulnerable as heck. All these robots in groups of 5 trying to kill you. Eventually you find a gun, or an axe, and kill one. Then you take his shotgun and you feel better about yourself. As in, you are less likely to die in the next 30 seconds at the hands of his 4 mates.

It's a really fun game. It isn't even finished yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076371572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2297, 'last_played': 1703976962}
review: This is a game you cannot help but fall in love with.  If you were one of those people where as a kid loved to play hide and go seek with your friends, then this is the perfect game for you.  It totally brings back that cold sweat excitement and heavy breathlessness you get while hiding and watching the seeker pass by.  This game boils over with nostalgia.  And as for the game play; it does take some patience, and you have to be in the right mood for it.  But the way the gun mechanics work, and the way the robots prance around tirelessly searching for you; it's all just so perfect. And... IT'S STEAM PUNK!!! (as you should be able to see) The moment I saw this game I just had to buy it.  I adore steam punk.  I ADORE THIS GAME!  If you haven't bought it, and you're like me, don't hesitate.  Get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990006052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1444369035}
review:
I was skeptical at first about the $20.00 price of a game in alpha but after watching both trailers I gave in and bought the game, After spending 3 hours with it I was surprised at how much the game pulls you into the world and makes you afraid to engage each patrol of machines, Never have I spent so much time crouched in a field waiting for the automatons to give up search for me and then sprint back a safe place only to be chased by another group and choosing to shoot back or run for the hills.

I highly recommend this to all survival game enthusiast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018499986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1397561874}
review:
HNNNNNNGGGGG. This game is a survival fps, a mix of STALKER and Don't Starve. The genre it self is already my GOTY. I am recommending this as of Aug 22, 2013. Its currently in alpha so don't say I didn't warn you.

You are a human. You are stuck in this dark/grim looking world with robots hunting you (you are an alien to them).  Your mission is to collect pieces of these magic rocks to power up this mechine that takes you back home. Along the way, you must stay alive and don't starve. You must search houses or robots you killed for supplies to stay alive till get back to the real world.

Gameplay: Its an FPS; find gun, shoot robots, don't starve, SURVIVE. You start out with nothing and you need to search for your 1st weapon. Weapons ranges from currently that I see in game are, axes, bear traps, revolver, 2 barrel shotty and a hunting rifle. Guns seems inaccurate so you do need to conserve ammo ALOT. Robots consists or dogs, normal huntsman in various cloths (seen in title art), fat town mayor guy and a flying ballonist spotter with floodlights that alarm nearby robots. To stay healthy you need to eat things, some things are bad for you like rotten food but you can cook some game. Currently you can't hunt game yourself so you have to find them in houses/robots and cook them at bonfire. Stealth is a BIG part of your survival. You are not a bullet sponge and you will be killed because currently it feels like the robots have aim/wall hacks. But you do regen health as long as you're not starving. Inventory management is also a big part of your survival. Its a tetris based bag and you have limited space where you can store things. You have to choose weather to pick up food vs ammo vs gun vs space to pick up those magic rock fragments to stay alive in the world. Also there is no storage chests so you have to be a hobo and scavage things or store them in nearby houses and hope you know where to refind it.

For comment on art style of this game just youtube, I can't really describe it to you. Its not realistic, its kind of a grim/dark cartoony thing but its VERY fitting to what they have going on.

Overall, I LOVE THE GAME and this can and will be my GOTY when it release. If you want to try it out BE WARNED: ITS IN ALPHA, updates will change gameplay. What I heard is dev is thinking about adding mulitplayer (so DayZ with robot as zombies with guns...HNNNNNNNNNNGGGG) and new content like trappers with traps that set up and wait for you to get caught and kill you.

TL;DR - FPS survival, great gameplay, my GOTY nomination, still in alpha so be warned. >If I didn't like it so much then why did I just write all this review? ITS A FUCKING GREAT GAME.  

Get out of here Stalker, you are being hunted...

author: {'steamid': '76561198052950161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 740, 'last_played': 1454206387}
review: As this game can be very fun it can be also very raging when a hunting party of seven walks into your path and kills you and you have to load your last save which was 30 minutes ago (what happend to me). A great  randomly generated world with towns, huts, houses, ruins, and much more that you can explore and loot . They also have different bioms like rural and mountain. Its a new randomly generated survival type game with a little scare added to it with you always thinking there could be somewon right behind you. I highly recommend this game for people who are looking for a survival game with a little twist to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984009151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1383504608}
review: I decided to give this a whirl today (Aug 19, 2013) since I thought the premise was marvelous. Currently SYABH is on build .3.xxxx, so VERY alpha. Despite this, I found myself REALLY enjoying myself. The developers already have a very compelling formula for fun, and I think as it's fleshed out we'll see a game that's easily as worth buying while mid-development as Kerbal Space Program and other good titles. There's definitely a lot there that's not finished - but what is finished was a hoot to play.
